Title: Performance Intelligence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join our dynamic team and become a part of a leading agency that works with major global brands. Our mission is to drive performance through innovative analysis and optimization. We offer a collaborative and innovative environment where your contributions can make a significant impact. This role focuses on supporting the performance of our work for clients through detailed analysis and optimization, reporting to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You will be responsible for identifying what influences the performance of our daily tasks for clients to drive optimization and deliver actionable insights and learnings. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you will work closely with client and agency stakeholders to develop and share actionable insights that lead to more effective work.

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Analyst, you will play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, preparing and presenting performance reports, and collaborating with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making and strategies. You will design and execute A/B tests, analyze the results to provide optimization recommendations, and support the development of learning agendas to drive best practices. Additionally, you will deliver actionable insights focused on content, audience, and channels in an easily understood format, providing clear direction for teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the insights to client service and other internal teams.
Assist in the creation and execution of performance experiments.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design and execute A/B tests to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Analyze the results of A/B tests and other experiments to provide optimization recommendations.


Who are you going to work with?

You will work closely with the Data and Analytics manager and be a bridge between the client and the technical team.

What do you bring to the table?

In this role, you bring a unique blend of analytical acumen and strategic insight, essential for supporting the performance of our client work. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

We are looking for talented individuals who have experience in:


Basic understanding of user experience principles.
Strong analytical skills and familiarity with data analysis tools.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Knowledge of data visualization tools and SQL (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent communication skills to effectively share insights with various teams.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and strategical thinking.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with open mind.
Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools.
Experience in setting up and analyzing A/B tests and other optimization experiments.
Previous experience in performance analysis or a similar role.
Experience in managing and analyzing large datasets and translating data into actionable insights


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization—creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers—who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.

For more information, please visit our website , and follow us on our social channels via Instagram and LinkedIn .

When you click "Submit Application" your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data when you apply for a role with us, how you can update your information, or have your information removed, please read our Privacy Policy . California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice .

When you click "Submit Application" your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data when you apply for a role with us, how you can update your information, or have your information removed, please read our Privacy Policy . California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice .

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who can set up Azure or AWS services in the cloud. The desire and skills to quickly learn new languages and services are essential. Experience within Azure / AWS, Data Factory, Databricks, PySpark, Python, and SQL is needed.

Are you our new Data Engineer?

Being a Data Engineer at Intellishore, you will get to shape and implement technology as well as business solutions to deliver value to our clients across different industries and business areas. We are not an industry-specific consultancy, so you should thrive in learning new industries and solving complex infrastructural problems. Two projects are rarely the same!

You will get the chance to immerse yourself in some of the most exciting technologies while gaining an in-depth understanding of specific business challenges as you engage with clients in close collaboration with your dedicated Intellishore project team. Because working at Intellishore means working together with people representing other competencies than yourself.

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore was founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical support. Today, we are more than 60 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; engineers, economists, marketers, and we even have a rhetorician (with a degree in economics, but still).

We are Intellishorians; a family, a unique collective of passionate professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.

What will be your key responsibilities?

Responsibilities

Intellishore is a cross-functional consultancy where you will represent the back-end area in the technical track. Here you will be responsible for (among other things):


Building value-creating and innovative solutions
Exploring new technologies and tools to enable the development of world-class solutions
Advising everyone from close project team collaborators to C-level executives on the best-fit solutions for their organization



And what specific capabilities are we looking for?

In regards to technology religion, we are what you call “agnostic,” meaning we act as an objective technology partner, only implementing tailored and best-fit solutions for our clients.

However, We Often Work With Microsoft, Qlik, Snowflake, Dbt, And AWS, So Experience With One Or More Of These Technologies Is a Prerequisite. We Also Realize That Few People Are Experts At Everything. But If You Can Nod Your Head At Some Of The Following Attributes, Then You Could Be The Person We Are Looking For


Proven track record and strong competencies with setting up Microsoft Azure or AWS services in the cloud, incl. experience within Data Factory, Databricks, PySpark, Python, and SQL.
Desire to quickly learn new and apply tools are essential – we need to constantly be on top of the best and most popular technologies on the market.
Call it agile, or just call it common sense. But we work in sprints, and we often use Azure DevOps to manage projects.
Energetic, passionate, and ambitious personality. With a drive to challenge the status quo within data & analytics.
Strong collaboration skills. You will work closely together with less technical people than yourself. You need to convince them that you know better.
Relevant academic background (Software development, IT, Economics). Or maybe you learned everything on your own. If that is the case, forget what we said about academic background.



Why work for Intellishore?

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging Consultant role in data-intensive and strategic client projects

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

A dynamic and entrepreneurial environment with kind & ambitious colleagues

3 | Courses & training

We will provide you with access to the necessary courses and certifications within the newest technologies (i.e., AWS & Azure)

4 | Strategic seminars

Annual Strategic Seminar where you get to socialize with your colleagues while building the company for the future (we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, and Iceland)

5 | Sustainable consulting

A sustainable consulting career with high levels of flexibility and a great and informal work environment

6 | Exciting growth journey

We are on a mission to redefine the world of data & analytics, and we are constantly expanding our team and scope

"Working at Intellishore, you get to build - not only best-practice technical solutions - but solutions that change the way people work and drive real value for companies."

Adam G. Andersen

Partner

Apply now

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the formula below. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to David Andreasen Lyngh: dly@intellishore.dk / +45 28 59 42 76

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside of the EU or the Nordics.

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore was founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical support. Today, we are more than 60 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; engineers, economists, marketers, and we even have a rhetorician (with a degree in economics, but still).

We are Intellishorians; a family, a unique collective of passionate professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
AddanEx JOB POSTING:

Title: Data Engineer

Location: Copenhagen, Denmark (Onsite 5 days/week)

Type: Contract

Start Date: 19th August / ASAP

Duration: 31/12/2024 + Extensions into 2025

Utilisation: 37 Hours per week

Languages: English




Job Summary / Key Skills

Support our business in the project framing phase or preliminary study for projects and provide workload estimations.
Design, code and test the data applications based on SQL script, SAS and UNIX.
Design, model and implement a functional and technical solution.
Support the data architecture in designing the data models.
Write technical specifications in relation to the functional specifications based on the requirements.
Ensure that we are working within the development standards in place, within a defined schedule, cost and quality.
Contribute in the deployment of applications in our production batch system.
Analyse the anomalies detected in production and provide corrective actions.
Monitoring of the applications in production.




If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply now with your updated CV in MS Word format to Applications@AddanEx.com

Title: Consumer Insights Consultant (Qualitative)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be part of an exciting journey, driving consumer centricity at the world’s largest jewellery brand? And are you passionate about working at the intersection of data, strategy, product and marketing to help give a voice to people’s loves? Then this might be the opportunity you are looking for!

Play an active role in driving consumer centricity at Pandora

The Global Consumer Insights team is run out of our headquarters in Copenhagen and is part of the Global Business Unit which sits within Pandora Global Marketing. The team is the voice of the consumers within the organization ensuring that we keep them at the heart of everything we do. It is a team with an ambitious agenda that plays a key role in the company’s growth strategy, all rooted in deep consumer understanding.

As a Consumer Insights Consultant, you will have the unique opportunity to contribute to and accelerate the growth of the entire business. Reporting to the Consumer Insights Manager, you will support building the future of Pandora’s upcoming initiatives in a consumer-centric way and ensure we continue our successful growth journey.

Key responsibilities:


Drive qualitative and ethnographic research projects independently or with the team to identify actionable insights that can impact various business functions (e.g., Global Business Unit, Comms, Retail, Brand Strategy, Design). This can include understanding specific purchase occasions, evaluating different campaign routes, early assessments of new product ideas or identifying our customers’ decision trees.
Independently manage (and assist the team in managing) all phases of the market research process for projects with a qualitative focus. This includes needs identification, project scoping and design, execution, analysis, and presentation of results.
Collaborate with commercial, innovation, design, and brand communication teams to incorporate insights into product and go-to-market concepts. Understand stakeholders’ business priorities and decision-making needs.
Support the framing of strategic and tactical insight topics.
Manage Pandora’s ongoing online consumer community, including identifying relevant topics, reporting, and analysis to drive consumer centricity in an agile way.
Support the social listening agenda, including identifying relevant topics, analyzing behavioral data, and reporting.
Develop relationships with external research vendors and moderators, interacting with them as needed.
Stay current with new market research techniques and implement innovative solutions.



Professional competencies:

We are looking for a talented individual with experience in qualitative research, a flair for numbers, and strong business acumen. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in consumer insights and a genuine passion for understanding people. They should thrive in a dynamic, changing, and fast-paced environment.

More specifically, you come with:


Minimum 2-5 years of professional experience in similar roles, either at the client side and/or agency side.
Excellent knowledge and experience in scoping and executing a variety of qualitative methodologies, such as ethnography, consumer communities, social listening, IDIs, and focus groups.
Proven track record of utilizing various quantitative and qualitative research methodologies and sources to create impactful insights with clarity.
Excellent proficiency in identifying patterns and crafting compelling narratives grounded in solid argumentation based on qualitative and quantitative data.
Strong project management skills, capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously from scoping to planning, execution, and reporting.
Excellent proficiency in English (both written and spoken), with strong presentation and communication skills. Able to create clear, insightful PowerPoint presentations, internal briefs, and reports.
Proficiency in MS Office, particularly Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.
International experience preferred.
University degree (BSc or MSc in Anthropology, Ethnography, Cognitive Psychology, Cognitive Sciences, or a related field is considered advantageous)



Personal competencies:


Self-motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit, capable of proactively managing daily tasks and independently completing complex projects within agreed-upon timelines.
Highly adaptable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, adept at managing multiple priorities and deadlines.
Curious about new opportunities and committed to generating insights with a continuous personal growth mindset.
A genuine team player, humble, honest, and trustworthy, with the ability to collaborate effectively across all organizational levels.



Additional Information

The role is in Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Travelling is highly dependent on the specific project, but 5-10 days of travel per year might be expected.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position. If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer required in Copenhagen (AI)




NDC Tek is currently supporting an exciting Mental Health organisation that is looking for a skilled Data Engineer for their team.




What you will be doing:




Migrate the existing data warehouse and BI-setup from a legacy / difficult-to-scale ​tech setup to a modern one with Snowflake as the foundation, dbt for data modelling, and PowerBI for visualizations.
Develop and deploy an AI-model to help management track key indicators and support running their residential facilities.




Your skills:




Snowflake / DBT
Data Modelling
PowerBi
SQL, Python




Please apply directly or email tmoraldo@ndctek.com




#dataengineer #snowflake #DBT #copenhagen

Title: Senior Data Analyst B2C
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description:


Location: Fully remote, EU timezone (CET +/- 2hours)
Start date: ASAP
Languages: English is mandatory; French is a plus
Our client: Cloud Computing / Distributed Systems / AI - European Saas



Objectives of this Role:


Analyze and interpret market and user data to drive business decisions and improve product offerings.
Develop and maintain robust data architecture for efficient data processing and analysis.
Present data insights in a clear, actionable manner to stakeholders across the company.
Understand and navigate the complexities of app marketing and related data restrictions.
Support product development and commercial objectives by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.



Responsibilities:


Design, implement, and manage backend data architecture to support analytics and reporting needs.
Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights about user behavior, product performance and growth roadmaps.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present data in an understandable and actionable way.
Collaborate with product, business, engineering and management teams to align data initiatives with company goals.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data science, nalytics, and B2C app marketing and educate stakeholders on best practices.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices in data handling.
Augment the company with relevant Ai toolings to grow and scale with data insights.



Skills and Qualifications:


8+ years of proven working experience in data science, analytics, or a related field in tech/ cloud/ software domain.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools like Mixpanel, Domo or similar.
Solid understanding of backend data architecture and database management.
Ability to interpret complex data and present it in a clear, concise manner.
Familiarity with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Excellent problem-framing, problem solving and project management skills.
Excellent communication skills with proficiency in English.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in the B2C app companies, particularly with user data analysis.
Commercial acumen and the ability to align data insights with business objectives.
Understanding of app marketing strategies and associated data restrictions.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their application in business contexts.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Fluency in AI-powered toolings to optimize productivity and efficiency.

Title: Car Pricing Data Analyst!
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hey there! At AUTOproff, we're all about shaking things up in the automotive world with our tech-savvy approach. We’re on the lookout for a new colleague to join our cool dynamic squad, based at our HQ in Vejle, Denmark, in this newly created position a Car Pricing Data Analyst!

If you've got a knack for crunching numbers and love diving into data, this might just be your thing. We need someone to help us analyze car pricing data and dish out some insights to keep our pricing game strong.

At AUTOproff, we're all about turning challenges into adventures! Our squads are meticulously organized into problem spaces, each dedicated to addressing real-life challenges. As a part of the Seller Problem Space squad, your role is pivotal in simplifying the vehicle selling process and empowering our clients to excel in sales. Join our dynamic squad, specializing in pricing trade-in and in-stock cars, where your expertise will make a tangible impact!

As our new Car Pricing Data Analyst at AUTOproff you will start up this new function within the AI team and own the area of building analytics for our Pricing Team. Secondarily provide auction and retail market insight on pricing and Risk Management.

Let's Dive Into Your Key Responsibilities, You Will


Dive deep into big piles of car pricing data to spot trends
Craft detailed reports, insightful analyses, and dynamic dashboards to monitor the vitality of our business, auction activities, and the retail markets
Pioneer the creation of innovative leading indicators to empower our Price Engines and Price Specialists in shaping cutting-edge pricing strategies
Stay ahead of potential risks through proactive risk management and deliver compelling reports that resonate with stakeholders


The Need-to-have Skills


A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent
Prior experience delving into data, particularly within the automotive market
Love to craft efficient and well-structured SQL queries
In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and fluent in English
In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.


The Nice-to-have Skills


Experience working with Python
Proficient working with Excel
Experience working with data lakes in S3


You will thrive in this role if you


Have a curious mindset and always want to get hands-on experience with the newest technologies
Are a team player, who loves to share their knowledge with colleagues and like-minded enthusiast
Can work independently and structure your tasks in an efficient way
Have a strong sense of ownership for the solutions you develop


If you think we could be a match, we can’t wait to hear from you. Hurry up and apply!

About AUTOproff

AUTOproff is a fully transparent digital B2B vehicle platform where professionals can seamlessly and securely sell and buy vehicles directly via AUTOproff’s online auction, with a unique range of integrated on-demand trading services (including on-site car appraisal, wholesale price guidance, guaranteed minimum pricing, secure escrow-based transactions/payment, car transportation etc.) or sell cars via AUTOproff’s fully managed, end-to-end selling service.

AUTOproff also provides C2B web solutions for dealerships, internal digital trading solutions for larger dealership groups and their ecosystems, as well as dedicated enterprise solutions for leasing, rental and insurance firms. More information on www.autoproff.com

We employ 100 enthusiastic professionals across our offices. In 2021, we posted revenues of more than DKK 750 million and we have been profitable since our inception.

In August 2022, AutoScout24, the leading specialized pan-European online car marketplace, acquired the majority stake in AUTOproff. The partnership supports a rapid expansion of AUTOproff’s solutions across Europe and enable the creation of Europe’s first fully integrated C2B-B2B-B2C used car trading solution. More information on www.autoscout24.de .

Hey there! At AUTOproff, we're all about shaking things up in the automotive world with our tech-savvy approach. We’re on the lookout for a new colleague to join our cool dynamic squad, based at our HQ in Vejle, Denmark, in this newly created position a Car Pricing Data Analyst!

If you've got a knack for crunching numbers and love diving into data, this might just be your thing. We need someone to help us analyze car pricing data and dish out some insights to keep our pricing game strong.

At AUTOproff, we're all about turning challenges into adventures! Our squads are meticulously organized into problem spaces, each dedicated to addressing real-life challenges. As a part of the Seller Problem Space squad, your role is pivotal in simplifying the vehicle selling process and empowering our clients to excel in sales. Join our dynamic squad, specializing in pricing trade-in and in-stock cars, where your expertise will make a tangible impact!

As our new Car Pricing Data Analyst at AUTOproff you will start up this new function within the AI team and own the area of building analytics for our Pricing Team. Secondarily provide auction and retail market insight on pricing and Risk Management.

Let's Dive Into Your Key Responsibilities, You Will

  • Dive deep into big piles of car pricing data to spot trends
  • Craft detailed reports, insightful analyses, and dynamic dashboards to monitor the vitality of our business, auction activities, and the retail markets
  • Pioneer the creation of innovative leading indicators to empower our Price Engines and Price Specialists in shaping cutting-edge pricing strategies
  • Stay ahead of potential risks through proactive risk management and deliver compelling reports that resonate with stakeholders

The Need-to-have Skills

  • A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent
  • Prior experience delving into data, particularly within the automotive market
  • Love to craft efficient and well-structured SQL queries
  • In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and fluent in English
  • In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.

The Nice-to-have Skills

  • Experience working with Python
  • Proficient working with Excel
  • Experience working with data lakes in S3

You will thrive in this role if you

  • Have a curious mindset and always want to get hands-on experience with the newest technologies
  • Are a team player, who loves to share their knowledge with colleagues and like-minded enthusiast
  • Can work independently and structure your tasks in an efficient way
  • Have a strong sense of ownership for the solutions you develop

If you think we could be a match, we can’t wait to hear from you. Hurry up and apply!

AUTOproff is a fully transparent digital B2B vehicle platform where professionals can seamlessly and securely sell and buy vehicles directly via AUTOproff’s online auction, with a unique range of integrated on-demand trading services (including on-site car appraisal, wholesale price guidance, guaranteed minimum pricing, secure escrow-based transactions/payment, car transportation etc.) or sell cars via AUTOproff’s fully managed, end-to-end selling service.

The partnership supports a rapid expansion of AUTOproff’s solutions across Europe and enable the creation of Europe’s first fully integrated C2B-B2B-B2C used car trading solution. More information on www.autoscout24.de .

Title: Consultant - Data & Process Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

We're Celonis, the global leading Process Mining software company and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us as Consultant.

The Role:

As a Consultant in our delivery organization, you are part of our agile project teams to accelerate our customers’ digital transformation and drive Celonis’ international expansion. To generate high-value use cases, you work closely with our customers. You perform data transformations, develop analyses and derive business cases. You develop data-driven process insights and actions. You implement the newest features and functionalities of the Celonis software, such as Process Automation, Task Mining and Machine Learning.

The work you’ll do:


Initiate:
Play a key role in the Celonis implementation project to ensure the optimal solution to tackle the customer’s pain points
Design innovative analyses and execution apps and enrich them with Machine Learning algorithms or Task Mining to make the customer’s processes transparent
Use our Celonis technology to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes, always in close collaboration with the customer

Implement:


Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies
Quantify the business and financial potential and present the findings to the management
Implement our Process Automation technology to speed up the customer’s processes, to drive value and to improve the process conformance rate


Adopt:


Implement the most relevant KPIs measuring the customer’s success
Ensure the enablement of the customer to continuously improve processes
Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen


The qualifications you need:


Min. 3 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement or a similar area
You are knowledgeable of data related languages (SQL required, other programming languages such as Python are a plus...)
Strong communication skills in Swedish/Danish and English and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining technology forward
Excellent analytical skills, well organised and known for being a quick learner
You search for a job with a steep learning curve in order to think outside the box and to continuously broaden your knowledge
Strong communication skills and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program


What Celonis can offer you:


The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


About Us

Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Financial Crime Prevention
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

About The Job

Do you want to work with management reporting and financial crime prevention in one? Saxo is an investments bank, with high speed, global colleagues and we are looking for a Data Analyst to work within the AML program management and reporting team.

The AML program is part of 1st Line of defense in Group Operations and located in Saxo’s headquarters in Hellerup. We are currently a team of four dedicated employees with diverse backgrounds and experience, and we are looking for new colleagues to join our program. The responsibility of the program team is to ensure progress on the Financial Crime Prevention globally across Saxo.

As our new Data Analyst, your primary focus will be to work closely with the reporting and data team to develop and implement multiple reporting solutions based on the right data. Furthermore, you will be responsible for supporting senior management and financial crime prevention leadership with data requests on different projects.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate should possess a balanced blend of business acumen and IT expertise. Saxo has a client-centric focus, which requires the candidate to comprehend data analysis and issues from a business standpoint. It is a requirement for this role to be able to collaborate with and communicate across departments and business units in the organization. The nature of the position is analyzing data stemming from financial crime prevention business units, so findings, scoping and collaboration of fixing issues will take place across the value chain.

Besides this, the candidate must be self-driven and interested in learning how the business works. Experience with data analysis itself and with other financial institutions is a plus, but the right attitude can go a long way if other elements are missing.

Your profile

You thrive in an environment with constant changes but have an eye for the details. You may have experience from the financial sector within financial crime prevention or are eager to expand your qualification in this area.

The Ideal Candidate For The Job


Understanding of how data is used within business processes and its impact on desired business process outcomes.
Experience with data analysis of big data sets using SQL, Power BI, and Excel.
Experience with Databricks would be an advantage.
Solid project management skills to guide point-in-time and ongoing targeted data quality projects. 
Comprehensive understanding of the importance and impact of data (or bad data) on the ability of the business to meet its own objectives. 
Facilitation and conflict resolution skills to assist in resolving the different points of view and requirements that invariably collide during cross-team and cross-organization efforts.
Have experience in presenting and reporting to senior management
Have good communications skills both verbally and in writing.
Masters English on a professional level


We conduct interviews on a continuous basis, so send your application sooner rather than later.

Interviews are expected to be held in August.

We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!
Show more

Title: Senior BI Consultant
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a passion for connecting business data with technology to drive global success?

We’re searching for a new colleague for our Business Intelligence (BI) team, who is responsible for defining and developing BI and analytics solutions across our Enterprise division at Jabra, a part of GN.

We connect business and technology and enable data-driven decision-making across the enterprise business to increase our global reach and help achieve our mission of making life sound better.

How you’ll contribute to the team

As our new BI Consultant at our HQ in Ballerup, Denmark, you will join 1 of 3 teams within the Global Data & Analytics umbrella. All 3 teams foster a collaborating, supporting and enthusiastic environment, creating a great team spirit – where we enjoy a good laugh as much as a discussion on the hottest topics in BI.

You will help set the structure our reporting landscape, help build the data models and front-end solutions to expose our wealth of internal and external data. You and your team will also bring valuable business insights to a range of decision-makers in the organization, ranging from the top-level management to our front-line employees.

To do this, you will collaborate with your colleagues across the organization to understand the needs for insights - and translate these needs, into BI solutions. More specifically, you will:


Develop automated BI reporting solutions in Power BI and star schema models using SQL.
Collaborate closely with IT for new data source, staging of data and governance.
Scope use cases, define target audience and purpose of reports as well as creating mock-ups to align expectations with stakeholders.
Define new data areas to develop and integrate into the analytics environment, the next level of analytics capabilities and new opportunities to mature advanced analytics solutions.


Sound good so far? Here’s what you’ll need to succeed:

You are a data professional with proven experience of engaging with many stakeholders. Your keen eye for structure, desire to make an impact, and your natural ability to collaborate, make you the ideal candidate for raising the bar for our global BI standards.

Moreover, we image that you:


Have solid experience with Power BI, SQL for analytics and star schema modeling.
Can consider and advocate for striking the right balance between supporting business needs and managing tech complexity.
Enjoy collaborating closely with non-technical business colleagues to find user-friendly solutions.


Fluent Written And Spoken English Skills

As an international organization with colleagues in over 50 different countries, our official company language is English. It’s essential that you can communicate effortlessly with your colleagues, no matter where they are.

The Jabra culture

The Jabra culture is upbeat and positive. We greet every day with energy and enthusiasm, bringing our best selves and approaching problem-solving and challenges with a ‘glass half full’ attitude. We’re independent, but we also know when two heads are better than one. Our leaders are supportive, our teams are tight-knit, and we believe in the power of collaboration across every level of our organization.

We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy, that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure success for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than July 31st 2024. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying – quick and easy.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Dennis Thomsen at dthomsen@jabra.com.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager upon accepting invitation to interview.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be part of an international team that drives technological innovation that saves lives and enhances patient care?

Do you want to gain the experience of being at the forefront of a digitalization tranformation journey?

Do you have a deepfounded passion in data engineering, cloud platforms and data management systems?

This could be your moment to shine. Apply today and embark on a career that keeps moving forward!

Local Role with Global Impact

In this role, you will be part of the Data and Analytics department at Ambu’s headquarters. Our team is uniquely international, with members from around the world, and engages with business stakeholders globally. We are on a transformative journey, establishing a new foundation of processes, ownership, and technology, with a major focus on developing a cutting-edge Data Platform in the Microsoft Azure cloud.

As a Data Engineer, you will be at the forefront of automating business processes through digitalization and playing a pivotal role in our strategic initiative to enhance data-driven decision-making across the company.

In a collaborative and agile environment, we value open communication and a team-oriented approach to solving complex challenges. For new team members, we look for the eagerness to learn and adapt, rather than having detailed knowledge of or experience with every technology.

Your Day-to-day Work Will Involve


Designing, developing, and managing scalable data pipelines and architectures.
Ensuring data integrity and security, complying with the latest standards in data governance.
Collaborating with various business stakeholders globally to support data-driven decisions and innovations.
Leveraging new technologies to enhance the efficiency and capabilities of our data systems.


Suggested Candidate Profile

Setting you up for success is one of our cornerstones. We imagine you have a robust educational background in computer science, data science, or a related field, coupled with substantial experience in data engineering. As a person, you should be proactive, keen to learn new skills, and enthusiastic about sharing your expertise.

Experience Or Knowledge In The Following Is Highly Relevant


Microsoft Azure and other cloud services
ETL tools and processes
Data modeling and warehousing
Python, SQL, and other relevant data management technologies
Strong command of English, both written and spoken, is crucial for this role.


Apply for a career #ForeverForward

The Talent Attraction team will engage with candidates on an ongoing basis, hence we encourage you to not hesitate, and rather apply!

Questions? Reach out to Aike Baars, Head of Strategic Data Systems at aaba@ambu.com.
Show more

In this role, you will be part of the Data and Analytics department at Ambu’s headquarters. Our team is uniquely international, with members from around the world, and engages with business stakeholders globally. We are on a transformative journey, establishing a new foundation of processes, ownership, and technology, with a major focus on developing a cutting-edge Data Platform in the Microsoft Azure cloud.

As a Data Engineer, you will be at the forefront of automating business processes through digitalization and playing a pivotal role in our strategic initiative to enhance data-driven decision-making across the company.

In a collaborative and agile environment, we value open communication and a team-oriented approach to solving complex challenges. For new team members, we look for the eagerness to learn and adapt, rather than having detailed knowledge of or experience with every technology.

Your Day-to-day Work Will Involve

  • Designing, developing, and managing scalable data pipelines and architectures.
  • Ensuring data integrity and security, complying with the latest standards in data governance.
  • Collaborating with various business stakeholders globally to support data-driven decisions and innovations.
  • Leveraging new technologies to enhance the efficiency and capabilities of our data systems.

Suggested Candidate Profile

Setting you up for success is one of our cornerstones. We imagine you have a robust educational background in computer science, data science, or a related field, coupled with substantial experience in data engineering. As a person, you should be proactive, keen to learn new skills, and enthusiastic about sharing your expertise.

Experience Or Knowledge In The Following Is Highly Relevant

  • Microsoft Azure and other cloud services
  • ETL tools and processes
  • Data modeling and warehousing
  • Python, SQL, and other relevant data management technologies
  • Strong command of English, both written and spoken, is crucial for this role.

Apply for a career #ForeverForward

The Talent Attraction team will engage with candidates on an ongoing basis, hence we encourage you to not hesitate, and rather apply!

Questions? Reach out to Aike Baars, Head of Strategic Data Systems at aaba@ambu.com.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.'




The job as Quantitative Analyst

As our new Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading and a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Minimum 2 years of experience from a similar role or top of your university class
Quantitative background in Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, etc.
Master machine learning and data-science fundamentals
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytic skills and an eye for detail
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best – we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day become partner
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This is an exciting time to become part of Tryg. With a strong focus on digitalization and data, our strategic ambition is to develop and improve our Data Transparency by offering a new and better solution across the Nordic. We are in search for a new colleague within the Data Team, to help develop the future Data Transparency solution. Would you like to be a part of the development?

About Us

As a part of the Tryg transformation journey Data Transparency is a crucial enabler for decision making. We are building end to end transparency of our system and application landscape where we are adding additional data layers to ensure the right perspectives and viewpoints to the organization.

You will become part of Business IT & Digitalization (BID), which today consists of approximately 700 dedicated employees, who support the current development of Tryg Group. The BID organization is Nordic, with majority of central functions placed in the headquarter in Ballerup.

The Data Team is a part of our Transformation Office, which today consists of 8 people that work close with other departments across the organization. The Data team is especially working close with the Enterprise Architects and Finance.

About The Role

The Transformation Office has the overall responsibility to drive the Transformation Tryg is undergoing, and as a part of this, ensuring Data Transparency is critical.

You will be a part of af team responsible for driving, defining and implementing the IT Data Transparency across Nordics.

We gather data from various systems, primarily through APIs, transform the data within our pipeline, and store it in SQL databases. Subsequently, the data is imported into Power BI, where we develop sophisticated and user-friendly reports.

As a Data Engineer you will be responsible for and ensure:


lead the backend development in Microsoft Azure
ensure the system integrations primarily through API
ensure data from different data sources into our pipeline and drive the initial data transformation in the new setup
drive the setup of our datamodel


About You

We imagine that you have work experience in a similar position. You have extensive understanding and experience in establishing database foundations with tables, keys, procedures etc. and have an eye for continuously optimizing on this throughput the transformation journey.

You enjoy translating requirements into a structured and comprehensible solution and be able to set the backend direction for the coming years.

You will be exposed to the following tech stack:


Power BI
SQL
Microsoft Azure (Synapse & Data Factory).
Phyton


Curious?

Send your application as soon as possible, but no later than 10th of August, as we’ll be conducting interviews continuously.

If you have any questions regarding the role, you are welcome to contact Director of Tech Transformation, Portfolio & Financial Management, Ema Ljubinac, at ema.ljubinac@tryg.dk .

job rekvisition ID: 26247

Vi er en del af Solsikkeprogrammet og opfordrer alle uanset kønsidentitet, alder, baggrund, handikap eller oprindelse til at søge stillingen. Vi er stolte af at have høj medarbejdertilfredshed, stærk faglighed og lige muligheder for at udvikle sin karriere i Tryg-koncernen. Tryg er Skandinaviens største skadesforsikringsselskab med aktiviteter i Danmark, Norge og Sverige. I Danmark består koncernen blandt andet af Tryg, Alka, TJM og Tryg Garanti. TryghedsGruppen er hovedejer af Tryg-koncernen og står bag TrygFonden. Sammen arbejder vi hver dag, på hver vores måde, for at gøre danskernes hverdag mere tryg. Se mere på www.tryg.dk

Title: Data Architect/Analyst (f/m/d)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Rethinking IT.

We have lots of ideas about how to successfully drive digitalization in companies. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, and clever tools for developers. What is your role in this? Move the world from behind the scenes with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Rethink IT and steer projects in completely new directions. Be bold when others would have given up. In short, play a key role in driving digitalization forward! We’ll provide the resources you need to do this. We also offer a variety of opportunities to get involved and to be part of a global network of IT experts and professionals. Welcome to our world!

We Make Real What Matters. This Is Your Role.

Vision:

As data is supposed to be the new oil, making tangible value out of data will make the difference and is what we are striving for.

Supporting the business in decision making and answering increasingly complex questions in ever shorter time or even real time is our aspiration.

Mission:

By combining a profound knowledge of finance and related end-2-end processes with deep technical know-how and a fresh thinking with respect to problem solving, we provide state of the art IT solutions, services and platforms for finance departments with a focus on reporting, analytics and planning.

Key Areas of Responsibility:


Support in the relaunch of a solution for group consolidation with a focus on the provision of an integrated data layer that enables a pass-through from consolidated data to unconsolidated ERP data
Permanent self-reliant optimization of data models (in the context of S/4 Group Reporting, SAP BW/4, S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Snowflake)
You envision, design and implement architectures and data models optimized for the integration of various, heterogenous data sources. You extend our service offering by business intelligence and reporting solutions to effectively deal with the new non-financial reporting requirements like the EU Taxonomy
Autonomously deliver/lead projects mainly in the context of an SAP BW/4 environment
Perform changes in alignment with BI colleagues and business stakeholders
Constantly provide innovations to improve or enhance analytics related solutions and service offering
Provide added value to data analytics initiatives / projects (migrations, predictive analytics, SAC, new projects)
Manage and coordinate external partners and communicate with various business stakeholders for the successful completion of projects and changes in existing solutions


Use Your Skills To Move The World Forward.


University degree in IT or Business Insights related field
Some years of experience in analytics and reporting (SAP BW, SAP BW/4, SAC, SAP ABAP, Snowflake, PowerBI)
Experience in an international group company and experience in SAP Group reporting are valued
Extensive experience in data warehousing, ETL processes and reporting (SAP AO, SAC)
Knowledge on HANA Studio (SQL/Java Script/CDS views), experience in cloud platforms, as well as any other BI tool are valued
Practical experience in collaborating with business stakeholders, experience within the area of Accounting / Controlling / Closing process is valued
Ability to learn and adapt to new environments / contexts / applications
Business Value and Customer focused, as well as goal-oriented professional with innovative thinking and attention to detail and a team player
Project Management experience in agile methodology
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and willingness to work in a multicultural team
Strong engineering/analytic skills and in leading BI projects and data expertise (modelling, analytics, prediction, simulation, AI/ML) and profound background in digitalization technologies is highly valued
Business fluent English


What we offer.


2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
Attractive remuneration package
Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
Find more benefits here


Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ - if you need further information on the application process.
Show more

Title: Data Insights Consultant
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Topsoe is a leading global provider of technology and solutions for the energy transition. We combat climate change by helping our customers and partners achieve their decarbonization and emission reduction goals.

Based on decades of scientific research and innovation, we offer world leading solutions for transforming renewable resources into fuels and chemicals for a sustainable world, and for efficient and low-carbon fuel production and clean air.

We were founded in 1940 and are headquartered in Denmark, with over 2,800 employees serving customers all around the globe. To learn more, visit www.topsoe.com.

Who We’re Looking For

Can you identify needs, build, and apply BI reports to support the business and for decision-making, or do you have an interest within this area? Do you like to work, and help colleagues from many different departments and cross functions? Then you might be the Data Consultant we are looking for!

Our team supports the business with tools and insights to make data-driven strategic and tactical improvements. We are a smaller team within the Business Finance organization with lots of ambitions, so there will be plenty of opportunity to make a difference and set the agenda together. Your role will be very diverse. One day you might be developing new insights reports, and the next day you will innovate existing analyses and reports – and discuss next-level solutions with stakeholders or managers.

Your Tasks Will Include


Identifying and designing value-adding insights solutions
Interpreting business requests and clarifying data requirements
Assisting and advising on data models and scoping of new BI projects
Collaborating with highly skilled colleagues including Data analysts, Application Specialists, Business Partners, and Managers to service our clients coherently
Promoting new insights/reports (descriptive and prescriptive).


Our primary tools - knowledge to the tools is not a requirement:


SAC (SAP Analytics Cloud)
Excel and SAP Analysis
Eclipse IDE (Eclipse Modeling Tools)
Power Point and Think-cell.


Experience or not?

The preferred candidate has some years of experience from similar jobs, e.g., Business Analyst, BI Consultant or Data Analyst in either other companies or consultancy firms. It is a plus but not a requirement to have consultancy experience.

The right candidate could also be a newly graduated and hold a master’s degree within Economics or Data Science or equivalent. If this is the case, together we will find the right balance between tasks and responsibilities to match your profile.

Why join us

There are many reasons to join us. To mention a few, you will get:


A job with a purpose: We are on a mission to solve the world’s climate crises. We are using our cutting-edge technology for a better world, and we are well underway on our vision to become a global driver in carbon emission reduction technologies in 2024
A platform to grow from: We have personal and professional development high on our agenda, and we will provide you with tools and tasks to make you learn and grow
We care about you: We believe in the strength derived from diversity, and we strive to build trust in- and collaborate with one-another.


How You Can Apply

If you would like to be part of a team of skilled and professional colleagues in an informal organization, please submit your application and resume in English and enclose a copy of your references through our website www.topsoe.com.

Please contact Nicholas Olsen-Stryhn, Head of Data Insights at +45 28409350 or NIOS@topsoe.com if you want to know more about the position.

Application deadline

August 11, 2024.

Title: Lead Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Redstone Commodity Search focus on offering 360° search solutions to the global commodities markets. With a competitive coverage of Trading Houses, Producers, Majors, Utilities, Merchants, Hedge Funds, Investment Banks and Brokerages; Redstone Commodity Search can confidently offer you an edge in today’s volatile market.




Redstone Commodity Search are working with an established Danish Commodities Trading House, in their search for a Lead Quantitative Researcher to join the growing Energy team.




Key Responsibilities / Tasks




Focus on EU power and Gas markets, seeking out new opportunities and trends.
Build models to power quantitative strategies.
Conduct research and statistical analysis.
Ensure compliance with regulations and reporting within the Energy Market.
Work with large data sets to predict and test statistical market patterns.
Role reports into the Director of Power Trading.




Key Qualifications / Experience




Having a broad understanding of international power and gas fundamentals.
Analytical mindset and strong ability to navigate the markets.
3+ years of relevant quantitative experience.
Master’s degree in finance, mathematics, economics, or a relevant field.
Strong attention to detail, and numerical accuracy.
Located in Denmark.

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Konsulent
Description:
Business Intelligence Konsulent med Fokus på Dataanalyse og Teknologi Søges til itm8 i Aarhus, København, Skovlunde & Odense

Er du passioneret omkring dataanalyse og business intelligence? Har du en solid teknisk baggrund og erfaring med at omdanne data til indsigt, der driver forretningsbeslutninger? Vi er på udkig efter en dygtig Business Intelligence Konsulent, der kan bringe avancerede dataanalysefærdigheder til vores team og hjælpe vores kunder med at navigere i datadrevne beslutningsprocesser.

Hvad tilbyder vi?


En nøglerolle i en organisation, hvor data og indsigt er i centrum for vores forretningsstrategi.
Muligheden for at arbejde med state-of-the-art teknologier inden for dataanalyse og business intelligence.
Et dynamisk arbejdsmiljø, hvor du kan påvirke og bidrage til virksomhedens vækst og succes.



Dine opgaver vil inkludere:


Udvikling og implementering af BI-løsninger, der understøtter kundens forretningsmål.
Arbejde med PowerBi, T-SQL, stored procedures og ETL-processer for at extracte, transformere og indlæse data.
Anvende Microsoft-teknologier som SQL Server, Data Factory, Azure SQL, Azure Data Lakes, Azure Synapse og udforske nye teknologier som Fabric.



Ideel kandidat:


Har en stærk baggrund som konsulent i dataanalyse og business intelligence med over 5 års erfaring.
Er teknisk dygtig med erfaring i PowerBi, SQL, Python, og Microsofts cloud-teknologier.
Er kundeminded, en god kollega, nysgerrig og altid på udkig efter at lære om nye teknologier, især inden for AI og data science.
Arbejdssted på Aarhus kontoret hvor resten af teamet sidder, men det er ikke et ultimativt krav. Det er også muligt at arbejde fra vores kontorer i København Ø, Skovlunde eller Odense.



Om itm8:

itm8 er en innovativ IT-partner, der specialiserer sig i at levere løsninger, der transformerer og optimerer vores kunders forretningsprocesser gennem intelligent brug af data. Vi værdsætter et miljø, hvor samarbejde, innovation og teknologisk ekspertise er nøglen til vores fælles succes.

Skal du med på holdet?

Er du klar til at tage skridtet og blive en del af vores team? Send dit CV og en kort motiverende ansøgning til os. Vi ser frem til at integrere dine færdigheder og passion i vores virksomhed!

Kontakt:

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, så kontakt Andreas Hvejsel Andersen på mail anhan@itm8.com. Vi afholder løbende samtaler og ansætter, når vi finder den rette kandidat. Vi indhenter straffeattest før ansættelse.

Title: Business Intelligence Konsulent
Description:
Vil du være en del af et stærkt fagligt fællesskab af Data & Analytics kyndige konsulenter og projektledere? Og ønsker du at videreudvikle dig indenfor den nyeste teknologi og arbejde med nogle af Danmarks førende virksomheder?

Så er Fellowmind en oplagt mulighed for det næste skridt i din karriere!

Hos Fellowmind søger vi konsulenter til vores Data & Analytics Team. I Data & Analytics arbejder vi passioneret med hele Microsoft stacken for at skabe de bedste Business Intelligence oplevelser for vores kunder. Vi arbejder sammen både i huset og i teamet – og vil gerne have dig med.

Du skal have lyst til at:


Inspirere og vise mulighederne ved brug af data og Business Intelligence.
Sikre, at vores kunder får det maksimale ud af deres løsninger.
Skabe forandring og tage ejerskab for dette.
Sætte dit eget præg på vores Best Practice.



Om teamet

I vores team synes vi vitterligt, at konceptet BI er det bedste, der er sket i forretningsverden, siden man begyndte at gemme og indsamle data. Vi fokuserer på høj faglighed, innovative løsninger og i særdeleshed kundetilfredshed, og vi ønsker at vækste teamet med profiler, der kan være med til at sætte Fellowminds Data & Analytics team på landkortet.

Teamet dækker bredt, og vores erfaring og kompetencer spænder lige fra behovsanalyse, kildeintegration over ETL og data warehousing, til front-end design og implementering.

Om dit kommende job

Som Business Intelligence Konsulent kommer du til at indgå i Data & Analytics teamet. Du vil lige fra starten få direkte kundekontakt og vil ofte indgå i hele projektforløbet fra salg til implementering.

Fellowmind er eksperter indenfor Microsoft-teknologi, og du kan derfor forvente, at projekterne baseres helt eller delvist på Microsofts BI suite. Du vil som konsulent inden for Business Intelligence oftest arbejde med den nyeste teknologi, og det vil være positivt, hvis du, sideløbende og i samspil med kundeprojekter, afprøver og udfordrer nye teknologier og tiltag.

Du får en unik mulighed for at fokusere på at udvikle og implementere BI-løsninger i samspil med vores mange dygtige specialister og forretningskonsulenter indenfor bl.a. Dynamics 365, Office 365, SharePoint og PPM.

Om dine faglige kompetencer

Vi forestiller os, at du kommer fra en stilling som BI Konsulent eller som Intern BI Konsulent, men der kan være flere indgange til stillingen.

Alt afhængig af dit erfaringsniveau, har du formentlig gennemført flere data warehouse- og BI-projekter med succes. Det er en fordel, hvis du har indsigt i områder som projektledelse, lager- & ressourcestyring, økonomi, produktion, m.m., og det er ligeledes en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med datakilder som Microsoft Dynamics 365 (CRM, AX), Nav, SAP eller andre kilder med økonomi, løn, tidsregistrerings- eller sags- og dokumentstyringsdata. Vi ser desuden gerne, at du mestrer Power BI og Tabular data modellering eller har interesse i at lære dette.

Vi forventer, at du har kendskab til og erfaring med størstedelen af følgende:

Teknologiske platforme


Microsoft SQL Server
Azure Data Platform
Azure Synapse og / eller Azure Data Factory
Microsoft Fabric
Tabular data modellering
Power BI
ETL / ELT
Formidling af tekniske emner til mindre tech-kyndige personer



Om dine personlige kompetencer

Vi ser gerne, at du:


er samarbejdsvillig, imødekommende, initiativrig
er god til at netværke både internt såvel som eksternt
ikke er bange for at gå forrest i opgaveløsningen
har fokus på at levere kvalitet og opfylde kundens forventninger indenfor budget
stiller høje krav til dig selv, og ikke er bange for at forvente det samme af dine omgivelser
er nysgerrig på andre teknologier og forretningsområder og hvordan en samlet Microsoft platform kan hjælpe med at skabe mere heltænkte løsninger.
Derudover er gode danskkundskaber en forudsætning for denne stilling.



Såfremt du har nogle spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Rekrutteringskonsulent Cecilie Olsen på +45 3028 9967 eller Manager, Jane Bøjer for en uforpligtende snak på hendes telefon +45 4130 4274




Show more

  • Microsoft Fabric
  • Tabular data modellering
  • Power BI
  • ETL / ELT
  • Formidling af tekniske emner til mindre tech-kyndige personer
