  • er samarbejdsvillig, imødekommende, initiativrig
  • er god til at netværke både internt såvel som eksternt
  • ikke er bange for at gå forrest i opgaveløsningen
  • har fokus på at levere kvalitet og opfylde kundens forventninger indenfor budget
  • stiller høje krav til dig selv, og ikke er bange for at forvente det samme af dine omgivelser
  • er nysgerrig på andre teknologier og forretningsområder og hvordan en samlet Microsoft platform kan hjælpe med at skabe mere heltænkte løsninger.
  • Derudover er gode danskkundskaber en forudsætning for denne stilling.


Såfremt du har nogle spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Rekrutteringskonsulent Cecilie Olsen på +45 3028 9967 eller Manager, Jane Bøjer for en uforpligtende snak på hendes telefon +45 4130 4274

Title: VIE - Sustainable Digital Data Analyst - Denmark (Ballerup)
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Why Schneider Electric (SE)?

Join us, be part of creating a sustainable future with Schneider Electric's energy and digital solutions!

We empower everyone to make the most of our energy and resources, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. Along the way, we create and provide equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere. We continuously create an inclusive environment and welcome people from all walks of life. We are empowered to do our best and innovate, while living our unique life and work. Together, we dare to disrupt and turn our bold ideas into reality.

Where is the VIE Position ?

The position is located in Ballerup, Denmark, in international dynamic team.

What is the Position?

Drive Sustainable Transformation for Global Supply Chain to support Schneider Electric's Sustainability Goals. You will have the opportunity to work on a wide scope coverage in sustainability, great exposure in global team.

Which missions will you lead?

Responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data to identify patterns, trends, and relationships. This information is to make informed decisions and recommendations for improvement in various sustainability transformations. It includes but not limited to:

Be the owner of the Global Supply Chain Sustainability Data. The global Sustainable Cockpit is a digital platform that provides an overview of all GSC Sustainable Transformations through data visualization. As the owner of the Global Supply Chain Sustainability Data, the candidate will own the Sustainable Cockpit Platform, partnering with all the transformation program leaders, to make sure it’s running stably and continuously improving based on program needs. This platform serves as a unique tool to inform all regions, functions and global teams on the Sustainable performance and trends and provides access to all layers of the organization. As the owner of the Global Sustainable Cockpit it is expected to play a crucial role which includes:


Strong data analytics skills and be able to interpret data accurately and make informed decisions based on the findings,
Have a good sense of data visualization and appealing charts to communicate complex data concisely,
Be familiar with various analytics tools and software, such as Excel, Tableau, Power BI, and Google Analytics, to analyze and present data efficiently.
Data Acquisition: Data analytics often need to acquire data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, and external data providers. Need to be able to understand data structures and formats to ensure accurate and complete data collection.
Problem-solving and be able to think critically to identify issues and develop solutions.
Be able to work independently or as part of a team to achieve common goals.
Be able to communicate efficiently with developers, transformation program leaders and users across regions,
Be able to program manage complex and multiple workstreams efficiently and in high quality
Continuous Learning: Data analysis is an evolving field, and data analysts should be willing to learn new skills and adapt to changes in technology and methodologies.


Be able to increase efficiency and accuracy of Sustainable Data consolidation and reporting from other platforms such as LEAP, GlobES, Sightness etc. Be able to partner with other functions and data base owners to increase sustainable data quality and governance. Be able to provide data and analytics support for Management Report and during Quarterly Business Reviews, Annual Report and other performance reviews.

Support Sustainable Performance Gap Analysis and Decision making process in order to accelerate our transformations, be able to detect possible delays or issues at early stage to propose an improvement plan.

What are the qualifications we are looking for?

Education: Environmental engineer, sustainable development, environmental science

Work experience : 2 internships with experiences already is preferable

Skills:


English Fluent
Microsoft powerpoint, excel, word
Self-motivated
Strong ownership
Good communication
Strategic thinking


What's in it for me?


Opportunity to get international experience abroad
To improve your English
To work in multicultural and inclusive environment
Interesting remuneration, social coverage, accommodation
Opportunity to get a permanent position in the end of your mission


Let us learn about you! Apply today.

Why us?

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

€25.7bn global revenue

137 000+ employees in 100+ countries

45% of revenue from IoT

5% of revenue devoted for R&D

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Abacus Medicine is searching for a driven Data Engineer to join the Data Engineering team where you will play a pivotal role in building scalable and robust data solutions. Utilize your skills in Python, Apache Spark, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Data/Delta Lake, along with other cutting-edge technologies. We don’t think it is mandatory to have experience with all tools, instead, we prioritize your eagerness to learn and grow within this role, as well as passion for the field of data engineering. Join us in driving our Data Engineering vision and explore the vast possibilities of a modern data tech-stack!




Your responsibilities as a Data Engineer:

Design, develop, maintain and optimize data pipelines that perform data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes from various sources, ensuring data quality and efficiency.
Work on projects in the field of data engineering that directly impact our data-driven initiatives. Relating to data integration solutions, data quality, storage optimization, upgrading our architecture, and more.
Stay up to date with emerging data engineering trends and technologies to further develop our modern data cloud platform.
Leveraging our scalable monitoring tool and cutting-edge data observability platform to monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, identifying and resolving issues proactively and build solutions with the aim of reducing time to detection and time to resolution.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and other data professionals and stakeholders throughout the business to gather requirements and design robust data solutions, merging the expertise from different domains to find the best solution for each data challenge.
Optimize big data storage and data retrieval processes.




The Tech-Stack

Some of the technologies and tools you will be working with are:

Azure Databricks
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data/Delta Lake
Python
PySpark
SQL
Azure DevOps
Monte Carlo, Data Observability Platform
Git
And more!




Are you the right candidate?

As a Data Engineer, you will play a vital role in our data infrastructure team, supporting the development, maintenance, and optimization of our data pipelines and platform. You will work closely with a talented group of data professionals, ranging from BI developers and data analysts to data scientists, gaining hands-on experience in data engineering best practices and cutting-edge technologies.

To succeed in the job, it is important that you are passionate, possess technical skills, and have a genuine interest in working with new cloud technologies. Your motivation to deliver high-quality data services, which serve as a foundation for impactful decision-making and advanced analytics across the organization, will be crucial to your success. You thrive in a dynamic and ambitious team environment and approach problem-solving with a creative mindset.

In Data & Analytics, we promote continuous learning and development and help our data engineers to expand their expertise and knowledge in various domains.




Qualifications and skills:

A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python programming.
Familiarity in working with source control such as git.
Basic knowledge of SQL.
Experience in data manipulation, data wrangling, and data cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity.
Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
Proactive mindset with a continuous learning approach to keep up with evolving technologies in the data engineering field.
Good oral and written communication skills in English.




It is an advantage (but not a requirement) if you have knowledge or experience with:

Cloud platforms, such as Azure, AWS or GCP.
Azure Data/Delta Lake for efficient storage and processing of big data.
Apache Spark and Databricks for data processing and analytics.
Experience with PySpark.
Experience with Azure Data Factory, or familiarity with other similar data integration and orchestration tools.
Data governance and data modelling best practices
Understanding of CI/CD practices.

Join our team and be part of an exciting journey to unlock the power of data!




Your future colleagues

In the D&A department, we are responsible for developing and maintaining Abacus' datahub, as well as implementing our BI platform, facilitating data-driven projects, and developing advanced analytics models (ML). The team comprises 3 Data Scientists, 5 BI developers, 2 Data Analysts, and 4 Data Engineers, along with 3 team leads overseeing different areas of expertise.




Our team consists of individuals from diverse nationalities, expertise areas, educational backgrounds, and ownership responsibilities across our data platforms and services. This diversity creates a strong environment for collaboration, technical synergies, and support among units, all while maintaining a positive and motivating work environment.




In summary, our goal is to create innovative data-driven solutions for core business problems within a friendly and professional work setting.




Have we caught your interest?

If you wish to apply for the position, please use the apply link and attach your resumé, cover letter and grade transcript. We do not accept applications by email.

Last application day is August 31st. Interviews will be conducted throughout the application period. The position is to be filled as soon as possible, and we process applications continuously.




If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Mariana Alves Monteiro, Team Lead for Data Engineering at mariana.monteiro@abacusmedicine.com.




We look forward to receiving your application!




Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn, to get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For other job openings, check out our Career page.




Better Access. Better Healthcare.

At Abacus Medicine, our purpose is to improve global healthcare through better access to medicine. This has driven us to quickly become a global player in the parallel import industry and pharmaceutical services while not losing sight of our entrepreneurial mindset. Our company values; Innovative, Dedicated, and Caring, lead us on our way to continuously look for improvement and further ways to achieve our purpose. Join our 1,200 dedicated colleagues with more than 32 different nationalities in e.g. Denmark, Hungary, Germany, the Netherlands, the UK, Austria and Hong Kong.

Show more
HTML:
Abacus Medicine is searching for a driven Data Engineer to join the Data Engineering team where you will play a pivotal role in building scalable and robust data solutions. Utilize your skills in Python, Apache Spark, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Data/Delta Lake, along with other cutting-edge technologies. We don’t think it is mandatory to have experience with all tools, instead, we prioritize your eagerness to learn and grow within this role, as well as passion for the field of data engineering. Join us in driving our Data Engineering vision and explore the vast possibilities of a modern data tech-stack!


Your responsibilities as a Data Engineer:

  • Design, develop, maintain and optimize data pipelines that perform data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes from various sources, ensuring data quality and efficiency.
  • Work on projects in the field of data engineering that directly impact our data-driven initiatives. Relating to data integration solutions, data quality, storage optimization, upgrading our architecture, and more.
  • Stay up to date with emerging data engineering trends and technologies to further develop our modern data cloud platform.
  • Leveraging our scalable monitoring tool and cutting-edge data observability platform to monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, identifying and resolving issues proactively and build solutions with the aim of reducing time to detection and time to resolution.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams and other data professionals and stakeholders throughout the business to gather requirements and design robust data solutions, merging the expertise from different domains to find the best solution for each data challenge.
  • Optimize big data storage and data retrieval processes.


The Tech-Stack

Some of the technologies and tools you will be working with are:

  • Azure Databricks
  • Azure Data Factory
  • Azure Data/Delta Lake
  • Python
  • PySpark
  • SQL
  • Azure DevOps
  • Monte Carlo, Data Observability Platform
  • Git
  • And more!


Are you the right candidate?

As a Data Engineer, you will play a vital role in our data infrastructure team, supporting the development, maintenance, and optimization of our data pipelines and platform. You will work closely with a talented group of data professionals, ranging from BI developers and data analysts to data scientists, gaining hands-on experience in data engineering best practices and cutting-edge technologies.

To succeed in the job, it is important that you are passionate, possess technical skills, and have a genuine interest in working with new cloud technologies. Your motivation to deliver high-quality data services, which serve as a foundation for impactful decision-making and advanced analytics across the organization, will be crucial to your success. You thrive in a dynamic and ambitious team environment and approach problem-solving with a creative mindset.

In Data & Analytics, we promote continuous learning and development and help our data engineers to expand their expertise and knowledge in various domains.


Qualifications and skills:

  • A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in Python programming.
  • Familiarity in working with source control such as git.
  • Basic knowledge of SQL.
  • Experience in data manipulation, data wrangling, and data cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
  • Proactive mindset with a continuous learning approach to keep up with evolving technologies in the data engineering field.
  • Good oral and written communication skills in English.


It is an advantage (but not a requirement) if you have knowledge or experience with:

  • Cloud platforms, such as Azure, AWS or GCP.
  • Azure Data/Delta Lake for efficient storage and processing of big data.
  • Apache Spark and Databricks for data processing and analytics.
  • Experience with PySpark.
  • Experience with Azure Data Factory, or familiarity with other similar data integration and orchestration tools.
  • Data governance and data modelling best practices
  • Understanding of CI/CD practices.

Join our team and be part of an exciting journey to unlock the power of data!


Your future colleagues

In the D&A department, we are responsible for developing and maintaining Abacus' datahub, as well as implementing our BI platform, facilitating data-driven projects, and developing advanced analytics models (ML). The team comprises 3 Data Scientists, 5 BI developers, 2 Data Analysts, and 4 Data Engineers, along with 3 team leads overseeing different areas of expertise.


Our team consists of individuals from diverse nationalities, expertise areas, educational backgrounds, and ownership responsibilities across our data platforms and services. This diversity creates a strong environment for collaboration, technical synergies, and support among units, all while maintaining a positive and motivating work environment.


In summary, our goal is to create innovative data-driven solutions for core business problems within a friendly and professional work setting.


Have we caught your interest?

If you wish to apply for the position, please use the apply link and attach your resumé, cover letter and grade transcript. We do not accept applications by email.

Last application day is August 31st. Interviews will be conducted throughout the application period. The position is to be filled as soon as possible, and we process applications continuously.


If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Mariana Alves Monteiro, Team Lead for Data Engineering at mariana.monteiro@abacusmedicine.com.


We look forward to receiving your application!


Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn, to get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For other job openings, check out our Career page.


Better Access. Better Healthcare.

At Abacus Medicine, our purpose is to improve global healthcare through better access to medicine. This has driven us to quickly become a global player in the parallel import industry and pharmaceutical services while not losing sight of our entrepreneurial mindset. Our company values; Innovative, Dedicated, and Caring, lead us on our way to continuously look for improvement and further ways to achieve our purpose. Join our 1,200 dedicated colleagues with more than 32 different nationalities in e.g. Denmark, Hungary, Germany, the Netherlands, the UK, Austria and Hong Kong.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Brænder du for data og Business Intelligence (BI), så har vi et spændende og udfordrende job, hvor du får mulighed for at sætte dit aftryk på BI-området til den europæiske medieindustri.




Som Business Intelligence Specialist er du en aktiv medspiller i opsætning, indsamling, og udforskning af data på baggrund af dataplatformen Google Analytics. Du bliver en vigtig person for data know-how og dataindsigt, både internt og eksternt. Du vil komme til at arbejde med vigtige kundeprojekter sammen med dygtige kolleger, som alle er opsatte på at bringe en øget værdi til Vitec Visiolinks platform.




Stillingen

Hos Vitec Visiolink vil du få arbejde med etablerede systemer, som Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, og Looker Studio. Derudover vil der være rig mulighed for selv at være med til at definere din rolle fremadrettet.




Arbejdsopgaver:

Opsætning af tracking-integrationer primært baseret på Google Analytics
Udarbejdelse af dashboards og rapporter, samt præsentation af disse
Udarbejdelse af ad hoc analyser i Excel eller vha. Python eller R
Assistere med scoping og udførelse af tracking-relaterede projekter
Deltage i kundemøder for at formidle og forstå ønsker og behov
Udarbejdelse af dokumentation og guider til internt og eksternt brug




Din baggrund

Som person har du dit fokus og dine interesser inden for analyser samt formidling af data. Du er nysgerrig og resultatorienteret, og du brænder samtidig for at føre teoretisk forståelse ud i en praktisk og anvendelsesorienteret virkelighed. Ellers forventer vi følgende kompetencer:

Erfaring med visualisering af data (gerne Looker Studio)
Erfaring med Google Analytics, Firebase og Google Tag Manager
Erfaring med stakeholder management og formidling af kundebehov
Kendskab til R eller Python er et plus
Selvstændig og initiativtager
Flydende dansk og engelsk. Tysk er også et plus




Vi tilbyder

En spændende stilling på en arbejdsplads, der servicerer den europæiske medieindustri. Vitec Visolink leverer publikationsløsninger, der faciliterer alt fra digitale e-aviser og publikationer til live news med lyd og podcasts i native apps.




Du får mulighed for at arbejde med data som grundlaget for vigtige beslutninger, der skaber og udvikler grundlaget for vores strategiske målsætninger. Vi har en uformel og inkluderende arbejdskultur, med gode muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling.




Vi sørger for at skabe gode betingelser for din læring og har fokus på at styrke dine kompetencer.




Er du interesseret?

Upload ansøgning, CV samt relevante bilag via linket.

Vi holder samtaler løbende og lukker stillingen, når den rette er fundet, så send os gerne din ansøgning snarest muligt. Alle ansøgninger vil blive behandlet fortroligt.




Kontakt Rasmus Frost, Business Intelligence Specialist, på tlf. 2067 1427 eller rasmus.frost@vitecsoftware.com eller Per Gylling, Product Manager, på tlf. 2010 5401 eller per.gylling@vitecsoftware.com for eventuelt yderligere information.




Arbejdssted er aktuelt Viby J, Aarhus.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Show more

Title: VIE - Sustainable Digital Data Analyst - Denmark (Ballerup)
Company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Why Schneider Electric (SE)?

Join us, be part of creating a sustainable future with Schneider Electric's energy and digital solutions!

We empower everyone to make the most of our energy and resources, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. Along the way, we create and provide equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere. We continuously create an inclusive environment and welcome people from all walks of life. We are empowered to do our best and innovate, while living our unique life and work. Together, we dare to disrupt and turn our bold ideas into reality.

Where is the VIE Position ?

The position is located in Ballerup, Denmark, in international dynamic team.

What is the Position?

Drive Sustainable Transformation for Global Supply Chain to support Schneider Electric's Sustainability Goals. You will have the opportunity to work on a wide scope coverage in sustainability, great exposure in global team.

Which missions will you lead?

Responsibilities

Responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data to identify patterns, trends, and relationships. This information is to make informed decisions and recommendations for improvement in various sustainability transformations. It includes but not limited to:

Be the owner of the Global Supply Chain Sustainability Data. The global Sustainable Cockpit is a digital platform that provides an overview of all GSC Sustainable Transformations through data visualization. As the owner of the Global Supply Chain Sustainability Data, the candidate will own the Sustainable Cockpit Platform, partnering with all the transformation program leaders, to make sure it's running stably and continuously improving based on program needs. This platform serves as a unique tool to inform all regions, functions and global teams on the Sustainable performance and trends and provides access to all layers of the organization. As the owner of the Global Sustainable Cockpit it is expected to play a crucial role which includes:


Strong data analytics skills and be able to interpret data accurately and make informed decisions based on the findings,
Have a good sense of data visualization and appealing charts to communicate complex data concisely,
Be familiar with various analytics tools and software, such as Excel, Tableau, Power BI, and Google Analytics, to analyze and present data efficiently.
Data Acquisition: Data analytics often need to acquire data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, and external data providers. Need to be able to understand data structures and formats to ensure accurate and complete data collection.
Problem-solving and be able to think critically to identify issues and develop solutions.
Be able to work independently or as part of a team to achieve common goals.
Be able to communicate efficiently with developers, transformation program leaders and users across regions,
Be able to program manage complex and multiple workstreams efficiently and in high quality
Continuous Learning: Data analysis is an evolving field, and data analysts should be willing to learn new skills and adapt to changes in technology and methodologies.



Be able to increase efficiency and accuracy of Sustainable Data consolidation and reporting from other platforms such as LEAP, GlobES, Sightness etc. Be able to partner with other functions and data base owners to increase sustainable data quality and governance. Be able to provide data and analytics support for Management Report and during Quarterly Business Reviews, Annual Report and other performance reviews.

Support Sustainable Performance Gap Analysis and Decision making process in order to accelerate our transformations, be able to detect possible delays or issues at early stage to propose an improvement plan.

What are the qualifications we are looking for?

Education: Environmental engineer, sustainable development, environmental science

Work experience : 2 internships with experiences already is preferable

Skills


English Fluent
Microsoft powerpoint, excel, word
Self-motivated
Strong ownership
Good communication
Strategic thinking



What's in it for me?


Opportunity to get international experience abroad
To improve your English
To work in multicultural and inclusive environment
Interesting remuneration, social coverage, accommodation
Opportunity to get a permanent position in the end of your mission



Let us learn about you! Apply today.

Why us?

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

₠25.7bn global revenue

137 000+ employees in 100+ countries

45% of revenue from IoT

5% of revenue devoted for R&D

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

Title: BI Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AIMING FOR NEW HEIGHTS

At Scalepoint, we aim for the stars. We support insurers in their digital journey to automate and provide a superior customer experience. Our solutions are unique, and Scalepoint CORE was recently appointed the world’s best claims management solution!




We are looking for a talented BI Developer to join our team at our headquarters in Copenhagen and help us harness the power of data to grow our business.




WHAT KIND OF GEEK ARE YOU?

As a part of our BI setup you will become part of a team of great individuals who strive to build and improve a high-quality data foundation. If you are passionate about data and eager to make a significant impact in a collaborative and innovative environment, we’d love to hear from you! Experience with the following would be a plus:




Expertise with data pipeline and workflow management tools (e.g., SSIS, Dbt, Dagster, Airbyte).
Proficiency in SQL and database design (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.).
Programming skills in .NET and knowledge of engineering best practices, including Unit Testing and Mocking.
Experience with Multidimensional and Tabular models in SSAS, and a strong understanding of analytical concepts such as cubes, measures, and dimensions.
Hands-on experience with PowerBI API and PowerShell.
Python experience is a plus




WHAT TO DIVE INTO

As our new BI Developer, you will be part of an agile team where we volunteer for tasks, manage our own priorities, and collaborate with team members to achieve shared goals. You'll be at the forefront of data innovation, continuously improving our data architecture with emerging technologies. Your focus in the role will be to:




Design, Develop, and Maintain: Create scalable data pipelines and ETL processes to support our data infrastructure.
Collaborate: Work closely with data stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver high-quality data solutions.
Implement Solutions: Develop data integration and data warehousing solutions.
Optimize Performance: Tune data processes for maximum performance and scalability.
Ensure Quality: Perform rigorous testing and verification to maintain data quality and integrity.
Monitor and Troubleshoot: Ensure reliability and accuracy by monitoring data pipelines.
Document Processes: Maintain comprehensive documentation for data processing and BI systems.




WOULD YOU LIKE TO JOIN THE JOURNEY?

Before you answer this question, let us emphasize that we will support your need to succeed. You can expect a warm welcome from your colleagues, and we will pair you with a buddy, who will be there to help and support you beyond onboarding.




If you are interested, please submit your CV and three lines about why you are the right candidate for the job, as soon as possible. We receive applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis.




Don’t hesitate to get in touch with our Scrum Master and Team Manager - Dorota Prusinska, at

dopr@scalepoint.com if you have any questions.

Apply for this job




ABOUT US

Scalepoint spirit in everyday life

Come as you are. That’s how we prefer it. You can easily leave dress codes, permanent lunch buddies, and corporate business attitudes at home. Our office is filled with kudos and high fives – and we believe that everyone is doing their best.




We have employees from 11 nationalities across our offices in Copenhagen, Poland and Switzerland. 63% of us ride a cycle to work. 42% eat vegetarian meals during lunch. 38% are parents. And 52% don't regularly work out. But our sport and events team tries to keep us moving by offering activities such as climbing, mountain biking, running and padel tennis. However, we cannot change the fact that we have a very generous attitude to sweets and cake. But that’s ok; there's a lot to celebrate at Scalepoint.




We look forward to hearing from you!

Show more

At Scalepoint, we aim for the stars. We support insurers in their digital journey to automate and provide a superior customer experience. Our solutions are unique, and Scalepoint CORE was recently appointed the world’s best claims management solution!


We are looking for a talented BI Developer to join our team at our headquarters in Copenhagen and help us harness the power of data to grow our business.


WHAT KIND OF GEEK ARE YOU?

WHAT TO DIVE INTO

If you are interested, please submit your CV and three lines about why you are the right candidate for the job, as soon as possible. We receive applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis.


Don’t hesitate to get in touch with our Scrum Master and Team Manager - Dorota Prusinska, at

Apply for this job

Scalepoint spirit in everyday life

Come as you are. That’s how we prefer it. You can easily leave dress codes, permanent lunch buddies, and corporate business attitudes at home. Our office is filled with kudos and high fives – and we believe that everyone is doing their best.


We have employees from 11 nationalities across our offices in Copenhagen, Poland and Switzerland. 63% of us ride a cycle to work. 42% eat vegetarian meals during lunch. 38% are parents. Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Dreamdata is the industry leader in B2B marketing attribution, optimization and automation. Founded by ex-Trustpilot product and engineering leaders starting in 2019 after building the platform internally, Dreamdata is on a mission to empower marketing professionals by democratizing access and usability of data.

Taking on the complex world of B2B marketing data Dreamdata helps marketing leaders to connect their efforts across all marketing channels to real revenue - something that wasn’t fully possible until now.

We are expanding our team to further empower our customers and ensure their success. This is where you come in. We are scaling our product team in our Copenhagen office.

As an Analytics Engineer at Dreamdata you will be part of a cross-functional product team consisting of Software Engineering, Design and Product Manager. At Dreamdata data is not just a support function - it is our product and what we do !

You will be responsible for the data function part of the team to build and iterate on our main product, ensuring that data pipelines and transformations are built using best practices and are transparent and easy-to-use for our customers.

You will also be part of the broader data group consisting of the analytics engineers and data scientists from other teams. Together we maintain the fundamental data models that power the entire Dreamdata product.

Requirements


You have 2-4 years of experience in a data related role such as analytics engineer, data engineer, data analyst, data scientist or a similar role.
You most likely have real-world experience in working with data from multiple sources, extracting, visualizing, and explaining insights to stakeholders. Previous experience working with marketing and sales data is considered a plus.
You are fluent in SQL. We use Google BigQuery, but experience with other cloud data warehouses like Snowflake, AWS Redshift, Azure SQL etc. is equally relevant.
We use GCP Dataform for the majority of data transformations but experience with dbt or transformation libraries like Pandas, Polar, tidyr, dplyr etc. is also relevant.
You have some exposure to other coding languages like Python, golang, Typescript etc
We use Github, but other version control systems are equally relevant.
You have played with visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx etc. Experience using open source Python/R-based visualization libraries is equally relevant.
We are heavy users of Google Cloud Platform, but exposure to the other public clouds are also considered a plus. If you think the role sounds exciting, but you don’t match all points, don’t hesitate to reach out as we are continuously hiring also with opportunities for less senior profiles.


Benefits


Flexibility - we are sharing our time between the office and remote work.
Equity - be part of the growth journey ahead.
Lunch at the office.
Office next to the waterfront, in the heart of Copenhagen.
A company where you will get the chance to grow with the company.


Who is Dreamdata?

We are a young company with big ambitions, but also a company that emphasizes that it should be fun going to work. We are currently 18 nationalities from all over the world. You will also have opportunities to participate in activities outside of work.

We get together for various non-workrelated events to get to know our colleagues across the company and simply to have a good time together.

https://dreamdata.io/blog/summer-fun-at-dreamdata

https://dreamdata.io/blog/building-the-dream-team-at-dreamdata
Show more

Title: Senior IT Support Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

IT Technical Support – Join Marsh - the world's leading risk advisory and insurance brokerage firm

With over 45,000 employees across 130 countries, we empower Denmark's largest companies to navigate risks and seize business opportunities through our unrivaled expertise in risk management and insurance consulting. We are app. 150 colleagues in Denmark, eager to welcome you to our great organization.

As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.

Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.

What You Can Expect

Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.

Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.

Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.

Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

What You Will Be Rewarded With


Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and innovation
Continuous learning and development opportunities to improve your skills and advance your career.
Competitive compensation and pension scheme
Global network of professionals providing opportunities for growth and mobility


We Will Rely On You To


On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
On- and off boarding of colleagues
Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
Administer and prepare mobile devices.
Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.


What You Need To Have


Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
Solid knowledge of software and hardware
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality


What Makes You Stand Out


Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.


Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.
Show more

Title: Student Developer
Description:
Hvis du er én af de dygtigste på din årgang og er selvkørende med masser af drive, leder Trifork SKT9 lige nu efter en ny studenterprogrammør

Trifork SKT9 søger studenterprogrammør

Vi søger lige nu en studerende til at hjælpe med vores spændende projekter.

Vi arbejder med nyeste teknologi indenfor f.eks. Cloud (Google, AWS & Azure), RESTful API snitflader, Sikkerhed, Webudvikling, Native mobile apps, Microservices, Docker, Kubernetes, Vision, Conversational og Generative AI, Machine Learning og meget andet.

Hvis du brænder for at gøre en forskel for andre og gerne vil udvikle dig både fagligt og personligt, mens du tjener lidt til SU'en, så er det dig vi leder efter.

Om dig


Du er i slutningen af dit studie enten på Datalogi eller Softwareteknologi og brænder for at prøve dine evner af på ægte problemer
Du er en dygtig C#- eller Java udvikler
Du har erfaring med web-udvikling
Du har måske erfaring med appudvikling til Android eller iOS?
Du har måske erfaring med Angular eller React?
Du har erfaring med versionsstyring og samarbejde
Du har et stort drive og er meget selvkørende
Du trives når du arbejder som en del af et hold
Du tager ansvar for egne opgaver
Du er nysgerrig på at lære nye teknologier og har et par hobbyprojekter du udvikler på i din fritid


Hvad Vi Tilbyder

Hos Trifork vil du fra dag 1 blive en del af et af vores projekter, og få et medansvar for at udvikle og designe dele af projektet sammen med dine nye kolleger.

Vi tilbyder en fleksibel arbejdsplads med rig mulighed for at tilpasse både arbejdsplads og –tider så det passer i dit studie. Hos os finder du et afslappet arbejdsmiljø med højt til loftet og kort til bordfodbold og bordtennis bordet.

Ikke mere end 42 mennesker på kontoret

Hvorfor, spørger du så? Vi ønsker at sikre at et kontor ikke bliver for stort, så du altid ved hvem du sidder ved siden af. Ved ikke at have for store kontorer, sikrer vi at have en uformel og afslappet kultur, hvor alle kender hinanden. Det gør også at vi er små autonome enheder og hvor medbestemmelse/indflydelse på hverdagen er en væsentlig faktor. Så på trods af, at Trifork er en virksomhed med mere end 1200 ansatte, så føles det ofte som at arbejde i en startup virksomhed med et stærkt og samarbejdsvenligt miljø, hvor alle kan blive hørt.

Bemærk, screening af ansøgninger vil først finde sted fra uge 33.

Vi ser frem til at modtage dit CV, ansøgning samt karakterblad.
Show more

Title: BI Developer
Place: Humlebæk, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
BI Developer – create value through data

Are you ready to join an agile and highly experienced team on a mission to evolve Business Intelligence in Coloplast through the Microsoft Azure BI stack, Lakehouse and Databricks?

At Coloplast, we have a clear vision for BI and a huge appetite for data. So, seize this opportunity to join a vibrant and expanding team that leverages diverse data sources to drive insights and innovation across the company.

“This is your chance to apply your knowledge of SQL DB, SSAS, data lakes and Databricks to create more value from data at one of the world’s most successful MedTech companies,” says Head of BI Development Jesper Bloch Jensen.

Join our Data team in our Digital, Data and IT organisation

At our HQ in Humlebæk, north of Copenhagen, you will join our inclusive and collaborative Data team of more than 20 BI colleagues, including developers, solution architects and our operations and adoption teams.

Working closely with departments across the organisation, we create methodical roadmaps to manage a diverse project pipeline encompassing Global Operations, Business Support and Innovation. As a global Data function, we leverage numerous source systems, working with a broad range of data from ERP and CRM systems to sensor and app data.

To enhance our existing Azure cloud BI infrastructure, we are currently establishing a real-time and advanced analytics platform using MS Data Lakehouse and Databricks.

“Teamwork is crucial for us, and we like spending time together to discuss good ideas and improve our skills,” continues Jesper.

Get a glimpse into all aspects of BI

Working on a wide range of exciting projects, you will be an important partner to the business. One such project could be establishing the data foundation for reporting on the coming Warehouse Management System with the Global Distribution team, developing a solution for raw material forecasting with the Global Supply Chain team or enabling real-time reporting on ERP data with the Finance team.

Moreover, you will be working with most aspects of the data delivery – from requirement gathering and discussions and analysis to working with ETL, data warehousing, testing and finally handing over the solution to our Operations team.

Specifically, you will


Develop value-adding BI solutions using SQL, DAX, SSAS/Tabular and Python. Both Python and Databricks are capabilities we are currently building, with more extensive use planned for 2024
Build data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and likely Databricks
Plan and run your tasks and BI projects from A to Z
Liaise with the business through workshops to clarify their needs – and challenge them along the way to find the most feasible solutions




“As you’ll follow your projects from start to finish, you’ll not just get a BI support function – but a very active role as a sounding board for the business,” Jesper finishes.

Experience In Microsoft SQL And SSAS

We are looking for an experienced colleague with an interest in BI and analytics, who can maintain a structured approach throughout the entire development process. This also means that you can plan your projects and communicate well with stakeholders across the organisation throughout your projects.

On top of that, you enjoy working in a team and like to engage with your colleagues and stakeholders to elevate data and reporting.

Moreover, we imagine that you


Have experience developing BI solutions using Microsoft SQL DB and SSAS/DAX
Experience within a Lakehouse and Databricks setting is a plus, but not a prerequisite
May have experience working with Power BI or similar frontend tools
Speak and write English effortlessly
Have an appetite for learning new technologies within a dynamic BI field




Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please call Head of BI Development, Digital, Data and IT, Jesper Bloch Jensen on +45 4911 1621. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate has been found .

Due to the upcoming holiday season, our recruitment process may take a bit longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com .

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn . Like us on Facebook .

56951


Show more

Working closely with departments across the organisation, we create methodical roadmaps to manage a diverse project pipeline encompassing Global Operations, Business Support and Innovation. As a global Data function, we leverage numerous source systems, working with a broad range of data from ERP and CRM systems to sensor and app data.

To enhance our existing Azure cloud BI infrastructure, we are currently establishing a real-time and advanced analytics platform using MS Data Lakehouse and Databricks.

“Teamwork is crucial for us, and we like spending time together to discuss good ideas and improve our skills,” continues Jesper.

Get a glimpse into all aspects of BI

Working on a wide range of exciting projects, you will be an important partner to the business. One such project could be establishing the data foundation for reporting on the coming Warehouse Management System with the Global Distribution team, developing a solution for raw material forecasting with the Global Supply Chain team or enabling real-time reporting on ERP data with the Finance team.

Moreover, you will be working with most aspects of the data delivery – from requirement gathering and discussions and analysis to working with ETL, data warehousing, testing and finally handing over the solution to our Operations team.

Specifically, you will

  • Develop value-adding BI solutions using SQL, DAX, SSAS/Tabular and Python. Both Python and Databricks are capabilities we are currently building, with more extensive use planned for 2024
  • Build data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and likely Databricks
  • Plan and run your tasks and BI projects from A to Z
  • Liaise with the business through workshops to clarify their needs – and challenge them along the way to find the most feasible solutions



“As you’ll follow your projects from start to finish, you’ll not just get a BI support function – but a very active role as a sounding board for the business,” Jesper finishes.

Experience In Microsoft SQL And SSAS

We are looking for an experienced colleague with an interest in BI and analytics, who can maintain a structured approach throughout the entire development process. This also means that you can plan your projects and communicate well with stakeholders across the organisation throughout your projects.

On top of that, you enjoy working in a team and like to engage with your colleagues and stakeholders to elevate data and reporting.

Moreover, we imagine that you

  • Have experience developing BI solutions using Microsoft SQL DB and SSAS/DAX
  • Experience within a Lakehouse and Databricks setting is a plus, but not a prerequisite
  • May have experience working with Power BI or similar frontend tools
  • Speak and write English effortlessly
  • Have an appetite for learning new technologies within a dynamic BI field



Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please call Head of BI Development, Digital, Data and IT, Jesper Bloch Jensen on +45 4911 1621. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate has been found .

Due to the upcoming holiday season, our recruitment process may take a bit longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com .

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn . Like us on Facebook .

56951

Title: Senior IT Support Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
IT Technical Support – Join Marsh - the world's leading risk advisory and insurance brokerage firm

With over 45,000 employees across 130 countries, we empower Denmark's largest companies to navigate risks and seize business opportunities through our unrivaled expertise in risk management and insurance consulting. We are app. 150 colleagues in Denmark, eager to welcome you to our great organization.

As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.

Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.

What you can expect:

Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.

Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.

Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.

Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

What you will be rewarded with:


Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and innovation
Continuous learning and development opportunities to improve your skills and advance your career.
Competitive compensation and pension scheme
Global network of professionals providing opportunities for growth and mobility


We will rely on you to:


On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
On- and off boarding of colleagues
Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
Administer and prepare mobile devices.
Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.


What you need to have:


Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
Solid knowledge of software and hardware
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality


What makes you stand out:


Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.


Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.

Title: BI Specialist
Place: Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Business Intelligence Specialist hos Danske Shoppingcentre

Brænder du for data og analyse? Har du en passion for at omdanne information til indsigt, der driver forretningens succes? Så er du måske vores næste Business Intelligence Specialist hos Danske Shoppingcentre.




Bliv en del af en virksomhed i kraftig vækst

Danske Shoppingcentre er en forholdsvis ung virksomhed med en vision om at udvikle vores 17 shoppingcentre til destinationer for fremtidens markedspladser. Vi er markedsledende, og du har sandsynligvis stiftet bekendtskab med et eller flere af vores shoppingcentre såsom Frederiksberg Centret, Lyngby Storcenter, Amager Centret, Kolding Storcenter etc.

Vi søger en passioneret Business Intelligence Specialist til at styrke vores BI-team i Strategi afdelingen, som holder til på vores Service Office i City 2, Taastrup. Teamet består af en Head of Tech, en BI Manager, dig samt en kommende Studentermedhjælper. Du vil referere til Head of Tech og derfor have et tæt samarbejde med BI Manageren, foruden selvstændige ansvarsområder og opgaver.




Udvikling og innovation i højsædet

Som Business Intelligence Specialist hos Danske Shoppingcentre vil du have en afgørende rolle i at omdanne data til værdifuld indsigt. Ved at analysere omsætningstal, kundeadfærd og operationelle processer hjælper du ledelsen med at træffe velinformerede beslutninger på baggrund af data.




Dine primære opgaver inkluderer:

Teknisk Ekspertise: Udvikling af Power BI-rapporter og sikring af, at data leveres i det rette format og form for at understøtte forretningsbeslutninger. Involvering i opbygning og vedligeholdelse af vores datawarehouse og datamodellering m.m. Kendskab til kodning i Python, R eller JavaScript er et stort plus.
Automation: Implementering af automatiseringsløsninger ved brug af RPA-teknologier som Power Automate, Blue Prism, Zapier og Make, som integrerer AI til at optimere og strømline forretningsprocesser.
Forretningsforståelse: Forståelse af forretningsbehov og omsætning af dem til effektive dataanalyser og visualiseringer. Samarbejde med BI Manageren for at fungere som bindeled mellem forretningen og Business Intelligence og sikre, at vores datastrategi understøtter vores overordnede forretningsmål.
Stakeholder Management: Samarbejde med interne og eksterne interessenter for at definere og levere BI-løsninger, der opfylder forretningsmæssige krav. Kommunikation af komplekse tekniske koncepter til ikke-tekniske interessenter vil være en vigtig del af din rolle.
Teknologisk Innovation: Udvikling og opsætning af en ny Microsoft Fabric dataplatform samt implementering af machine learning-teknikker til predictive og prescriptive analytics. Udforskning af generativ AI inden for Business Intelligence for at bruge teknologien til visualisering og besvare ad hoc forretningsspørgsmål.




Dine kompetencer. Vores samarbejde. Sammen skaber vi resultaterne.

Som person trives du i en relationsopbyggende rolle, er nysgerrig, initiativrig og passioneret omkring data og analyse. Din samarbejdsform er løsningsorienteret, og du er vant til at arbejde på tværs af teams og fagligheder.




Desuden forventer vi, at du har:

Erfaring med Power BI, kildeintegration, datamodellering og datawarehouse.
Kendskab til design og udvikling af BI-løsninger inden for Microsoft-teknologier som Azure/Fabric og Power Platformen.
Erfaring med datamanagement og visualisering af analyser i Power BI.
Evne til at oversætte forretningsbehov til relevante analyser og visualiseringer.
Erfaring med kodning i Python, R eller JavaScript er et plus.
Evne til at udarbejde roadmap og pipeline ift. fremtidens datarapportering i Danske Shoppingcentre.
Kundskaber inden for machine learning og en stærk interesse for artificial intelligence.
Erfaring med automation, herunder RPA teknologier så som Power Automate, Blue Prism, Zapier eller Make.
Stærke projektledelsesevner er et stort plus.

Hvis du brænder for at arbejde med data, kunstig intelligens og ønsker at være en del af et ambitiøst team, som agter at udforske den nyeste teknologi, så send din ansøgning og CV til os i dag!




Har du spørgsmål?

Så kontakt vores Head of Tech, Sebastian Krogh, på telefon +45 30 50 60 30, eller Rekrutteringskonsulent William Pokriva på telefon +45 93 80 91 57.




Sådan ansøger du

Klik på linket øverst til højre, send dit CV og fortæl os, hvorfor du brænder for netop denne stilling.

Da vi løbende afholder samtaler, ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt og senest den 31. august 2024.

Som person trives du i en relationsopbyggende rolle, er nysgerrig, initiativrig og passioneret omkring data og analyse. Din samarbejdsform er løsningsorienteret, og du er vant til at arbejde på tværs af teams og fagligheder.


Desuden forventer vi, at du har:

  • Erfaring med Power BI, kildeintegration, datamodellering og datawarehouse.
  • Kendskab til design og udvikling af BI-løsninger inden for Microsoft-teknologier som Azure/Fabric og Power Platformen.
  • Erfaring med datamanagement og visualisering af analyser i Power BI.
  • Evne til at oversætte forretningsbehov til relevante analyser og visualiseringer.
  • Erfaring med kodning i Python, R eller JavaScript er et plus.
  • Evne til at udarbejde roadmap og pipeline ift. fremtidens datarapportering i Danske Shoppingcentre.
  • Kundskaber inden for machine learning og en stærk interesse for artificial intelligence.
  • Erfaring med automation, herunder RPA teknologier så som Power Automate, Blue Prism, Zapier eller Make.
  • Stærke projektledelsesevner er et stort plus.

Hvis du brænder for at arbejde med data, kunstig intelligens og ønsker at være en del af et ambitiøst team, som agter at udforske den nyeste teknologi, så send din ansøgning og CV til os i dag!


Har du spørgsmål?

Så kontakt vores Head of Tech, Sebastian Krogh, på telefon +45 30 50 60 30, eller Rekrutteringskonsulent William Pokriva på telefon +45 93 80 91 57.


Sådan ansøger du

Klik på linket øverst til højre, send dit CV og fortæl os, hvorfor du brænder for netop denne stilling.

Da vi løbende afholder samtaler, ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt og senest den 31. august 2024.

Title: DI - Lead Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lead Data Engineer
Om stillingen

DI har en ambitiøs digital strategi, der skal bringe dem tættere på medlemmerne, understøtte vækst og sikre effektiv kommunikation og samarbejde på tværs. Som en del af dette og for at styrke Data & Automations Teamet søger DI en Lead Data Engineer.


Som Lead Data Engineer vil du være med til at opbygge en moderne dataplatform i DI. Du får mulighed for at være med i alle faser – fra analyse, design og udvikling til test, implementering og den måske vigtigste fase, forankringen i hverdagen. Du sætter den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis. Du kan skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.

Afdelingen har ansvaret for dataprocessering og dataløsninger og er godt i gang med at opbygge en dataplatform på Microsoft Azure stacken – startende med et datavarehus og en række analytiske løsninger. Afdelingen har til ansvar at få teknologierne til at tale sammen ved at automatisere og strømline datapipelines.

Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i afdelingen, som er Center of Excellence i forhold til dataplatformen. Du samarbejder tæt med forretningen om at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter gennem bl.a. selvbetjeningsløsninger. I den forbindelse vil du til dagligt være i tæt dialog med forretningen, hvor du også vil agere sparringspartner og indgå i dialog ift. opsætning af integration af data fra forskellige kildesystemer.

Derudover vil dit ansvarsområder bl.a være at:


Være drivende i at opbygge en moderne og mangfoldig dataplatform i DI.

Sætte den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis.

Skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.

Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i forhold til dataplatformen

Af arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. nævnes:


Udarbejde tekniske løsningsforslag, såvel som at estimere opgaver og effektivt kommunikere det til forretningen

Designe, udvikle og implementere dataløsninger, primært til data warehouset

Designe, udvikle og vedligeholde dataplatformen og data pipelines

Bidrage til at udvikle en langsigtet strategi for dataplatformen

Integrere data fra en række kilder, og opbygning af datamodeller

Bidrage til tekniske og forretningsmæssige afklaringer af løsninger

Deltage i udviklings- og projektopgaver i forbindelse med optimering af processer og systemer på tværs af DI.

Om dig

Den ideelle kandidat brænder for data og udvikling og tør udfordre status quo og flirte med cloud teknologi og data arkitektur. Du har fire til otte års erfaring fra en lignende stilling, evt. fra et konsulenthus eller en brancheorganisation, hvor du har haft hands-on erfaring med opbygning af data løsninger. Du har en relevant akademisk baggrund formentlig fra CBS, KU eller ITU med særlig fokus på data. Du er serviceorienteret, hjælpsom og kan være bindeled mellem forretningen og it-specialister. Vi ser gerne at du er fagligt nysgerrig i forhold til nye tendenser og udviklingen inden for datavidenskab, herunder data services i Azure. Derudover arbejder du struktureret og selvstændigt med et analytisk mindset og en metodisk tilgang.

Vi ser gerne at du besidder følgende kvalifikationer:

Ekspert i ETL processen, SQL programmering og datamart modellering iflg. Kimball

Solid erfaring med agil udvikling, gerne med afsæt i Git platformen

Gode kommunikationsevner på både dansk og engelsk

Det er en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du også har erfaring med:


T-SQL og SQL Server automation rammeværk generelt set

Analytiske applikationer, gerne Microsoft Power BI

Microsoft Azure dataplatform (Infrastruktur)

Azure data factory

Derudover er du en person, der tager ansvar for at kvaliteten, af det der leveres, er høj. Du er god til at sætte dig ind i komplekse og fagligt tunge opgaver. Du er resultatorienteret og har stor handlekraft. Det er også vigtigt, at du er vedholdende, også når det kommer til at udvikle dig selv fagligt og personligt, da teamet har stort fokus på det gode kollegaskab, samt at være gode samarbejdspartnere for hele huset. Det er altså vigtigt, at du er i stand til at danne dig en helhedsforståelse af hele DI. Endelig er du en person som har både hjerte og hjerne med på job og er enig med teamet i, at et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø er en nødvendig del af det at gå på arbejde.


Interesseret?


Så klik på linket herunder med det samme. Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt, og vi behandler kandidater løbende. Rekrutteringen faciliteres af vores rekrutteringspartner Kold+Partners. Har du spørgsmål eller brug for mere viden, er du velkommen til at kontakte Peter Kold (2989 0903/peter@koldpartners.com).

Læs mere om DI her.




Show more

  • Designe, udvikle og implementere dataløsninger, primært til data warehouset

  • Designe, udvikle og vedligeholde dataplatformen og data pipelines

  • Bidrage til at udvikle en langsigtet strategi for dataplatformen

  • Integrere data fra en række kilder, og opbygning af datamodeller

  • Bidrage til tekniske og forretningsmæssige afklaringer af løsninger

  • Deltage i udviklings- og projektopgaver i forbindelse med optimering af processer og systemer på tværs af DI.

Om dig

Den ideelle kandidat brænder for data og udvikling og tør udfordre status quo og flirte med cloud teknologi og data arkitektur. Du har fire til otte års erfaring fra en lignende stilling, evt. fra et konsulenthus eller en brancheorganisation, hvor du har haft hands-on erfaring med opbygning af data løsninger. Du har en relevant akademisk baggrund formentlig fra CBS, KU eller ITU med særlig fokus på data. Du er serviceorienteret, hjælpsom og kan være bindeled mellem forretningen og it-specialister. Vi ser gerne at du er fagligt nysgerrig i forhold til nye tendenser og udviklingen inden for datavidenskab, herunder data services i Azure. Derudover arbejder du struktureret og selvstændigt med et analytisk mindset og en metodisk tilgang.

Vi ser gerne at du besidder følgende kvalifikationer:

  • Ekspert i ETL processen, SQL programmering og datamart modellering iflg. Kimball

  • Solid erfaring med agil udvikling, gerne med afsæt i Git platformen

  • Gode kommunikationsevner på både dansk og engelsk

Det er en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du også har erfaring med:

  • T-SQL og SQL Server automation rammeværk generelt set

  • Analytiske applikationer, gerne Microsoft Power BI

  • Microsoft Azure dataplatform (Infrastruktur)

  • Azure data factory

Derudover er du en person, der tager ansvar for at kvaliteten, af det der leveres, er høj. Du er god til at sætte dig ind i komplekse og fagligt tunge opgaver. Du er resultatorienteret og har stor handlekraft. Det er også vigtigt, at du er vedholdende, også når det kommer til at udvikle dig selv fagligt og personligt, da teamet har stort fokus på det gode kollegaskab, samt at være gode samarbejdspartnere for hele huset. Det er altså vigtigt, at du er i stand til at danne dig en helhedsforståelse af hele DI. Endelig er du en person som har både hjerte og hjerne med på job og er enig med teamet i, at et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø er en nødvendig del af det at gå på arbejde.

Interesseret?

Så klik på linket herunder med det samme. Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt, og vi behandler kandidater løbende. Rekrutteringen faciliteres af vores rekrutteringspartner Kold+Partners. Har du spørgsmål eller brug for mere viden, er du velkommen til at kontakte Peter Kold (2989 0903/peter@koldpartners.com).

Læs mere om DI her.

Title: Internship: Database System Development
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic intern to join our team and help extend our current database system.

Responsibilities


Enhance and extend our existing database system into our robots utilizing MongoDB.
Collaborate with the development team to integrate new features.
Write clean, maintainable code with tests


Requirements


Good knowledge in a programming language (Typescript /JavaScript preferred)
Experience in working with databases (NoSQL is a plus)
Understanding of Object-Oriented Programming concepts


What You Will Gain


Hands-on experience with MongoDB and learn best practices for database design and optimization.
Improve your coding skills, particularly in TypeScript/JavaScript, and learn how to write efficient, maintainable code.
Deepen your understanding of OOP concepts and how to apply them effectively in real-world projects.
Learn industry-standard development practices, including version control, code reviews, and collaborative development workflows.
Enhance your problem-solving abilities by tackling real-world challenges and finding innovative solutions.
Gain insight into the software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies, and understand how to manage and deliver projects successfully.
Work closely with experienced professionals, receive mentorship, and build a strong foundation for your future career.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.'




The job as Quantitative Analyst

As our new Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading and a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Minimum 2 years of experience from a similar role or top of your university class
Quantitative background in Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, etc.
Master machine learning and data-science fundamentals
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytic skills and an eye for detail
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best – we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day become partner
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.
