Title: Serialization Data Analyst, Packaging Compliance & Master Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a flair and interest for data and supply chain and are you keen on working across various business areas to ensure compliance of Lundbeck’s products? Then this is a great opportunity.

Your new role

In your new role, you will join the cross-functional serialization team. You will work alongside dedicated colleagues by handling various operational serialization tasks and maintaining the current processes. You will assist the organization in translating market-specific regulations into actions and ensure that Lundbeck is compliant with local regulations on serialization.

Your role will combine operational support, process ownership, and project management. You will be the focal point for our various business units and partners and support the organization in implementing serialization compliance initiatives globally while ensuring effective serialization processes cross-functionally.

You will be working on several activities within serialization, with the following focus areas:


Driving issue analysis and correction with production, IT, external partners, contract manufacturers, and solution providers - to support Supply Chain departments and Pharmaceutical Production
Data analysis and error trending on operations to identify improvement areas
Creating standard processes and guidelines in the Line of Business – in collaboration with the Serialization team, Corporate IT, and consultants
Driving small and medium projects and activities independently, and in collaboration with colleagues – with the possibility of driving larger projects further on



Your future team

You will join the Packaging Compliance and Master Data department which consists of 19 dedicated employees divided into 4 groups: Artwork, Master Data, Packaging Change Management, and Serialization. Together we ensure timely updates of artwork and master data for all Lundbeck products, as well as drive serialization for the whole organization and external partners.

Packaging Compliance and Master Data is a part of the division Pharmaceutical Production & Supply Chain, and we are based in Lundbeck’s headquarters in Valby. The division consists of +550 employees, located in Denmark and France, and we are responsible for the production and distribution of Lundbeck’s medical products.

As Serialization Data Analyst, you will report to the Senior Manager of Packaging Compliance & Master Data.

What You Bring To The Team

Our preferred candidate has the following professional qualifications:


A bachelor's or master’s degree in a relevant field (IT, engineering, supply chain management, business, or equivalent), and 0-3 years of experience
A structured approach to complex issues, with an analytic and goal-oriented mindset to independently establish solutions
Detail-oriented and deep understanding of data
Great communication- and stakeholder management skills
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry (working with GMP and GXP), supply chain, and/or working with serialization is beneficial



Serialization is a niche, and while experience and knowledge within the field will be beneficial, it is not a requirement, and Lundbeck will provide thorough training. The most important thing is that you are willing to learn and have the desire to develop your competencies as well as having a desire to develop yourself and grow your area of expertise and responsibility.

You enjoy working with data and complex workflows. You are detail-oriented but also possess the ability to take the “helicopter” view of various ongoing projects and activities and naturally take the lead in solving complex challenges.

You are curious by nature; you are proactive, and you always try to find the best solution for our customers and Lundbeck overall.

You are a true team player and bring positivity to the office even in busy times. You enjoy having several different tasks (including day-to-day) and projects at the same time and are confident in communicating with colleagues on all levels in the organization.

Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace, passionate colleagues, and a culture characterized as collaborative – a must to successfully bring our treatments through research and development all the way to commercialization and the people who need them. We offer a mix of exciting tasks and numerous development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

You can also learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com or by following us on LinkedIn, Instagram (@h_lundbeck) or Twitter (@Lundbeck).

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include a few lines about your motivation and reasons for applying. No separate cover letter is needed. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

Please submit your application no later than the 5th of August 2024.

If you have questions or want to hear more, please feel free to contact hiring manager, Anne Katrine Irgens at AEIR@lundbeck.com or +45 22 76 98 27.

We need every brain in the game – and that includes all brains and the different perspectives we bring to the table. At Lundbeck, we embrace the uniqueness of each employee, and we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

#EveryBrainInTheGame

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This is an exciting time to become part of Tryg. With a strong focus on digitalization and data, our strategic ambition is to develop and improve our Data Transparency by offering a new and better solution across the Nordic. We are in search for a new colleague within the Data Team, to help develop the future Data Transparency solution. Would you like to be a part of the development?

About Us

As a part of the Tryg transformation journey Data Transparency is a crucial enabler for decision making. We are building end to end transparency of our system and application landscape where we are adding additional data layers to ensure the right perspectives and viewpoints to the organization.

You will become part of Business IT & Digitalization (BID), which today consists of approximately 700 dedicated employees, who support the current development of Tryg Group. The BID organization is Nordic, with majority of central functions placed in the headquarter in Ballerup.

The Data Team is a part of our Transformation Office, which today consists of 8 people that work close with other departments across the organization. The Data team is especially working close with the Enterprise Architects and Finance.

About The Role

The Transformation Office has the overall responsibility to drive the Transformation Tryg is undergoing, and as a part of this, ensuring Data Transparency is critical.

You will be a part of af team responsible for driving, defining and implementing the IT Data Transparency across Nordics.

We gather data from various systems, primarily through APIs, transform the data within our pipeline, and store it in SQL databases. Subsequently, the data is imported into Power BI, where we develop sophisticated and user-friendly reports.

As a Data Engineer you will be responsible for and ensure:


lead the backend development in Microsoft Azure
ensure the system integrations primarily through API
ensure data from different data sources into our pipeline and drive the initial data transformation in the new setup
drive the setup of our datamodel


About You

We imagine that you have work experience in a similar position. You have extensive understanding and experience in establishing database foundations with tables, keys, procedures etc. and have an eye for continuously optimizing on this throughput the transformation journey.

You enjoy translating requirements into a structured and comprehensible solution and be able to set the backend direction for the coming years.

You will be exposed to the following tech stack:


Power BI
SQL
Microsoft Azure (Synapse & Data Factory).
Phyton


Curious?

Send your application as soon as possible, but no later than 10th of August, as we’ll be conducting interviews continuously.

If you have any questions regarding the role, you are welcome to contact Director of Tech Transformation, Portfolio & Financial Management, Ema Ljubinac, at ema.ljubinac@tryg.dk .

job rekvisition ID: 26247

Tryg er Skandinaviens største skadesforsikringsselskab med aktiviteter i Danmark, Norge og Sverige. I Danmark består koncernen blandt andet af Tryg, Alka, TJM og Tryg Garanti. Title: Data Architect/Analyst (f/m/d)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Rethinking IT.

We have lots of ideas about how to successfully drive digitalization in companies. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, and clever tools for developers. What is your role in this? Move the world from behind the scenes with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Rethink IT and steer projects in completely new directions. Be bold when others would have given up. In short, play a key role in driving digitalization forward! We’ll provide the resources you need to do this. We also offer a variety of opportunities to get involved and to be part of a global network of IT experts and professionals. Welcome to our world!

We Make Real What Matters. This Is Your Role.

Vision:

As data is supposed to be the new oil, making tangible value out of data will make the difference and is what we are striving for.

Supporting the business in decision making and answering increasingly complex questions in ever shorter time or even real time is our aspiration.

Mission:

By combining a profound knowledge of finance and related end-2-end processes with deep technical know-how and a fresh thinking with respect to problem solving, we provide state of the art IT solutions, services and platforms for finance departments with a focus on reporting, analytics and planning.

Key Areas of Responsibility:


Support in the relaunch of a solution for group consolidation with a focus on the provision of an integrated data layer that enables a pass-through from consolidated data to unconsolidated ERP data
Permanent self-reliant optimization of data models (in the context of S/4 Group Reporting, SAP BW/4, S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Snowflake)
You envision, design and implement architectures and data models optimized for the integration of various, heterogenous data sources. You extend our service offering by business intelligence and reporting solutions to effectively deal with the new non-financial reporting requirements like the EU Taxonomy
Autonomously deliver/lead projects mainly in the context of an SAP BW/4 environment
Perform changes in alignment with BI colleagues and business stakeholders
Constantly provide innovations to improve or enhance analytics related solutions and service offering
Provide added value to data analytics initiatives / projects (migrations, predictive analytics, SAC, new projects)
Manage and coordinate external partners and communicate with various business stakeholders for the successful completion of projects and changes in existing solutions


Use Your Skills To Move The World Forward.


University degree in IT or Business Insights related field
Some years of experience in analytics and reporting (SAP BW, SAP BW/4, SAC, SAP ABAP, Snowflake, PowerBI)
Experience in an international group company and experience in SAP Group reporting are valued
Extensive experience in data warehousing, ETL processes and reporting (SAP AO, SAC)
Knowledge on HANA Studio (SQL/Java Script/CDS views), experience in cloud platforms, as well as any other BI tool are valued
Practical experience in collaborating with business stakeholders, experience within the area of Accounting / Controlling / Closing process is valued
Ability to learn and adapt to new environments / contexts / applications
Business Value and Customer focused, as well as goal-oriented professional with innovative thinking and attention to detail and a team player
Project Management experience in agile methodology
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and willingness to work in a multicultural team
Strong engineering/analytic skills and in leading BI projects and data expertise (modelling, analytics, prediction, simulation, AI/ML) and profound background in digitalization technologies is highly valued
Business fluent English


What we offer.


2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
Attractive remuneration package
Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
Find more benefits here


Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ - if you need further information on the application process.
Show more
HTML:
Rethinking IT.

We have lots of ideas about how to successfully drive digitalization in companies. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, and clever tools for developers. What is your role in this? Move the world from behind the scenes with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Rethink IT and steer projects in completely new directions. Be bold when others would have given up. In short, play a key role in driving digitalization forward! We’ll provide the resources you need to do this. We also offer a variety of opportunities to get involved and to be part of a global network of IT experts and professionals. Welcome to our world!

We Make Real What Matters. This Is Your Role.

Vision:

As data is supposed to be the new oil, making tangible value out of data will make the difference and is what we are striving for.

Supporting the business in decision making and answering increasingly complex questions in ever shorter time or even real time is our aspiration.

Mission:

By combining a profound knowledge of finance and related end-2-end processes with deep technical know-how and a fresh thinking with respect to problem solving, we provide state of the art IT solutions, services and platforms for finance departments with a focus on reporting, analytics and planning.

Key Areas of Responsibility:

  • Support in the relaunch of a solution for group consolidation with a focus on the provision of an integrated data layer that enables a pass-through from consolidated data to unconsolidated ERP data
  • Permanent self-reliant optimization of data models (in the context of S/4 Group Reporting, SAP BW/4, S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Snowflake)
  • You envision, design and implement architectures and data models optimized for the integration of various, heterogenous data sources. You extend our service offering by business intelligence and reporting solutions to effectively deal with the new non-financial reporting requirements like the EU Taxonomy
  • Autonomously deliver/lead projects mainly in the context of an SAP BW/4 environment
  • Perform changes in alignment with BI colleagues and business stakeholders
  • Constantly provide innovations to improve or enhance analytics related solutions and service offering
  • Provide added value to data analytics initiatives / projects (migrations, predictive analytics, SAC, new projects)
  • Manage and coordinate external partners and communicate with various business stakeholders for the successful completion of projects and changes in existing solutions

Use Your Skills To Move The World Forward.

  • University degree in IT or Business Insights related field
  • Some years of experience in analytics and reporting (SAP BW, SAP BW/4, SAC, SAP ABAP, Snowflake, PowerBI)
  • Experience in an international group company and experience in SAP Group reporting are valued
  • Extensive experience in data warehousing, ETL processes and reporting (SAP AO, SAC)
  • Knowledge on HANA Studio (SQL/Java Script/CDS views), experience in cloud platforms, as well as any other BI tool are valued
  • Practical experience in collaborating with business stakeholders, experience within the area of Accounting / Controlling / Closing process is valued
  • Ability to learn and adapt to new environments / contexts / applications
  • Business Value and Customer focused, as well as goal-oriented professional with innovative thinking and attention to detail and a team player
  • Project Management experience in agile methodology
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and willingness to work in a multicultural team
  • Strong engineering/analytic skills and in leading BI projects and data expertise (modelling, analytics, prediction, simulation, AI/ML) and profound background in digitalization technologies is highly valued
  • Business fluent English

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ - if you need further information on the application process.

Title: Data Insights Consultant
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Topsoe is a leading global provider of technology and solutions for the energy transition. We combat climate change by helping our customers and partners achieve their decarbonization and emission reduction goals.

Based on decades of scientific research and innovation, we offer world leading solutions for transforming renewable resources into fuels and chemicals for a sustainable world, and for efficient and low-carbon fuel production and clean air.

We were founded in 1940 and are headquartered in Denmark, with over 2,800 employees serving customers all around the globe. To learn more, visit www.topsoe.com.

Who We’re Looking For

Can you identify needs, build, and apply BI reports to support the business and for decision-making, or do you have an interest within this area? Do you like to work, and help colleagues from many different departments and cross functions? Then you might be the Data Consultant we are looking for!

Our team supports the business with tools and insights to make data-driven strategic and tactical improvements. We are a smaller team within the Business Finance organization with lots of ambitions, so there will be plenty of opportunity to make a difference and set the agenda together. Your role will be very diverse. One day you might be developing new insights reports, and the next day you will innovate existing analyses and reports – and discuss next-level solutions with stakeholders or managers.

Your Tasks Will Include


Identifying and designing value-adding insights solutions
Interpreting business requests and clarifying data requirements
Assisting and advising on data models and scoping of new BI projects
Collaborating with highly skilled colleagues including Data analysts, Application Specialists, Business Partners, and Managers to service our clients coherently
Promoting new insights/reports (descriptive and prescriptive).


Our primary tools - knowledge to the tools is not a requirement:


SAC (SAP Analytics Cloud)
Excel and SAP Analysis
Eclipse IDE (Eclipse Modeling Tools)
Power Point and Think-cell.


Experience or not?

The preferred candidate has some years of experience from similar jobs, e.g., Business Analyst, BI Consultant or Data Analyst in either other companies or consultancy firms. It is a plus but not a requirement to have consultancy experience.

The right candidate could also be a newly graduated and hold a master’s degree within Economics or Data Science or equivalent. If this is the case, together we will find the right balance between tasks and responsibilities to match your profile.

Why join us

There are many reasons to join us. To mention a few, you will get:


A job with a purpose: We are on a mission to solve the world’s climate crises. We are using our cutting-edge technology for a better world, and we are well underway on our vision to become a global driver in carbon emission reduction technologies in 2024
A platform to grow from: We have personal and professional development high on our agenda, and we will provide you with tools and tasks to make you learn and grow
We care about you: We believe in the strength derived from diversity, and we strive to build trust in- and collaborate with one-another.


How You Can Apply

If you would like to be part of a team of skilled and professional colleagues in an informal organization, please submit your application and resume in English and enclose a copy of your references through our website www.topsoe.com.

Please contact Nicholas Olsen-Stryhn, Head of Data Insights at +45 28409350 or NIOS@topsoe.com if you want to know more about the position.

Application deadline

August 11, 2024.
Show more

August 11, 2024.

Title: Lead Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Redstone Commodity Search focus on offering 360° search solutions to the global commodities markets. With a competitive coverage of Trading Houses, Producers, Majors, Utilities, Merchants, Hedge Funds, Investment Banks and Brokerages; Redstone Commodity Search can confidently offer you an edge in today’s volatile market.




Redstone Commodity Search are working with an established Danish Commodities Trading House, in their search for a Lead Quantitative Researcher to join the growing Energy team.




Key Responsibilities / Tasks




Focus on EU power and Gas markets, seeking out new opportunities and trends.
Build models to power quantitative strategies.
Conduct research and statistical analysis.
Ensure compliance with regulations and reporting within the Energy Market.
Work with large data sets to predict and test statistical market patterns.
Role reports into the Director of Power Trading.




Key Qualifications / Experience




Having a broad understanding of international power and gas fundamentals.
Analytical mindset and strong ability to navigate the markets.
3+ years of relevant quantitative experience.
Master’s degree in finance, mathematics, economics, or a relevant field.
Strong attention to detail, and numerical accuracy.
Located in Denmark.

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Konsulent
Description:
Business Intelligence Konsulent med Fokus på Dataanalyse og Teknologi Søges til itm8 i Aarhus, København, Skovlunde & Odense

Er du passioneret omkring dataanalyse og business intelligence? Har du en solid teknisk baggrund og erfaring med at omdanne data til indsigt, der driver forretningsbeslutninger? Vi er på udkig efter en dygtig Business Intelligence Konsulent, der kan bringe avancerede dataanalysefærdigheder til vores team og hjælpe vores kunder med at navigere i datadrevne beslutningsprocesser.

Hvad tilbyder vi?


En nøglerolle i en organisation, hvor data og indsigt er i centrum for vores forretningsstrategi.
Muligheden for at arbejde med state-of-the-art teknologier inden for dataanalyse og business intelligence.
Et dynamisk arbejdsmiljø, hvor du kan påvirke og bidrage til virksomhedens vækst og succes.



Dine opgaver vil inkludere:


Udvikling og implementering af BI-løsninger, der understøtter kundens forretningsmål.
Arbejde med PowerBi, T-SQL, stored procedures og ETL-processer for at extracte, transformere og indlæse data.
Anvende Microsoft-teknologier som SQL Server, Data Factory, Azure SQL, Azure Data Lakes, Azure Synapse og udforske nye teknologier som Fabric.



Ideel kandidat:


Har en stærk baggrund som konsulent i dataanalyse og business intelligence med over 5 års erfaring.
Er teknisk dygtig med erfaring i PowerBi, SQL, Python, og Microsofts cloud-teknologier.
Er kundeminded, en god kollega, nysgerrig og altid på udkig efter at lære om nye teknologier, især inden for AI og data science.
Arbejdssted på Aarhus kontoret hvor resten af teamet sidder, men det er ikke et ultimativt krav. Det er også muligt at arbejde fra vores kontorer i København Ø, Skovlunde eller Odense.



Om itm8:

itm8 er en innovativ IT-partner, der specialiserer sig i at levere løsninger, der transformerer og optimerer vores kunders forretningsprocesser gennem intelligent brug af data. Vi værdsætter et miljø, hvor samarbejde, innovation og teknologisk ekspertise er nøglen til vores fælles succes.

Skal du med på holdet?

Er du klar til at tage skridtet og blive en del af vores team? Send dit CV og en kort motiverende ansøgning til os. Vi ser frem til at integrere dine færdigheder og passion i vores virksomhed!

Kontakt:

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, så kontakt Andreas Hvejsel Andersen på mail anhan@itm8.com. Vi afholder løbende samtaler og ansætter, når vi finder den rette kandidat. Vi indhenter straffeattest før ansættelse.


Show more

Title: Student Developer
Description:
Hvis du er én af de dygtigste på din årgang og er selvkørende med masser af drive, leder Trifork SKT9 lige nu efter en ny studenterprogrammør

Trifork SKT9 søger studenterprogrammør

Vi søger lige nu en studerende til at hjælpe med vores spændende projekter.

Vi arbejder med nyeste teknologi indenfor f.eks. Cloud (Google, AWS & Azure), RESTful API snitflader, Sikkerhed, Webudvikling, Native mobile apps, Microservices, Docker, Kubernetes, Vision, Conversational og Generative AI, Machine Learning og meget andet.

Hvis du brænder for at gøre en forskel for andre og gerne vil udvikle dig både fagligt og personligt, mens du tjener lidt til SU'en, så er det dig vi leder efter.

Om dig


Du er i slutningen af dit studie enten på Datalogi eller Softwareteknologi og brænder for at prøve dine evner af på ægte problemer
Du er en dygtig C#- eller Java udvikler
Du har erfaring med web-udvikling
Du har måske erfaring med appudvikling til Android eller iOS?
Du har måske erfaring med Angular eller React?
Du har erfaring med versionsstyring og samarbejde
Du har et stort drive og er meget selvkørende
Du trives når du arbejder som en del af et hold
Du tager ansvar for egne opgaver
Du er nysgerrig på at lære nye teknologier og har et par hobbyprojekter du udvikler på i din fritid


Hvad Vi Tilbyder

Hos Trifork vil du fra dag 1 blive en del af et af vores projekter, og få et medansvar for at udvikle og designe dele af projektet sammen med dine nye kolleger.

Vi tilbyder en fleksibel arbejdsplads med rig mulighed for at tilpasse både arbejdsplads og –tider så det passer i dit studie. Hos os finder du et afslappet arbejdsmiljø med højt til loftet og kort til bordfodbold og bordtennis bordet.

Ikke mere end 42 mennesker på kontoret

Hvorfor, spørger du så? Vi ønsker at sikre at et kontor ikke bliver for stort, så du altid ved hvem du sidder ved siden af. Ved ikke at have for store kontorer, sikrer vi at have en uformel og afslappet kultur, hvor alle kender hinanden. Det gør også at vi er små autonome enheder og hvor medbestemmelse/indflydelse på hverdagen er en væsentlig faktor. Så på trods af, at Trifork er en virksomhed med mere end 1200 ansatte, så føles det ofte som at arbejde i en startup virksomhed med et stærkt og samarbejdsvenligt miljø, hvor alle kan blive hørt.

Bemærk, screening af ansøgninger vil først finde sted fra uge 33.

Vi ser frem til at modtage dit CV, ansøgning samt karakterblad.
Show more

Title: BI Developer
Place: Humlebæk, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
BI Developer – create value through data

Are you ready to join an agile and highly experienced team on a mission to evolve Business Intelligence in Coloplast through the Microsoft Azure BI stack, Lakehouse and Databricks?

At Coloplast, we have a clear vision for BI and a huge appetite for data. So, seize this opportunity to join a vibrant and expanding team that leverages diverse data sources to drive insights and innovation across the company.

“This is your chance to apply your knowledge of SQL DB, SSAS, data lakes and Databricks to create more value from data at one of the world’s most successful MedTech companies,” says Head of BI Development Jesper Bloch Jensen.

Join our Data team in our Digital, Data and IT organisation

At our HQ in Humlebæk, north of Copenhagen, you will join our inclusive and collaborative Data team of more than 20 BI colleagues, including developers, solution architects and our operations and adoption teams.

Working closely with departments across the organisation, we create methodical roadmaps to manage a diverse project pipeline encompassing Global Operations, Business Support and Innovation. As a global Data function, we leverage numerous source systems, working with a broad range of data from ERP and CRM systems to sensor and app data.

To enhance our existing Azure cloud BI infrastructure, we are currently establishing a real-time and advanced analytics platform using MS Data Lakehouse and Databricks.

“Teamwork is crucial for us, and we like spending time together to discuss good ideas and improve our skills,” continues Jesper.

Get a glimpse into all aspects of BI

Working on a wide range of exciting projects, you will be an important partner to the business. One such project could be establishing the data foundation for reporting on the coming Warehouse Management System with the Global Distribution team, developing a solution for raw material forecasting with the Global Supply Chain team or enabling real-time reporting on ERP data with the Finance team.

Moreover, you will be working with most aspects of the data delivery – from requirement gathering and discussions and analysis to working with ETL, data warehousing, testing and finally handing over the solution to our Operations team.

Specifically, you will


Develop value-adding BI solutions using SQL, DAX, SSAS/Tabular and Python. Both Python and Databricks are capabilities we are currently building, with more extensive use planned for 2024
Build data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and likely Databricks
Plan and run your tasks and BI projects from A to Z
Liaise with the business through workshops to clarify their needs – and challenge them along the way to find the most feasible solutions




“As you’ll follow your projects from start to finish, you’ll not just get a BI support function – but a very active role as a sounding board for the business,” Jesper finishes.

Experience In Microsoft SQL And SSAS

We are looking for an experienced colleague with an interest in BI and analytics, who can maintain a structured approach throughout the entire development process. This also means that you can plan your projects and communicate well with stakeholders across the organisation throughout your projects.

On top of that, you enjoy working in a team and like to engage with your colleagues and stakeholders to elevate data and reporting.

Moreover, we imagine that you


Have experience developing BI solutions using Microsoft SQL DB and SSAS/DAX
Experience within a Lakehouse and Databricks setting is a plus, but not a prerequisite
May have experience working with Power BI or similar frontend tools
Speak and write English effortlessly
Have an appetite for learning new technologies within a dynamic BI field




Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please call Head of BI Development, Digital, Data and IT, Jesper Bloch Jensen on +45 4911 1621. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate has been found .

Due to the upcoming holiday season, our recruitment process may take a bit longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com .

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn . Like us on Facebook .

56951


Show more
HTML:
BI Developer – create value through data

Are you ready to join an agile and highly experienced team on a mission to evolve Business Intelligence in Coloplast through the Microsoft Azure BI stack, Lakehouse and Databricks?

At Coloplast, we have a clear vision for BI and a huge appetite for data. So, seize this opportunity to join a vibrant and expanding team that leverages diverse data sources to drive insights and innovation across the company.

“This is your chance to apply your knowledge of SQL DB, SSAS, data lakes and Databricks to create more value from data at one of the world’s most successful MedTech companies,” says Head of BI Development Jesper Bloch Jensen.

Join our Data team in our Digital, Data and IT organisation

At our HQ in Humlebæk, north of Copenhagen, you will join our inclusive and collaborative Data team of more than 20 BI colleagues, including developers, solution architects and our operations and adoption teams.

Working closely with departments across the organisation, we create methodical roadmaps to manage a diverse project pipeline encompassing Global Operations, Business Support and Innovation. As a global Data function, we leverage numerous source systems, working with a broad range of data from ERP and CRM systems to sensor and app data.

To enhance our existing Azure cloud BI infrastructure, we are currently establishing a real-time and advanced analytics platform using MS Data Lakehouse and Databricks.

“Teamwork is crucial for us, and we like spending time together to discuss good ideas and improve our skills,” continues Jesper.

Get a glimpse into all aspects of BI

Working on a wide range of exciting projects, you will be an important partner to the business. One such project could be establishing the data foundation for reporting on the coming Warehouse Management System with the Global Distribution team, developing a solution for raw material forecasting with the Global Supply Chain team or enabling real-time reporting on ERP data with the Finance team.

Moreover, you will be working with most aspects of the data delivery – from requirement gathering and discussions and analysis to working with ETL, data warehousing, testing and finally handing over the solution to our Operations team.

Specifically, you will

  • Develop value-adding BI solutions using SQL, DAX, SSAS/Tabular and Python. Both Python and Databricks are capabilities we are currently building, with more extensive use planned for 2024
  • Build data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and likely Databricks
  • Plan and run your tasks and BI projects from A to Z
  • Liaise with the business through workshops to clarify their needs – and challenge them along the way to find the most feasible solutions



“As you’ll follow your projects from start to finish, you’ll not just get a BI support function – but a very active role as a sounding board for the business,” Jesper finishes.

Experience In Microsoft SQL And SSAS

We are looking for an experienced colleague with an interest in BI and analytics, who can maintain a structured approach throughout the entire development process. This also means that you can plan your projects and communicate well with stakeholders across the organisation throughout your projects.

On top of that, you enjoy working in a team and like to engage with your colleagues and stakeholders to elevate data and reporting.

Moreover, we imagine that you

  • Have experience developing BI solutions using Microsoft SQL DB and SSAS/DAX
  • Experience within a Lakehouse and Databricks setting is a plus, but not a prerequisite
  • May have experience working with Power BI or similar frontend tools
  • Speak and write English effortlessly
  • Have an appetite for learning new technologies within a dynamic BI field



Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please call Head of BI Development, Digital, Data and IT, Jesper Bloch Jensen on +45 4911 1621. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate has been found .

Due to the upcoming holiday season, our recruitment process may take a bit longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com .

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn . Like us on Facebook .

56951

Title: Senior IT Support Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
IT Technical Support – Join Marsh - the world's leading risk advisory and insurance brokerage firm

With over 45,000 employees across 130 countries, we empower Denmark's largest companies to navigate risks and seize business opportunities through our unrivaled expertise in risk management and insurance consulting. We are app. 150 colleagues in Denmark, eager to welcome you to our great organization.

As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.

Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.

What you can expect:

Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.

Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.

Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.

Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

What you will be rewarded with:


Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and innovation
Continuous learning and development opportunities to improve your skills and advance your career.
Competitive compensation and pension scheme
Global network of professionals providing opportunities for growth and mobility


We will rely on you to:


On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
On- and off boarding of colleagues
Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
Administer and prepare mobile devices.
Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.


What you need to have:


Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
Solid knowledge of software and hardware
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality


What makes you stand out:


Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.


Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.

Title: BI Specialist
Place: Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Business Intelligence Specialist hos Danske Shoppingcentre

Brænder du for data og analyse? Har du en passion for at omdanne information til indsigt, der driver forretningens succes? Så er du måske vores næste Business Intelligence Specialist hos Danske Shoppingcentre.




Bliv en del af en virksomhed i kraftig vækst

Danske Shoppingcentre er en forholdsvis ung virksomhed med en vision om at udvikle vores 17 shoppingcentre til destinationer for fremtidens markedspladser. Vi er markedsledende, og du har sandsynligvis stiftet bekendtskab med et eller flere af vores shoppingcentre såsom Frederiksberg Centret, Lyngby Storcenter, Amager Centret, Kolding Storcenter etc.

Vi søger en passioneret Business Intelligence Specialist til at styrke vores BI-team i Strategi afdelingen, som holder til på vores Service Office i City 2, Taastrup. Teamet består af en Head of Tech, en BI Manager, dig samt en kommende Studentermedhjælper. Du vil referere til Head of Tech og derfor have et tæt samarbejde med BI Manageren, foruden selvstændige ansvarsområder og opgaver.




Udvikling og innovation i højsædet

Som Business Intelligence Specialist hos Danske Shoppingcentre vil du have en afgørende rolle i at omdanne data til værdifuld indsigt. Ved at analysere omsætningstal, kundeadfærd og operationelle processer hjælper du ledelsen med at træffe velinformerede beslutninger på baggrund af data.




Dine primære opgaver inkluderer:

Teknisk Ekspertise: Udvikling af Power BI-rapporter og sikring af, at data leveres i det rette format og form for at understøtte forretningsbeslutninger. Involvering i opbygning og vedligeholdelse af vores datawarehouse og datamodellering m.m. Kendskab til kodning i Python, R eller JavaScript er et stort plus.
Automation: Implementering af automatiseringsløsninger ved brug af RPA-teknologier som Power Automate, Blue Prism, Zapier og Make, som integrerer AI til at optimere og strømline forretningsprocesser.
Forretningsforståelse: Forståelse af forretningsbehov og omsætning af dem til effektive dataanalyser og visualiseringer. Samarbejde med BI Manageren for at fungere som bindeled mellem forretningen og Business Intelligence og sikre, at vores datastrategi understøtter vores overordnede forretningsmål.
Stakeholder Management: Samarbejde med interne og eksterne interessenter for at definere og levere BI-løsninger, der opfylder forretningsmæssige krav. Kommunikation af komplekse tekniske koncepter til ikke-tekniske interessenter vil være en vigtig del af din rolle.
Teknologisk Innovation: Udvikling og opsætning af en ny Microsoft Fabric dataplatform samt implementering af machine learning-teknikker til predictive og prescriptive analytics. Udforskning af generativ AI inden for Business Intelligence for at bruge teknologien til visualisering og besvare ad hoc forretningsspørgsmål.




Dine kompetencer. Vores samarbejde. Sammen skaber vi resultaterne.

Som person trives du i en relationsopbyggende rolle, er nysgerrig, initiativrig og passioneret omkring data og analyse. Din samarbejdsform er løsningsorienteret, og du er vant til at arbejde på tværs af teams og fagligheder.




Desuden forventer vi, at du har:

Erfaring med Power BI, kildeintegration, datamodellering og datawarehouse.
Kendskab til design og udvikling af BI-løsninger inden for Microsoft-teknologier som Azure/Fabric og Power Platformen.
Erfaring med datamanagement og visualisering af analyser i Power BI.
Evne til at oversætte forretningsbehov til relevante analyser og visualiseringer.
Erfaring med kodning i Python, R eller JavaScript er et plus.
Evne til at udarbejde roadmap og pipeline ift. fremtidens datarapportering i Danske Shoppingcentre.
Kundskaber inden for machine learning og en stærk interesse for artificial intelligence.
Erfaring med automation, herunder RPA teknologier så som Power Automate, Blue Prism, Zapier eller Make.
Stærke projektledelsesevner er et stort plus.

Hvis du brænder for at arbejde med data, kunstig intelligens og ønsker at være en del af et ambitiøst team, som agter at udforske den nyeste teknologi, så send din ansøgning og CV til os i dag!




Har du spørgsmål?

Så kontakt vores Head of Tech, Sebastian Krogh, på telefon +45 30 50 60 30, eller Rekrutteringskonsulent William Pokriva på telefon +45 93 80 91 57.




Sådan ansøger du

Klik på linket øverst til højre, send dit CV og fortæl os, hvorfor du brænder for netop denne stilling.

Da vi løbende afholder samtaler, ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt og senest den 31. august 2024.

  • Kendskab til design og udvikling af BI-løsninger inden for Microsoft-teknologier som Azure/Fabric og Power Platformen.
  • Erfaring med datamanagement og visualisering af analyser i Power BI.
  • Evne til at oversætte forretningsbehov til relevante analyser og visualiseringer.

  • Erfaring med automation, herunder RPA teknologier så som Power Automate, Blue Prism, Zapier eller Make.

Så kontakt vores Head of Tech, Sebastian Krogh, på telefon +45 30 50 60 30, eller Rekrutteringskonsulent William Pokriva på telefon +45 93 80 91 57.

Title: DI - Lead Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lead Data Engineer
Om stillingen

DI har en ambitiøs digital strategi, der skal bringe dem tættere på medlemmerne, understøtte vækst og sikre effektiv kommunikation og samarbejde på tværs. Som en del af dette og for at styrke Data & Automations Teamet søger DI en Lead Data Engineer.


Som Lead Data Engineer vil du være med til at opbygge en moderne dataplatform i DI. Du får mulighed for at være med i alle faser – fra analyse, design og udvikling til test, implementering og den måske vigtigste fase, forankringen i hverdagen. Du sætter den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis. Du kan skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.

Afdelingen har ansvaret for dataprocessering og dataløsninger og er godt i gang med at opbygge en dataplatform på Microsoft Azure stacken – startende med et datavarehus og en række analytiske løsninger. Afdelingen har til ansvar at få teknologierne til at tale sammen ved at automatisere og strømline datapipelines.

Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i afdelingen, som er Center of Excellence i forhold til dataplatformen. Du samarbejder tæt med forretningen om at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter gennem bl.a. selvbetjeningsløsninger. I den forbindelse vil du til dagligt være i tæt dialog med forretningen, hvor du også vil agere sparringspartner og indgå i dialog ift. opsætning af integration af data fra forskellige kildesystemer.

Derudover vil dit ansvarsområder bl.a være at:


Være drivende i at opbygge en moderne og mangfoldig dataplatform i DI.

Sætte den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis.

Skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.

Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i forhold til dataplatformen

Af arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. nævnes:


Udarbejde tekniske løsningsforslag, såvel som at estimere opgaver og effektivt kommunikere det til forretningen

Designe, udvikle og implementere dataløsninger, primært til data warehouset

Designe, udvikle og vedligeholde dataplatformen og data pipelines

Bidrage til at udvikle en langsigtet strategi for dataplatformen

Integrere data fra en række kilder, og opbygning af datamodeller

Bidrage til tekniske og forretningsmæssige afklaringer af løsninger

Deltage i udviklings- og projektopgaver i forbindelse med optimering af processer og systemer på tværs af DI.

Om dig

Den ideelle kandidat brænder for data og udvikling og tør udfordre status quo og flirte med cloud teknologi og data arkitektur. Du har fire til otte års erfaring fra en lignende stilling, evt. fra et konsulenthus eller en brancheorganisation, hvor du har haft hands-on erfaring med opbygning af data løsninger. Du har en relevant akademisk baggrund formentlig fra CBS, KU eller ITU med særlig fokus på data. Du er serviceorienteret, hjælpsom og kan være bindeled mellem forretningen og it-specialister. Vi ser gerne at du er fagligt nysgerrig i forhold til nye tendenser og udviklingen inden for datavidenskab, herunder data services i Azure. Derudover arbejder du struktureret og selvstændigt med et analytisk mindset og en metodisk tilgang.

Vi ser gerne at du besidder følgende kvalifikationer:

Ekspert i ETL processen, SQL programmering og datamart modellering iflg. Kimball

Solid erfaring med agil udvikling, gerne med afsæt i Git platformen

Gode kommunikationsevner på både dansk og engelsk

Det er en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du også har erfaring med:


T-SQL og SQL Server automation rammeværk generelt set

Analytiske applikationer, gerne Microsoft Power BI

Microsoft Azure dataplatform (Infrastruktur)

Azure data factory

Derudover er du en person, der tager ansvar for at kvaliteten, af det der leveres, er høj. Du er god til at sætte dig ind i komplekse og fagligt tunge opgaver. Du er resultatorienteret og har stor handlekraft. Det er også vigtigt, at du er vedholdende, også når det kommer til at udvikle dig selv fagligt og personligt, da teamet har stort fokus på det gode kollegaskab, samt at være gode samarbejdspartnere for hele huset. Det er altså vigtigt, at du er i stand til at danne dig en helhedsforståelse af hele DI. Endelig er du en person som har både hjerte og hjerne med på job og er enig med teamet i, at et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø er en nødvendig del af det at gå på arbejde.


Interesseret?


Så klik på linket herunder med det samme. Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt, og vi behandler kandidater løbende. Rekrutteringen faciliteres af vores rekrutteringspartner Kold+Partners. Har du spørgsmål eller brug for mere viden, er du velkommen til at kontakte Peter Kold (2989 0903/peter@koldpartners.com).

Læs mere om DI her.




Show more

Derudover vil dit ansvarsområder bl.a være at:

  • Være drivende i at opbygge en moderne og mangfoldig dataplatform i DI.

  • Sætte den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis.

  • Skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.

  • Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i forhold til dataplatformen

Af arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. nævnes:

  • Udarbejde tekniske løsningsforslag, såvel som at estimere opgaver og effektivt kommunikere det til forretningen

  • Designe, udvikle og implementere dataløsninger, primært til data warehouset

  • Designe, udvikle og vedligeholde dataplatformen og data pipelines

  • Bidrage til at udvikle en langsigtet strategi for dataplatformen

  • Integrere data fra en række kilder, og opbygning af datamodeller

  • Bidrage til tekniske og forretningsmæssige afklaringer af løsninger

  • Deltage i udviklings- og projektopgaver i forbindelse med optimering af processer og systemer på tværs af DI.

Om dig

Den ideelle kandidat brænder for data og udvikling og tør udfordre status quo og flirte med cloud teknologi og data arkitektur. Du har fire til otte års erfaring fra en lignende stilling, evt. fra et konsulenthus eller en brancheorganisation, hvor du har haft hands-on erfaring med opbygning af data løsninger. Du har en relevant akademisk baggrund formentlig fra CBS, KU eller ITU med særlig fokus på data. Du er serviceorienteret, hjælpsom og kan være bindeled mellem forretningen og it-specialister. Vi ser gerne at du er fagligt nysgerrig i forhold til nye tendenser og udviklingen inden for datavidenskab, herunder data services i Azure. Derudover arbejder du struktureret og selvstændigt med et analytisk mindset og en metodisk tilgang.

Vi ser gerne at du besidder følgende kvalifikationer:

  • Ekspert i ETL processen, SQL programmering og datamart modellering iflg. Kimball

  • Solid erfaring med agil udvikling, gerne med afsæt i Git platformen

  • Gode kommunikationsevner på både dansk og engelsk

Det er en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du også har erfaring med:

  • T-SQL og SQL Server automation rammeværk generelt set

  • Analytiske applikationer, gerne Microsoft Power BI

  • Microsoft Azure dataplatform (Infrastruktur)

  • Azure data factory

Derudover er du en person, der tager ansvar for at kvaliteten, af det der leveres, er høj. Du er god til at sætte dig ind i komplekse og fagligt tunge opgaver. Du er resultatorienteret og har stor handlekraft. Det er også vigtigt, at du er vedholdende, også når det kommer til at udvikle dig selv fagligt og personligt, da teamet har stort fokus på det gode kollegaskab, samt at være gode samarbejdspartnere for hele huset. Det er altså vigtigt, at du er i stand til at danne dig en helhedsforståelse af hele DI. Endelig er du en person som har både hjerte og hjerne med på job og er enig med teamet i, at et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø er en nødvendig del af det at gå på arbejde.

Interesseret?

Så klik på linket herunder med det samme. Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt, og vi behandler kandidater løbende. Rekrutteringen faciliteres af vores rekrutteringspartner Kold+Partners. Har du spørgsmål eller brug for mere viden, er du velkommen til at kontakte Peter Kold (2989 0903/peter@koldpartners.com).

Læs mere om DI her.

Title: Internship: Database System Development
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic intern to join our team and help extend our current database system.

Responsibilities


Enhance and extend our existing database system into our robots utilizing MongoDB.
Collaborate with the development team to integrate new features.
Write clean, maintainable code with tests


Requirements


Good knowledge in a programming language (Typescript /JavaScript preferred)
Experience in working with databases (NoSQL is a plus)
Understanding of Object-Oriented Programming concepts


What You Will Gain


Hands-on experience with MongoDB and learn best practices for database design and optimization.
Improve your coding skills, particularly in TypeScript/JavaScript, and learn how to write efficient, maintainable code.
Deepen your understanding of OOP concepts and how to apply them effectively in real-world projects.
Learn industry-standard development practices, including version control, code reviews, and collaborative development workflows.
Enhance your problem-solving abilities by tackling real-world challenges and finding innovative solutions.
Gain insight into the software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies, and understand how to manage and deliver projects successfully.
Work closely with experienced professionals, receive mentorship, and build a strong foundation for your future career.
Show more

  • Experience in working with databases (NoSQL is a plus)
  • Understanding of Object-Oriented Programming concepts

  • Gain insight into the software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies, and understand how to manage and deliver projects successfully.
  • Work closely with experienced professionals, receive mentorship, and build a strong foundation for your future career.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Engineer to a rapidly growing and competent team based in Copenhagen. As a Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and maintaining data architecture solutions. This is an opportunity to work and collaborate with a dynamic team on innovative projects.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement data architecture solutions aligned with business objectives.
Evaluate and enhance existing data models, databases, and systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide strategic recommendations.
Create and maintain documentation related to data architecture processes and best practices.
Ensure data security, integrity, and availability throughout various stages of the data lifecycle.




Required Skills and Experience:

Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role. (4 years +)
Expertise in designing and implementing data solutions using technologies such as: Database Management Systems (e.g., SQL, NoSQL)
Data modeling tools (e.g., ERwin, ER/Studio)
Data warehousing and ETL processes
Cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively within a remote team environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

Advanced degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
Certifications in relevant technologies or data architecture frameworks.
Experience working remotely in a distributed team setup.




Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.

Show more

Title: Vi søger en Senior Data Analyst til nyopstartet afdeling
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Jobbeskrivelse

Nu har du chancen for at spille en helt central rolle i opbygningen af en fremadstormende konsulentvirksomhed, der har sat data højest på udviklingsagendaen. Som den første dedikerede data analytiker medarbejder i data-afdelingen, får du muligheden for at sætte retningen for de kundevendte løsninger og være rammesættende for valg af metode og værktøjer, når vores kunder skal have værdi fra deres data.

Hvem er Sopra Steria?

Sopra Steria er en IT-konsulentforretning med fokus på forskellige kerneydelser og vi hjælper i dag private og offentlige virksomheder med at nå deres ambitioner. Vi kombinerer moderne teknologi og en solid forretningsforståelse og sikrer, at vi finder løsninger som både er attraktive, skaber værdi og er teknisk mulige at gennemføre og implementere. Vi er med fra start til slut.

Siden 2015 har vi været i top-10 som ”Danmarks bedste it-virksomhed” i ”Great Place To Works” årlige undersøgelse, og vi er i høj grad drevet af at skabe et godt, socialt og uformelt arbejdsmiljø med god stemning. Helt fundamentalt er det vigtigt for os, at vores medarbejdere har det godt, og syntes at det er sjovt at gå på arbejde.

Om rollen

Som Senior Data Analyst hos Sopra Steria vil du få ansvaret for at drive den analytiske del af vores data-afdeling, hvilket omfatter dataanalyse fra start til slut. Du forventes at kunne håndtere hele den analytiske leverance af de dataløsninger, vi tilbyder vores kunder.

I denne rolle vil du have omfattende kundekontakt og arbejde tæt sammen med dygtige kollegaer. Sammen med teamet vil du designe data- og informationsarkitekturen, identificere kundens behov og levere værdifulde data-drevne indsigter. Dit bidrag til teamet vil omfatte valg af analysemetoder og værktøjer, som du vil være hovedansvarlig for at implementere.

Da teamet stadig er i opstartsfasen, vil du, ud over dit analytiske bidrag, også være med til at forme data-teamets kultur og arbejdsmetoder. Du vil naturligt samarbejde med forskellige fagområder på tværs af teams og sikre, at de bliver opdateret på vores nye data-tilgang.

Hvem er du?

Du er en analytisk type, der elsker at finde mønstre og indsigter i data. Nogle gange starter du fra bunden med rå data, andre gange optimerer du eksisterende løsninger. Du er begejstret for nye muligheder med analyseværktøjer og metoder, men er også pragmatisk nok til kun at anvende dem, når du ved, de giver værdi.

Som person er du optimistisk og nysgerrig med et stærkt gå-på-mod og en lyst til at drive udvikling gennem data og indsigt. Du sætter pris på at være en del af et team, hvor I hver især kan bidrage med jeres individuelle kompetencer.

For at lykkes i rollen forestiller vi os, at du:


Tidligere har arbejdet med dataanalyse og rapportering
Har erfaring med data-visualiseringsværktøjer (som Power BI eller lign)
Har kendskab til statistiske analyseværktøjer (som R eller SAS)
Har kompetencer inden for SQL og måske Python
Har minimum 5 års erfaring med brug af ovenstående teknologier
Kan identificere muligheder ved nye analysemetoder og hvordan de kan anvendes hos vores kunder
Har lyst til at holde dig opdateret på trends og teknologier inden for data, AI og analytics
Har god energi og en positiv tilgang til tingene


Bliv en del af os

Hos os får du muligheden for at blive en del af en organisation som er i rivende udvikling, du bliver en vigtig del af et godt, socialt og uformelt arbejdsmiljø med god stemning og en flad organisationsstruktur.

Vi Tilbyder


Søde og dedikerede kollegaer, som glæder sig til at arbejde sammen med dig.
En uformel og sjov hverdag på en spændende arbejdsplads med sociale og hjælpsomme kolleger.
Gode muligheder med fokus på både personlig og faglig udvikling: seminarer, konferencer, coaching, sparring, certificeringer mv.
Regelmæssige sociale arrangementer som fredagsbar, onsdagstræning, sommerfest etc.
Fleksibel arbejdsplads med mulighed for at arbejde fra vores kontor i København i kombination med hjemmearbejdsdage.


Lyder det som noget for dig, så skynd dig at sende en ansøgning af sted. Skulle du have spørgsmål til rollen, så kontakt Maria Woxen, Senior Talant Acquisition Advisor på +45 28267302.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig.

Yderligere informationer

Vi er en af nordens førende konsulentvirksomheder inden for digitalisering, innovation og moderne teknologi og gennem mange år har vi været rangeret som en af Danmarks bedste IT-arbejdspladser.

Som en af nordens største konsulentvirksomheder bistår vi store private virksomheder og offentlige organisationer med deres digitale omstilling.

Vi lægger vægt på at skabe værdi for vores kunder og samfundet og har som mål at skabe en bedre og mere bæredygtig fremtid.
Show more

  • Har kompetencer inden for SQL og måske Python

  • Søde og dedikerede kollegaer, som glæder sig til at arbejde sammen med dig.

Title: Analyst, Markets Business Technology Support
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 25134 



Would you like to work in a fast paced environment within Nordea Markets where technology is at the heart of business and continuously improve and secure monitoring, development and availability of trading systems and e-offerings? We are now looking for a colleague in Markets Business Technology Support, within Markets Business Technology, to monitor and support electronic trading systems. You would be working on the trading floor in close collaboration with Sales, Trading and in-house IT Development within the Markets organisation and across Nordea.  At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

About this opportunity 

Welcome to the Markets Business Technology Support. We add value by managing and monitoring front-office applications and processes related to Fixed Income and FX franchises. We do this in close collaboration with business and core technology stakeholders. In Markets Business Technology Support, you’ll play a valuable role in ensuring that Nordea Markets is fully available to customers, financial markets and internal stakeholders.  

What you’ll be doing:

Manage and monitor our electronic Fixed Income platforms and systems, and act as the primary line of defence
Troubleshooting incidents and implementing preventive measures
Working closely with a wide range of stakeholders in Technology and Trading/Sales desks
Participate in inter-team collaboration with business analysts and developers
Be the first point of contact of trading systems and assisting its users
Contributing to documentation and service improvements, new monitoring systems and maintain stability of Trading systems
Bridging the knowledge space between high performance business teams and IT experts
Contributing to various projects and bring forth your own ideas

 

You’ll join a diverse multinational organisation, embedded in the trading organisation with passionate and competent colleagues. The role is based in Copenhagen.



Who you are 

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  

 

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Enjoy supporting and collaborating with colleagues across the trading floor, but also have the ability to work independently and take ownership of your work
Are a self-driven, analytical person with a proactive attitude and a solution oriented mindset
Have the ability to comprehend, analyse, connect, and utilize information in a highly paced environment
Are a reliable team player with great stakeholder management skills 
Are a fast learner and manage to carry out various assignments on different complexity levels
Don’t get stressed about uncertainties but find new ways and methods to approach any obstacle that may occur



Your experience and background: 

Bachelor/Master degree and relevant work experience
Skills within Linux, Kubernetes and SQL
Experience from the banking industry
Good knowledge of Fixed Income products, perhaps from a Front Office position
Experience with automation and/or AI
Excellent communication skills
Professoinal level in English

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 07/08/2024. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Thomas Prehn, Head of Markets Business Technology Support: Email: Thomas.Prehn@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

 

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered. 

Show more

Title: Senior IT Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
For one of our clients in the financial industry, we are currently looking for a Senior IT Analyst to cover the migration of the PayPlus application from SWIFT to Trading Operations AM Team.

Description Of Knowledge And Experience

The position also includes following roles:


Team member (IT Analyst): Projects
Consultation (IT Analyst): Business units
Incidents and problem solving: IT
Second level application support: End User support


Ideally the applicant would have some working experience of following:


3 years of experience in Banking Area (especially payment systems)
5 years of experience in IT Industry
SWIFT in general
XML and XML standards (ISO20022)
Application administration
Application development and tools (basic programming skills)


Technical skills/knowledge:


Mainframe (CICS, JCL, etc)
DB2
Hosting Platforms (Oracle WebLogic, Tomcat)
IBM MQ
Linux (RHEL)
Oracle DB (or SQL in general)
DEVOps
Agile (Scrum or Kanban)


Business skills/knowledge:


MX/MT messages (XML format)
PayPlus (CLS)


Start: 1st of July 2024

Duration: 12 months

Allocation: Fulltime, time & material

Location: Taastrup, hybrid (3 days onsite & 2 days remote)

HTML:
For one of our clients in the financial industry, we are currently looking for a Senior IT Analyst to cover the migration of the PayPlus application from SWIFT to Trading Operations AM Team.

Description Of Knowledge And Experience

The position also includes following roles:

  • Team member (IT Analyst): Projects
  • Consultation (IT Analyst): Business units
  • Incidents and problem solving: IT
  • Second level application support: End User support

Ideally the applicant would have some working experience of following:

  • 3 years of experience in Banking Area (especially payment systems)
  • 5 years of experience in IT Industry
  • SWIFT in general
  • XML and XML standards (ISO20022)
  • Application administration
  • Application development and tools (basic programming skills)

Technical skills/knowledge:

  • Mainframe (CICS, JCL, etc)
  • DB2
  • Hosting Platforms (Oracle WebLogic, Tomcat)
  • IBM MQ
  • Linux (RHEL)
  • Oracle DB (or SQL in general)
  • DEVOps
  • Agile (Scrum or Kanban)

Business skills/knowledge:

  • MX/MT messages (XML format)
  • PayPlus (CLS)

Start: 1st of July 2024

Duration: 12 months

Allocation: Fulltime, time & material

Location: Taastrup, hybrid (3 days onsite & 2 days remote)

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

FP Aquaculture & Ocean Health ApS is dedicated to revolutionizing aquaculture through cutting-edge AI and machine learning solutions. We are a dynamic startup focused on developing innovative technologies to promote sustainable aquaculture practices and protect ocean health. Our technology includes AI-powered underwater low-cost microscopes for early detection of salmon lice, micro jellyfish, and other parasites, with the goal of scaling from a few sensors to several hundred in the next 3-5 years.




Position Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Lead AI Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing advanced AI and machine learning systems, as well as leading the development of API and UI systems that are critical to our operations. You will play a key role in shaping the future of our technology and driving our mission to make aquaculture more efficient and environmentally friendly.




Key Responsibilities

AI & Machine Learning Systems Design: Develop and implement AI models and algorithms to optimize various aspects of aquaculture, including early detection of parasites and water quality monitoring.
API Development: Design and maintain robust APIs to facilitate seamless integration of AI models with our aquaculture monitoring systems.
UI Development: Lead the development of user interfaces to provide actionable insights and real-time data to users, ensuring an intuitive and effective user experience.
Data Analysis and Processing: Analyze large datasets to train and fine-tune machine learning models, ensuring high accuracy and reliability.
System Integration: Work closely with the engineering team to integrate AI systems with existing hardware and software infrastructure.
Collaboration and Leadership: Collaborate with biologists, business developers, and other stakeholders to ensure the technology aligns with our strategic goals. Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior team members.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and continuously improve our systems and processes.




Qualifications

Educational Background: Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Technical Expertise: Proven experience in designing and deploying AI/ML models. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and other relevant tools and frameworks.
API & UI Development: Experience in developing APIs and UIs, with a strong understanding of web technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS) and frameworks (React, Angular).
Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a track record of tackling complex technical challenges.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




What We Offer

Innovative Environment: Work on cutting-edge technologies that have a positive impact on the environment and aquaculture industry.
Collaborative Culture: Join a passionate and diverse team dedicated to sustainability and innovation.
Professional Growth: Opportunities for professional development and career advancement in a rapidly growing startup.




Contact

For further information please reach out to R&D Lead Jesper Lemmich on e-mail jele@fpaqua.com or call to +45 25 44 53 80.
