Title: Systems Engineer for Medical Device
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you an experienced engineer that has a passion for overseeing and documenting the development process for medical devices as per the European MDR?  Then perhaps you could be the newest addition to our R&D Function.




We at Uvisa Health are developing a phototherapy (light-based treatment) solution to the common vaginal infections Bacterial Vaginosis (BV) and Vulvovaginal Candidiasis (VVC / Svamp / Thrush). It is a small, insertable device that is intended as a Point Of Care (POC) solution and reusable.




We are ramping up the development phase, which means that a lot of the groundwork has already been done during the concept phase. Now, as we are establishing a manufacturing partnership, soon entering clinical investigations, continuing to enhance the product, and readying ourselves for submission to a Notified Body (NB), we are seeking an experienced professional in this field to continue the work and take a lead within product management.




We are seeking a person who has some mechanical and/or electronics engineering knowledge, experience of documenting medical device product development, and a comprehensive knowledge of the MDR and other regulations applicable to our device such as ISO 13485, ISO 14971, IEC 60601, IEC 62304, etc. 




They must be comfortable with working in a startup environment, a self-starter that can manage their own workload and prioritisation of activities, highly structured and organised, and a team player who is able to take on additional roles and responsibilities as required.




They will be reporting to the CEO and this is a full-time role, though working hours are flexible.




We expect that all work is conducted on-site in Copenhagen, Denmark. This is not a remote position.




We are hoping to have the role as soon as possible, and applicants will be reviewed on a rolling basis. 




Remuneration will be in the range of 40,000 - 60,000 DKK per month depending on experience.




Roles & Responsibilities

Ensuring compliance to the established Design & Development plans and evolving these as required.
Managing & structuring information related to the entire product development process and technical file including but not limited to; Risk Management File, Design Input Specifications, Design Output.
Planning Verification and Validation (V&V) activities, assisting with executing on the plans, and documenting the output of these.
Working with the Head of Design and the Electronics & Embedded Software Engineer, to contribute expertise to the overall design of the product.
Producing documentation required for the Technical File and the Clinical Evaluation Plan as required as per the European MDR.
Working with the QMS and documenting output of processes followed as per ISO13485.
Project management accountabilities to ensure that deadlines are adhered to and that interdependencies are well managed.
Additional responsibilities as required as the startup matures.




Qualifications & Competencies




Required

Minimum Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Electronics Engineering or other related discipline.
Documented history of working in a similar capacity as eg. R&D Manager, Head of Product Engineering, Systems Engineer, or CTO.
Comprehensive knowledge of the MDR.
Previous experience working under ISO13485 for medical devices.
Fluent in written and spoken English.
Good initiative (must be able to demonstrate).




Bonus

Master’s Degree in a related discipline or other professional qualifications within medical device product development.
Previous experience interfacing with a Notified Body with successful CE certification as a result.
Experience of working with Regulatory Affairs and/or Quality Assurance.
Some knowledge of development of light-based technologies and manufacturing processes for these.

Title: Analyst/Senior Analyst (Analytics, Bangkok-based, Relocation provided)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (WITH RELOCATION PROVIDED)

Location: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote work.)

Get to Know our Team:

As part of the Supply Analytics, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day-to-day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met.

We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

The Opportunity:

As an Analyst/Senior Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Team members within Agoda.

In this Role, you’ll get to:


Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the ‘right questions’, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output)
Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders
Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence
Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations


What you’ll Need to Succeed:


At least 3-5+ years of experience working as an Analyst with experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy/BI
Advanced working knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL
Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau (preferably)
Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, Python (or R)
Bachelor’s degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning technique knowledge (such as hypothesis testing, regression, logistic regression, random forest, etc.)
Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite
Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation
Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business
A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping
Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement
Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources


It’s Great if you Have:


MBA or Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
Program management certifications (e.g. PMI, PRINCE2) to compliment your program management experience
Asian market experience
Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experience

We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
Er du en skarp konsulent med back-end kompetencer og stor interesse i at arbejde med Cloud-tjenester?




Trives du i en ledende og udførende rolle i transformationsprojekter, hvor du hjælper vores kunder med det tekniske, så de kan træffe bedre beslutninger på baggrund af data?




Hvis du er klar til at være på forkant med ny teknologi og ønsker at være blandt de bedste, så kunne du være den stjerne, vi leder efter hos Inspari!




Din afdeling i Inspari

Du vil blive en del af et hold af konsulenter, der består af Data Engineers, forretningskonsulenter og projektledere på forskellige niveauer og med hver sine spidskompetencer.

Vi arbejder i faste teams, hvilket giver gode muligheder for at opbygge tætte kollegiale relationer. Vi arbejder sammen på projekter og prioriterer samarbejde og kommunikation. Det er sjovt og givende at være en del af en enhed, hvor vi har en stor følelse af samhørighed til både det nære og det større Inspari.

Vores projektportefølje spænder bredt over flere industrier og varierede projekttyper. Det, der forener disse projekter, er vores kunders fælles mål om at opnå dybere forståelse for dataanvendelse. Vi er eksperter i at demonstrere og formidle, hvordan vores kunder kan realisere værdien af deres datainvesteringer.




Ansvarsområder og opgaver

I din stilling som Senior Data Engineer hos Inspari vil du påtage dig en række ansvarsområder og opgaver, der omfatter:

At udøve fagligt lederskab og bære ansvaret gennem alle projektets faser, lige fra den indledende analyse og design til den endelige implementering og efterfølgende opfølgning
At fungere som en værdifuld sparringspartner for vores kunder, hvor du gennem dialog, kundebesøg og afholdelse af workshops vil rådgive og vejlede
At håndtere opgaver inden for Data Engineering, herunder ETL-processer (Extract, Load & Transform), SQL & Python-programmering og datamodellering
At arbejde parallelt med flere kunder og aktivt bidrage til at identificere nye forretningsmuligheder samt understøtte pre-sales aktiviteter
At tage ansvar for dit eget budget og sikre dets opfyldelse, samt at bidrage til at engagere og beskæftige teammedlemmer. Dette inkluderer planlægning, organisering og opfølgning på teamets opgaver og aktiviteter
At evaluere og estimere omfanget af tekniske opgaver inden for projektteamet
At sikre, at projektteamet lever op til de fastsatte standarder, metodikker, kvalitetssikringsprocedurer og best practices




Dine kvalifikationer

Vi forventer/forestiller os, at du har:

Dybdegående kendskab til data warehouse-løsninger og erfaring med ETL-processer
Stærke kompetencer i SQL og andre programmeringssprog som Python eller lignende
Evnen til at udvikle vedligeholdelsesvenlig og effektiv kode
Erfaring med at udvikle og optimere store og komplekse data pipelines
Stærke kompetencer i data modellering og back-end udvikling
Erfaring med Microsoft Azure-tjenester og måske kendskab til andre cloud-platforme som Snowflake, Databricks, eller andre




Derudover har du følgende kompetencer:

Besidder en naturlig flair for hurtigt at tilegne dig nye teknologier og værktøjer, hvilket er afgørende i en branche, der konstant udvikler sig
Har stærke analytiske evner til at navigere og forstå komplekse dataflows, strukturer og datamodeller, hvilket er kernen i effektiv datahåndtering
Udviser fremragende kommunikationsevner, der gør dig til en pålidelig rådgiver og sparringspartner for vores kunder og dit team
Har en solid forståelse for forandringsledelse, hvilket er nødvendigt for at guide vores kunder gennem teknologiske transformationer
Er ivrig efter at dele din viden og ekspertise med dine kolleger, hvilket bidrager til et miljø præget af fælles læring og udvikling
Kan omsætte dine observationer og analyser til konkrete, handlingsorienterede anbefalinger, der driver forretningsværdi for vores kunder
Vores forventninger til dig er høje, både personligt og professionelt, men vi forpligter os til at støtte din udvikling hos Inspari, så du kan vokse i rollen som Senior Data Engineer og som en værdifuld del af vores team




”Du får en meget bred viden om rigtig mange forskellige ting, men du har også muligheden for, hvis der er noget, som er superspændende at dykke ned og blive meget specialiseret i det. Det er klart noget af det vigtigste for mig i en arbejdsplads.”

– Mathias Ragn, Senior Data Engineer & Assistant Team Lead




Din tjekliste

Du ønsker at arbejde på et højt fagligt niveau hvor vidensdeling er højt prioriteret blandt kollegaerne
Du motiveres af at transformere forretningsdata til et strategisk beslutningsværktøj og har dermed en afgørende rolle for kundernes fremtidige forretningsfokus
Du vil være en del af en best-in-class virksomhed som især formår at skabe handling bag rådgivningen og de strategiske planer
Du ønsker at udfolde din gode energi og skarpe perspektiver, som gør dig til en eftertragtet problemløser og stærk sparringspartner for kolleger og ledere på alle niveauer
Du værdsætter god opbakning fra kolleger og et overskyggende fokus fra din leder ift. trivsel
Du holder af at have stor fleksibilitet og mulighed for selv at planlægge din hverdag




Vi tilbyder dig

Udover et spændende job og kolleger i verdensklasse kan vi tilbyde dig:
Gode karrieremuligheder og personlig udvikling, herunder løbende træning og uddannelse
At blive en del af vores unikke Heartwork kultur hvor ambitioner og forventninger går hånd i hånd med passion og holdånd
Lækre omgivelser og gode arbejdsforhold
Fleksibel hverdag med rig mulighed for hjemmearbejde
Attraktiv løn, som modsvarer dine kvalifikationer
En aktiv personaleforening der favner bredt i aktiviteter
En arbejdsplads udover det sædvanlige




Lokation: Du vil have en vis rejseaktivitet i Danmark (i landsdelen tættest på kontoret som du tilknyttes), da kundebesøg er en naturlig del af arbejdet som konsulent.




Kontakt os snarest muligt

Vi afholder samtaler løbende og ansætter, når vi har fundet det rette match.

Vi håber, at du vil åbne dialogen med os - hvad end du sender en kort besked på LinkedIn, en video, 3 linjer om din motivation, eller hvordan end det passer dig, kan du jo pege på netop det, der gør, at vi kunne være de rette for hinanden. Dine ord vil blive behandlet fortroligt og læst med ægte interesse og nysgerrighed.




Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at række ud til:

Jakob Jessen, Talent Acquisition Consultant, jjes@inspari.dk, +45 61 95 66 93

Show more
HTML:
Er du en skarp konsulent med back-end kompetencer og stor interesse i at arbejde med Cloud-tjenester?


Trives du i en ledende og udførende rolle i transformationsprojekter, hvor du hjælper vores kunder med det tekniske, så de kan træffe bedre beslutninger på baggrund af data?


Hvis du er klar til at være på forkant med ny teknologi og ønsker at være blandt de bedste, så kunne du være den stjerne, vi leder efter hos Inspari!


Din afdeling i Inspari

Du vil blive en del af et hold af konsulenter, der består af Data Engineers, forretningskonsulenter og projektledere på forskellige niveauer og med hver sine spidskompetencer.

Vi arbejder i faste teams, hvilket giver gode muligheder for at opbygge tætte kollegiale relationer. Vi arbejder sammen på projekter og prioriterer samarbejde og kommunikation. Det er sjovt og givende at være en del af en enhed, hvor vi har en stor følelse af samhørighed til både det nære og det større Inspari.

Vores projektportefølje spænder bredt over flere industrier og varierede projekttyper. Det, der forener disse projekter, er vores kunders fælles mål om at opnå dybere forståelse for dataanvendelse. Vi er eksperter i at demonstrere og formidle, hvordan vores kunder kan realisere værdien af deres datainvesteringer.


Ansvarsområder og opgaver

I din stilling som Senior Data Engineer hos Inspari vil du påtage dig en række ansvarsområder og opgaver, der omfatter:

  • At udøve fagligt lederskab og bære ansvaret gennem alle projektets faser, lige fra den indledende analyse og design til den endelige implementering og efterfølgende opfølgning
  • At fungere som en værdifuld sparringspartner for vores kunder, hvor du gennem dialog, kundebesøg og afholdelse af workshops vil rådgive og vejlede
  • At håndtere opgaver inden for Data Engineering, herunder ETL-processer (Extract, Load & Transform), SQL & Python-programmering og datamodellering

  • At evaluere og estimere omfanget af tekniske opgaver inden for projektteamet
  • At sikre, at projektteamet lever op til de fastsatte standarder, metodikker, kvalitetssikringsprocedurer og best practices


Dine kvalifikationer

Vi forventer/forestiller os, at du har:

  • Dybdegående kendskab til data warehouse-løsninger og erfaring med ETL-processer
  • Stærke kompetencer i SQL og andre programmeringssprog som Python eller lignende
  • Evnen til at udvikle vedligeholdelsesvenlig og effektiv kode
  • Erfaring med at udvikle og optimere store og komplekse data pipelines
  • Stærke kompetencer i data modellering og back-end udvikling
  • Erfaring med Microsoft Azure-tjenester og måske kendskab til andre cloud-platforme som Snowflake, Databricks, eller andre


Derudover har du følgende kompetencer:

  • Besidder en naturlig flair for hurtigt at tilegne dig nye teknologier og værktøjer, hvilket er afgørende i en branche, der konstant udvikler sig
  • Har stærke analytiske evner til at navigere og forstå komplekse dataflows, strukturer og datamodeller, hvilket er kernen i effektiv datahåndtering
  • Udviser fremragende kommunikationsevner, der gør dig til en pålidelig rådgiver og sparringspartner for vores kunder og dit team
  • Har en solid forståelse for forandringsledelse, hvilket er nødvendigt for at guide vores kunder gennem teknologiske transformationer

Title: Reliability Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you feel motivated when developing, implementing and monitoring reliability programs? And are you capable of analysing data meticulously to identify issues and develop solutions that enhance system reliability?




About us

Metro Service is world class when it comes to driverless metro trains. We have a strong focus on reliability and customer satisfaction, which requires expertise and professionalism. In our daily work, this means that we prioritise education, development, and collaboration throughout the organisation. It is easy to collaborate in an organisation like ours, where enthusiasm and morale is high. As a Reliability Engineer at Metro Service, you will be part of a diverse team with people from various backgrounds. Our employees are incredibly helpful, and as a new employee, you will quickly become an integrated part of the team.




Your tasks as a Reliability Engineer will include:

Develop and implement reliability programs to enhance the performance and longevity of metro systems and components.
Collect and analyse reliability and performance data, identifying trends and areas for improvement.
Leverage SAP for effective asset management, maintenance planning, and reliability reporting, ensuring accurate data capture.
Conduct root cause analysis of system failures and create corrective action plans to prevent reoccurrence.
Design and implement strategies for preventive maintenance to improve system reliability and minimize downtime.
Collaborate closely with maintenance teams, operations staff, and other engineering disciplines to meet reliability objectives.
Prepare and present detailed reliability reports and actionable recommendations to senior management.
Lead initiatives focused on enhancing maintenance practices and overall system reliability.




If you would like to learn more about our employees and the work we do, you can visit our website here.




Experienced Reliability Engineer with a well-equipped toolbox

To succeed in this role, it is important that you have experience with CMMS (we use SAP) and proven experience in data analysis and reliability metrics.




Additionally, we are looking for someone who has:

A bachelor's or master’s degree in engineering, project management, or a related field.
5 years of experience in reliability engineering.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to conduct detailed failure analyses.
Strong project management skills and the ability to lead cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
The ability to express themselves clearly in written and spoken English.




Moreover, it is beneficial to be certified in RCM or Reliability Engineering (e.g., CRE) as well as proficiency within the Office package (Microsoft Word, Outlook, Project, Excel, PowerPoint).




We value candidates who are driven by innovative solutions based on analysis of data, who enjoy working with cross-functional teams, and who can lead projects so that initiatives will be implemented and understood by different stakeholders.




Why work at Metro Service?

We have a great canteen where you pay when having lunch or breakfast. You will also receive a good health insurance and pension scheme. Additionally, we have a lot of social events such as bowling trips, summer parties, Copenhagen Pride, DHL-relay, Cycling for Cancer, etc. We have an internal health clinic where you can get massages, acupuncture, and foot therapy at a very good price, and we also cover a large part of your fitness subscription.




There will be opportunities for working from home.




Do you have any questions about the position?

In this role, you will report to the Maintenance Director, Teddy Frank. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Teddy at +45 2965 9162.




Diversity is our strength, and we encourage all interested individuals to apply regardless of religion, gender, or ethnic background. If this sounds like something for you, please send your application to us via the link – we are looking forward to hearing from you.




Application deadline: August 15th, 2024

Start date: As soon as possible

Working hours: Full-time

Workplace: Metrovej 3, 2300 København S and Vasbygade 16, 2450 København SV

Website: www.metroservice.dk

Show more

Title: Microsoft Solution Engineer - $450 per day - Fully REMOTE - Long term contract
Description:
Microsoft Solution Engineer

$450 per day

Fully REMOTE from EU

B2B, Long term contract




Responsibilities:

Provide technical leadership and guidance for the design, configuration, and development of M365 products, Power Platform, SharePoint, and associated .NET/SQL components.
Lead technical analysis and design of Microsoft solutions, including conceptual and functional prototypes, and develop solution design documents based on business needs.
Oversee M365/Power Platform application development, support coding standards, frameworks, components, and interfaces, ensuring technical governance.
Act as the primary technical interface between the Project Team and managed service providers (MSPs), presenting reports, monitoring trends, and escalating risks and issues.




Skills/Experience Required:

Advanced University Degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field.
Proven experience in managing large-scale IT development and implementation projects, specifically Microsoft 0365 and SharePoint, with 9 years of relevant professional experience.
Strong organizational skills, excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills.
Experience with delivering ICT service to users in developing countries or similar environments.
Certifications within the Microsoft Certification Program and knowledge of national or international regulatory frameworks on the protection of personal data.

Title: Junior Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
We’re looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you’ll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You’ll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more.

What You’ll Do


You’ll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10’s of billions of data points per day!!)
You’ll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, and helping us understand how to improve and optimise our member's experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in statistics, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career.
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation across all areas of the product development lifecycle. You will use SQL and data visualisation skills to translate technical problems into actionable recommendations for product managers.
You will make contributions to the data model and contribute to building out data pipelines
You’ll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, analytics managers, and analytics engineers PLUS, you’ll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc.


About You


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with complex datasets.
Foundational coding experience (e.g. SQL. Python, R, Matlab, SAS, Java)
Experience with data visualisation
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methods.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present findings to non-technical audiences.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Detail-oriented mindset and a strong commitment to accuracy.
Internships, coursework, or projects involving data analysis or business intelligence are a plus.
Eagerness to learn and develop new skills in data analysis and business insights.

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge that gives you the chance to use your knowledge and passion for Data Analysis to take Customer Insights at Selfridges to the next level? Looking for a company that wants to help further your career as well as provide you with an exciting, inspiring, and fun place to work?

If the answer to all of these questions is ‘yes’ then you’re just the kind of person we’re looking for!

Selfridges has a brilliant opportunity within the Customer Analytics Team, reporting to the Senior Customer Analytics Manager. As a Customer Data Analyst, you will have the exciting and rare chance to work in a fast-paced environment, to help us take our business to the next level

THE ROLE

As a Customer Analyst, some of your main responsibilities will be:

Provide weekly and monthly reports on key customer KPIs understand the drivers of their performance
Providing actionable insights of the back of analysis completed on customer and transactional data, using SQL.
Work with fellow analysts to create accessible, relevant, and actionable reports and Power BI dashboards, using multiple sources of data.
Own projects end-to-end and manage the process.
Champion a culture of self service by ensuring your stakeholders are suitably skilled in how to use our analytics tools.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

SQL knowledges and experience building Power BI or Salesforce Einstein Analytics dashboards – Already experience using Power BI is a bonus
Proven experience dealing with large, complex datasets of different varieties (e.g. digital data, transactional data, marketing data) and evidence of being able to transform data into actionable insights
Strong Excel skills, including pivot tables and aggregation of data
Time management skills: Ability to meet deadlines while dealing with multiple priorities.
Passionate about the customer - you are passionate about improving the customer experience through delivering actionable insight
Impeccable attention to detail
A passion for solving new problems, learning new skills and furthering your understanding along the way.

Show more

  • Own projects end-to-end and manage the process.
  • Champion a culture of self service by ensuring your stakeholders are suitably skilled in how to use our analytics tools.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • SQL knowledges and experience building Power BI or Salesforce Einstein Analytics dashboards – Already experience using Power BI is a bonus
  • Proven experience dealing with large, complex datasets of different varieties (e.g. digital data, transactional data, marketing data) and evidence of being able to transform data into actionable insights
  • Strong Excel skills, including pivot tables and aggregation of data
  • Time management skills: Ability to meet deadlines while dealing with multiple priorities.
  • Passionate about the customer - you are passionate about improving the customer experience through delivering actionable insight
  • Impeccable attention to detail
  • A passion for solving new problems, learning new skills and furthering your understanding along the way.

Title: Graduate - Data Analyst
Description:
Are you eager to get into the emerging world of Data and work with the latest technologies? Do you have great attention to detail and strong analytical skills? How would you like to work for Leasing Company of the Year?

If your answer is 'yes' to all of these, keep reading.

Key Dates


Application open date - 5th June 2024
Application close date - 21st July 2024
Assessment centre date - 8th October 2024
Interviews - 17th and 18th October 2024
Start date - 18th November 2024
Length of programme - 2 years


Want to know a little about us?

At Novuna Vehicle Solutions, we're passionate about building a better tomorrow. Which is why we're lighting the way in the electric vehicle revolution. From family cars to HGVs, we're helping customers of all kinds on their journey to carbon-free mobility.

We're proud to be a Top 50 Inclusive employer. We're a signatory of the Women in Finance and the Race at Work Charter and we're DisabilityConfidentCommitted.

What does the role involve?

As a Data Analyst Graduate, you will be joining the Risk team within our Vehicle Solutions business unit. During the two-year programme, you will play an active part in working on cutting-edge projects, analysing data to uncover insights and trends, supporting with data-driven decision making across Vehicle Solutions. You'll get the chance to spend time in several key business areas, including Data Modelling, Data Quality, Data Visualisation and Data Stewards, so you'll certainly have plenty of opportunities to develop yourself as a professional, and potential leader.

Our office is based in Newbury but we're passionate about hybrid working,attendance at the Newbury office is a minimum of 2 days per week. On occasions, you may be required to travel to our Trowbridge office based on business requirements.

Some Of Your Key Duties Will Include


Design and implement analytics and build Power BI dashboards and visualisations for business functions
Model, reshape and prepare data using SQL and Power BI to optimise dashboard performance
Create reports to communicate your findings to stakeholders, providing insights that support business strategies and decision-making
Working with the wider VS Data Team, contributing to data modelling and report & visualisation requirements, testing and analysis activities


In addition to your role above, as part of the Novuna Graduate Programme you will have the opportunity to:


Graduate from our industry accredited Aspiring Leaders programme
Play an active role within our Corporate Communities, helping to drive engagement, inclusion and belonging
Access trained mentors who can help develop your technical skills
Meet regularly as a cohort with our CEO, and have contact with other Executive Committee and Senior Leaders in the business


Beyond this, you'll continue to grow your career at Novuna through development conversations with your people leader.

What are we looking for?

You'll have recently graduated and achieved a 2:2 or above in your chosen degree.

In an ever-evolving environment you will flourish by using your talent for spotting opportunities to make things better. You'll have the ability to navigate relationships using your interpersonal skills, think creatively, be adaptable and last but certainly not least, have a passion for learning.

We're Also Looking For a Graduate Who Can


Work with and collaborate with others
Plan their own day and prioritise work
Adapt to change quickly and positively
Think differently and outside the box


What can we offer you?

At Novuna we take our people promise seriously. If you join us, you'll have a chance to make a difference, opportunities to learn, and time to shine.

Our Offer To You Includes


Starting salary of £30,000, increasing to £32,000 in Year 2
Up to 15% bonus, linked to company and individual performance
Flexible hybrid working
25 days' holiday, plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell 5 days
Full wellbeing package including BUPA, digital GP service, 24/7 employee assistance, plus wellbeing events throughout the year
Up to 10% contributory pension
Flexible benefits options such as cycle to work, discounted personal finance and insurance


Want to know what it's like to be on a Novuna Graduate Programme? See what some of our graduates have to say - Graduate | Launch Your Career with Novuna's Graduate Opportunities

What's the next step?

Interested? Start your application today and see what Novuna can offer you.

Novuna has been named one of the top 50 most inclusive employers for the fourth year running and this is also reflected in our recruitment process. We are committed to ensuring our application process is inclusive and accessible to all candidates.

We're DisabilityConfidentCommitted, so if you're a person with a disability, if you're neurodivergent, or if you have a condition that you believe may affect your performance during our selection process, we'll be happy to make reasonable adjustments to our processes for you.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Junior Data Analyst

Location - London

Salary - £30k-£45k (DOE)




Join a revolutionary Financial services company based in the heart of London. Helping over 200,000 business across the UK and Europe overcome challenging events and increase profits.




They are looking for a Junior Data Analyst who is passionate about finance and leveraging data to drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in analysing financial data sets, generating actionable insights, and supporting business operations through data-driven analysis.




Responsibilities:

Analyse raw financial data: assess quality, cleanse, and structure for downstream processing.
Generate accurate and insightful reports to support financial forecasting and market analysis.
Collaborate closely with the finance team to support analytical projects and business initiatives.
Provide actionable insights for business improvements based on data analysis.
Build interactive dashboards for senior stakeholders and clients to provide actionable insights.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, etc.).
Basic understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical methods, and data visualisation.
Proficiency in a programming language (Python, SQL) for data analysis and reporting tasks.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) for handling and visualising financial datasets.




Additional Skills (Preferred):

Experience working with financial data or related domains.
Knowledge of financial market dynamics and trends.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Passion for learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in data analysis and finance technology.




Benefits:

Competitive salary package.
Annual Bonus
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative finance environment.
Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools for data analysis.
Career development and growth opportunities within the company.




We would love to hear from you if you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making. Apply now to join our team and help shape the finance industry's future.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

A leading company in the CBD industry is seeking a passionate and motivated Junior Data Analyst to join their innovative team in Central London. This organisation is dedicated to delivering comprehensive CBD products and services, emphasizing sustainable, natural, and organic solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Market Research: Conduct thorough market research to gather and analyze data on industry trends, consumer behavior, and competitive landscape.
Data Analytics: Perform data collection, cleansing, and analysis to generate actionable insights. Utilize statistical tools and software to interpret complex data sets.
Direct Reporting: Act as a direct report to senior team members, providing accurate and timely data analysis and insights.
Presentation Work: Prepare and deliver clear, concise, and compelling presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, R, Python, or SQL.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organisational skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
Prior experience in market research or data analytics is a plus.




This position would suit someone who is a recent graduate from a top-tier university with an environmental data background. To apply for this position, please apply with your most up to date CV.

Title: Data Analyst (Python)
Description:
About the Company: A great opportunity to join a highly ambitious, London-based, food & drink consultancy on a mission to support our customers with expert data insight. They are one of the leading consultancies in the food and drinks industry, and provide expert consultancy through data and insight, powered by analytical thinking, outstanding expertise, and insights technology. They work with a broad range of clients emerging brands and operators and some of the most renowned businesses.




About the Role: They are looking for a Data Analyst confident in Python, SQL and GitHub to join their growing data team, this is more than a standard data role.




Responsibilities:

Restructure and maintain data into a database-friendly multi-table format for all product trackers and bespoke research.
Implement systems to help the optimization of data efficiency and data quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources to enrich internal data.
Assist in the identification, design, development, and maintenance of new and existing data tools and applications.
Troubleshooting databases and BI tools to ensure minimal client disruption.
Set up and maintenance of automated data processes.
KPI tracking
Analysing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.




Qualifications:

Previous experience working with survey data
Working experience in Python and GitHub a non negotiable
Strong understanding of relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server).
Advanced Excel data handling and modelling.
Analytical and problem-solving skills to spot trends, errors and highlight / rectify.
Understand the process of acquiring, cleansing, and transforming data.
Dashboard building
Web analytics and behavioural tracking (i.e., Google Analytics)




Pay range and compensation package:35k-37k

Hybrid: 2 x days in London a week

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Graduate Data Analyst Opportunity - Become an Expert in Business Change and IT Transformation




Bristol | Permanent | £25,000




Eager to springboard your career into the exhilarating world of Business Change? Look no further! Here’s an exclusive opportunity to join ea Change, a renowned firm committed to shaping the next generation of Change and IT leaders.




About us

ea Change, with over two decades of expertise in managing Business and IT transformations, is at the forefront of facilitating meaningful, lasting change for clients across the spectrum. With a firm foundation in fostering long-lasting partnerships, we're committed to upskilling and developing future leaders through our Futures Programme. We pride ourselves on a culture that prioritises diversity, inclusion, kindness, integrity, and most importantly, people.




Responsibilities

As a Graduate Data Analyst, you would instantaneously become a pivotal resource onsite for one of our clients, collaborating closely with senior staff and working end-to-end on a project lifecycle. Your role is crucial in contributing to nationwide Change and IT project success; it’s dynamic, exciting, and no week is similar to the last.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project scope and objectives.
Develop and maintain project plans, ensuring alignment with organisational goals.
Assist in the identification and mitigation of project risks.
Communicate project progress and updates to stakeholders.
Work closely with IT professionals to ensure successful project implementation.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of project management processes.




Requirements

Possession of a technical undergraduate degree
Right to work in the United Kingdom
Strong soft skills, excellent communication abilities
Exceptional problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail
Strong GCSE and A-Level grades (or equivalent)
A passionate interest in Change and IT




Benefits

Fully funded accredited qualifications
Bespoke flexible training
A health cash plan
26 days holiday, among other benefits
Regular mentoring and personal development
Access to a comprehensive learning portal
Opportunities for progression and a robust fast-track into Business Change
Hybrid working and commercial exposure




At ea Change, you will find a vibrant community that wholeheartedly believes in pushing boundaries, embracing innovation, and celebrating diversity. We assure an ambience where everyone is encouraged to express themselves, contributing to our shared goal of shaping the future of business success.




How to Apply

If you're captivated by this opportunity and fit the bill, we'd be thrilled to hear from you so kindly submit your up-to-date CV. Together, let's shape the future!

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Location-Stockport , UK

This role is ideal for professionals or graduates who enjoy working with large data sets, have an interest in statistical modelling and would relish the opportunity to be involved in the data reporting process for both internal and external clients, as well as contributing to the thought leadership and application of data driven solutions to wider business needs.

Responsibilities:


Uncover great insights that inform our clients decision making through regular and bespoke reporting. The Data Analyst identifies the key brand and market trends through interrogation and the manipulation of complex data sets
Work independently and as part of a team to create blueprints for new methodologies and drive improvement to existing products delivering a first-class service to the broader business
Working closely with experienced Senior Analysts, you will rapidly develop your technical skills to ultimately play a crucial role in the delivery of outstanding market intelligence
Collaborate closely with different teams in a culture that celebrates the exchange of ideas and encourages innovation. You will work with internal stakeholders, consulting on analytical projects and presenting solutions to teams with varying degrees of technical knowledge
Keep up to date with industry news and understand the company’s goal to provide expert data and creative insight. You will play a pivotal role developing new services, helping to shape the next stage of growth for the company


Requirements:


Educated to degree level in a STEM subject (or equivalent)
Ideally some experience in SQL and/or Python coding languages
Comfortable with basic statistical methods such as Measures of Central Tendency, Correlation, Logistic Regression, Non-linear Regression and Hypothesis Testing
Confident mining data from various data sources, interpreting it and communicating findings numerically and in written form in layman’s terms
Interest in data visualisation and storytelling with data, knowledge and experience in Excel and Power BI is desirable but not essential
Passionate about building strong relationships with internal stakeholders
Has a love of the out of home industry and is curious about the products sold in bars and restaurants as well as the people who visit them
Intelligent, ambitious, and highly motivated individual
Enjoys working autonomously and is a strong team player
Confident and articulate. Will be required to speak, present, and contribute to groups within the company. May occasionally be required to discuss projects with clients


Must have an analytical and investigative mind, with a strong ability and desire to learn.

We Offer:


Generous holiday entitlement and holiday buy-back scheme
Enhanced maternity, adoption, and shared parental leave policy
Bravo! Peer to peer recognition platform
AXA Private medical healthcare
Fidelity Pension scheme
We operate a hybrid approach with the opportunity to work from home


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst: £30k-£60k – London (Hybrid/Remote)




My client a leading financial service organisation are looking to build out their teams capabilities through the acquisition of a new Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will be responsible for gathering, processing, and analysing data to help drive informed business decisions. If you are passionate about data, possess strong analytical skills, and enjoy problem-solving, we want to hear from you!




This role will be operating in a standalone capacity and will see you liaising with C Level business stakeholders whilst relaying and explaining technical information to non-technical business teams. This role will also have a lot of scope for personal development with the successful candidate hopefully working their way up in seniority within the team.




This role will be based remotely, although travel into the London office would be required once per month.




All candidates must have the full right to work in the UK!




Responsibilities:

Collect and analyse data from various sources to support business objectives.
Develop and maintain databases, data systems, and data analytics tools.
Perform detailed data analysis and create reports to identify trends and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular data audits and validation.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner




Requirements:

Experience in a Data Analytic role (preferably in financial services)
Advanced Excel skills
Power BI
Python (Desirable)
Experience presenting data and excellent communication skills
Knowledge, experience, or interest in AI capabilities




Benefits:

Competitive bonus scheme




If the above role is of interest and you’ve got the required experience, apply with your most up to date CV for immediate consideration and interview!




Alternatively, if you would like to find out more about the position, reach out to me on 020 3920 8833 or at ethan.chesterfield@intechnologygroup.com

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Reports to: Insights Manager

Direct Reports: none

Location: London

A role with Kooth is an exciting chance to join a fast growing business with a social purpose. Our mission is to provide welcoming and effective digital mental health support across the UK.

Kooth is a fast-growing business with a social purpose. Listed on the London Stock Exchange (LSE:KOO), our mission is to provide welcoming and effective digital mental health support.

Working in partnership with the NHS, we are already the UK's largest digital mental health platform for young people aged 10-25. We use the collective insight from over one million hours of professional support we have provided to guide people to self-help, community support, and professional help that matches their wants, needs, and goals in life.

Role Objective:

Enable data driven decisions, clinical excellence and commercial success throughout Kooth, by the provision of data and insights via dashboards, reporting and pieces of analysis, using data manipulation and visualisation tools to access Kooth's data model.

Main responsibilities:


Support evidence based Product Development through analysis of service user behaviour
Enable commercial success through delivery of insights and narrative aligned to strategic communication
Support research team in the delivery of Clinical and Economic Evaluations
Provide data and insights to enable optimisation of clinical and service delivery processes
Optimise dashboards with new data points and improved functionality
Optimise data model through the addition of new data points and efficiency improvements, allowing for complex analysis and faster end use
Work closely with function leads and Insights Team colleagues, in translating insights requirements into work plans
Communicate progress, issues and blockers on tasks and projects



Requirements


Demonstrative experience using Tableau, and an awareness of Tableau Prep
Good understanding of Programming languages such as PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Python
Thorough visualization and data analysis skills
SQL experience
Good time management and strategic planning skills
High levels of attention to detail and accuracy when working
Passion for mental health
Excellent collaboration and communication skills
A degree in a relevant subject such as Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics



Benefits


Are you looking for a fulfilling career with attractive perks and a supportive work environment? Look no further! We're excited to offer an incredible opportunity with a range of benefits that cater to your professional growth, well-being, and work-life balance.


Competitive Salary:


Dependant on experience, up to £35,000


Generous Annual Leave


Enjoy 28 days of annual leave, in addition to public holidays, providing you ample time to recharge and spend quality moments with your loved ones.


Professional Development


Benefit from our yearly professional training programmes, tailored to your career aspirations and designed to enhance your skills and knowledge.


Financial Security


Secure your financial future with our pension contributions and annual company share option awards, giving you a stake in the success of the company.


Health and Well-being


Prioritize your health and well-being with our comprehensive AXA plan and access to an Employee Assistance Programme (EAP). The EAP offers 24/7 telephone mental health support and access to GP consultations, ensuring your mental and physical health are taken care of.


Life Assurance:


Gain peace of mind knowing that you're covered with life assurance, providing up to four times your annual salary to your loved ones in the unfortunate event of your passing.


Flexible Working


Embrace the flexibility of remote working, allowing you to create a work-life balance that suits your needs and maximizes your productivity.


Lifestyle Benefits


Participate in the Cycle to Work Scheme, promoting a healthy and eco-friendly lifestyle, and take advantage of our Incapacity Income Protection to safeguard your financial stability in case of unforeseen circumstances.

If you're seeking a stimulating career where your well-being, growth, and contributions are valued, we invite you to apply and become a part of our dynamic and supportive team. Join us as we strive for success together!

At Kooth, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace that values and embraces the unique contributions of every individual. We believe in equal opportunities for all, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression or sexual orientation.

Our dedication to creating a fair and unbiased environment is reflected in all aspects of our recruitment, hiring, and employment practices. We strive to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination, where every employee is treated with respect and dignity.

Request for Reasonable Adjustments:

We are dedicated to providing reasonable adjustments to applicants and employees with disabilities or individuals who require accommodations to participate in the application process, interviews, or job-related tasks. If you require any reasonable adjustments to ensure your equal participation in our recruitment process, please inform our Human Resources team.

Your openness will allow us to work together to provide appropriate accommodations and ensure a fair and accessible application and employment experience for everyone.

Kooth plc is committed to our responsibilities for safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults . We are committed to recruiting candidates who share this commitment to safeguarding, and therefore we apply robust recruitment and selection procedures to ensure that the people selected are right for the job, and that all candidates are appropriately screened prior to appointment. This will include a DBS check.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Excel - Healthtech - Remote - £32,000 + Bonus




Scalexperts are partnered with a Healthtech SaaS business, who partner with a huge proportion of the countries healthcare organisations in helping them to optimise their spend. Due to their continued success & growth, this has led to vast amounts of data being shared by their partners which means there is the opportunity to uncover more insights from data and deliver more value.




They are looking for an inquisitive individual to help uncover opportunities and trends in spend data which will help develop insights for their customers. The role will involve engaging proactively with the customers, sharing new opportunities and a new approach to their data. What will make someone successful in this role is the drive to deliver value through data, and a real knack for problem solving. Anyone who has experience of working with large and complex datasets will be at an advantage, as will those who have experience of working with data sets to analyse spending.




Experience in an analytical role, dealing with large, unstructured and complex data sets
Excellent at problem solving
Good Excel skills - knowledge of vlookups and pivot tables is essential
Previous experience in a role with client engagement and stakeholder management would be high beneficial
Able to work as part of a wider team, whilst also being self-motivated




The team works primarily remote and tend to meet up in London once a month

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Commercial Intelligence Analyst - Sponsorship is not available for this role




Location: Oxford, United Kingdom




Salary: Competitive Market Rate on offer




Hybrid Working Model (3 Days a week on site)




A global, rapidly expanding Energy Research client who provides clients with data-driven intelligence for strategy, portfolio management and investment decisions on the global energy transformation is on the look-out for a Commercial Intelligence Analyst to join the Commercial arm of their business.




You will work in a dynamic multi-national team playing a key role in collecting, processing and reporting key data supporting all aspects of commercial and operational activities. You will combine a strong analytical mindset, the ability to answer unstructured data questions, and interpersonal relationship skills with an interest in energy markets and the transition towards a more sustainable world.




This role would be ideal for a candidate at an earlier stage of their career who is looking to develop a skillset in analytics and reporting with a focus on commercial management.




Key Responsibilities:

Producing existing reporting regarding the Commercial Teams’ KPIs and sales activity, and producing new reporting to provide further analysis, clarity or to increase the efficiency of reporting production
Work with various stakeholders to produce clear, accurate analysis relevant to their needs
Provide bespoke analysis of commercial performance for one-off deep analysis
Administrate and keep various databases and datasets up to date
Working within the Commercial Systems & Intelligence team to improve administrative and operational processes, and to carry out some of those processes
Conduct market research and business intelligence to support the Commercial team




Required attributes:

A high level of numerical & analytical competence
Experience in analysing and manipulating numerical data
An ability to understand unstructured data questions to carry out analysis to provide a suitable answer
Experience with Microsoft Excel ideally including lookups; pivot tables; sumifs; countifs
An ability to effectively prioritise and manage your own time and tasks
Excellent organisation skills and a high degree of persistence and diligence
A can-do attitude and willingness to help wherever needed e.g. improving internal systems and processes
Ability to communicate and collaborate with both technically and non-technically minded parties
Outstanding written and verbal communication as well as interpersonal skills
Evidence of performing well in team-oriented environments
Enthusiasm and curiosity about the energy transition




Please reach out for further information:

joe@paritasrecruitment.com

Title: Data Analyst (Mid-Level)
Description:
Python I AWS I Django I Data Science I Typescript I Node




WeDo have exclusively partnered with a business who continue to go from strength to strength. They have built an exceptional client portfolio off the back of a strong reputation for seamless delivery. This delivery is based around a suite of products focussing on Wealth Management.




Below is a brief summary outlining the desired skills. It is worth saying at this time that the client are very pragmatic and would rather someone show the necessary aptitude to upskill and "grow" with the business. The below also outlines the tech execution stage of the project roadmap and in the early days, the problem solving/analysis stage is arguably more important.




Collect, process, and analyse large datasets consisting of shareholder and investment data.
Develop and implement a solution using Python, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and where applicable, the associated tooling (e.g., Jupyter and Node.js). Django is the preferred in-house framework
Implement data pipelines to manage and process data (e.g., leverage the API associated with an online application service) and delivery code outputs (e.g., shareholder correspondence) to secure cloud storage objects (e.g., AWS S3).




There are several projects pipelined with similar tooling. All within the investment space. You will take the lead when it comes to stakeholder engagement and subsequent tech execution. The position therefore lends itself to someone who in the early days, is happy operating as an individual contributor.




2 stage interview with expected turnaround time of 2 weeks.




This is a remote-first position which requires you to be based in the UK. Unfortunately, no Sponsorship with this one.




Python I AWS I Django I Data Science I Typescript I Node

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Inigo




We enable your ambition. We insure good people – knowledgably, fairly, and efficiently. We combine our expertise with the best of science, data, and analytics.




Inigo's aim is to create an underwriting focused insurance and reinsurance business, concentrating on limited classes. We want to combine the best data and analytics that exist and build our own capability to generate insights to drive business decisions. At the top of our agenda is to create a diverse and open culture where we foster talent and provide opportunities to build a rewarding career in a company that is vibrant and at the start of an exciting journey.

We have a culture that is inclusive, fun, and constantly strives for excellence, we describe it as ‘all in’. Our values are:




Get Smart – we ask questions, explore, learn, and continuously strive for excellence
Park the Ego – we are welcoming and open, and embrace different thinking
Share the Passion – we collaborate and communicate our expertise honestly and thoughtfully
Radical Simplicity – we are transparent, focused and actively avoid complexity in how we operate




Aim of the role




The aim of the role is to support the actuarial reserving team as well as the finance team. The candidate will work closely with the actuarial and finance teams to support various analytical tasks, including data collection, cleansing, and analysis. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.




The successful candidate will do this by:




Being the data manager and extracting, treating and cleansing data in order to have accurate and complete data for the reserving and finance process
Identifying and addressing data quality issues, including correcting data errors and capturing missing business information
Automating tasks in Alteryx or Power BI
Maintaining current Alteryx and Power BI models
Identifying opportunities to streamline data processes and enhance data quality though process and model improvements
Validating and reconciling data across multiple systems and providing reports to actuaries and management
Ensuring the data tools provide appropriate, complete and accurate data
Working with IT so they are aware of changes to tools and databases that may impact corporate systems or databases
Providing data to different stakeholders (Reserving, Pricing, Capital, Finance)




In addition to the above key responsibilities, you may be required to undertake other duties from time to time as the Company may reasonably require.




To do this, we’re going to need you to bring:




Experience in data analysis for Non-Life business
Experience with dealing with large amount of data
High proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of individuals in a variety of functions (e.g. finance, claims, underwriting, actuarial, operations)
Ability to deliver results under tight deadlines
Good problem-solving abilities

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A global management consulting firm is urgently seeking experienced Data Strategy & Advisory Consultants to join and help expand their Data & Analytics practice at the Manager / Principal Consultant level.




Our client is looking for a Subject Matter Experts in Data & Analytics with a Management Consulting background, where you will be involved in delivering strategic advisory services to client senior stakeholders, where you will be leading efforts in assessing the maturity of clients’ Data, Analytics and AI capabilities through multiple methods.




The ideal candidate should hold a combination of experience across some of the following areas:




Data Management
Analytics & Insights
Business Intelligence
Data Visualisation
Data Modelling
Data Architecture
Data Quality
Data Governance
Big Data
Data Warehousing
Data Migration
AI Analytics
Data Science
Data Strategy




The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 4years of experience and come from a Management Consulting background.




This is a unique opportunity to join a rapidly expanding Data & Analytics practice driving Data Strategy & Advisory with a range of exciting clients. This organisation offers a hybrid working environment, has excellent training & career development as well as a streamlined promotion process with excellent remuneration offered.




Further to the above, you must have full right to work in the UK without sponsorship. It is also essential that you come from a consulting background for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Central London

Up to £70k + Bonus

Permanent




HL11367




Finatal is exclusively partnered with a Global Legal & Tech Advisory business in its second Private Equity lifecycle and is going through rapid growth, having exited at 4.5X. They are on a strong buy-and-build journey and are at the beginning of their data journey. They are searching for their first data hire to work across the organisation to drive a data culture and lead data-led decision-making through optimising reporting. Reporting to the CFO you will develop critical reports across finance and other areas of the business taking ownership of rolling out Power BI to the wider organisation.




Role:

Joining the business at the beginning of their journey you will use your strong technical ability to pull data from multiple sources including NetSuite to develop detailed analysis and give visibility to the C-suite.
You will have ownership of Power BI visualisation tool, ensuring it is rolled out efficiently and seamlessly across the business.
Developing intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports, presenting back to key stakeholders across the business giving recommendations and key insights that will optimise their decision-making.
This greenfield role will require you to work with the CFO to report back on key business questions and automate key financial reports transitioning from manual reporting for the FP&A team.
In the long term you will have the opportunity to step into a strategic role.




Requirements:

Strong track record (2+ years) in a Data analytics or BI role using Power BI for reporting and creating clear and automated dashboards.
Experience working on finance data or closely with the FP&A team using NetSuite is highly beneficial.
Exceptional stakeholder management experience, having worked closely with executives previously.
Experience in a small to medium business that’s fast-growing or private equity environment is preferred.
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a relevant field.




If you are interested in this role or know someone who would be a good fit please contact Harriet Lander at harriet.lander@finatal.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Durham | Utilities | £35,000 - £43,000




Peaple Talent have partnered exclusively with a leading Utilities provider, who are at the forefront of providing innovative and sustainable utility solutions. They are committed to optimizing resource management, ensuring high-quality service, and driving impactful data-driven decisions. Join the dynamic team and contribute to their mission of making utilities smarter and more efficient.




Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join the team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, with specific experience using Power BI to drive business insights and decision-making. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing complex data sets, creating visually compelling reports, and providing actionable insights to support our strategic goals.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Gather requirements, design solutions and work with stakeholders on their delivery.
Act as business partner for Data Analytics to other teams as required.
Provide regular project/progress reports and resource plans.




Experience needed:

SQL, Advanced Excel.
Advanced skills using Power BI,
Knowledge of SSRS or other BI/Reporting tools.
Organised and reliable with attention to detail.
Bonus points for experience in Development of data models and warehouses.




What We Offer:

💰Salary: £35,000-£43,000

📈Opportunities for professional growth and development.

🤝A collaborative and innovative work environment.

♻️The chance to make a meaningful impact in the utilities industry.

🪙10% matched Pension

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive insightful decision-making? Do you excel in presenting visually compelling dashboards and creating user-friendly data applications? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!




Join a growing team at a leading provider of management services. Our client is dedicated to leveraging technology to enhance client experiences and drive business growth. With a commitment to innovation, they are currently harnessing the power of PowerBI and custom-built data solutions to provide valuable insights to their clients.




As a Data Analyst, the successful candidate will be responsible for delivering impactful insights through visually engaging dashboards and building accessible data applications. They will collaborate closely with the data team to extract, analyse, and visualise data from various sources, including the Dynamics system and SQL Server. The role requires strong communication skills as they will present these solutions to clients, helping them understand trends, identify opportunities, and make informed decisions.




Key Responsibilities:




Create visually appealing dashboards using PowerBI to present insights derived from multiple data sources.
Develop and maintain user-friendly data applications that allow business users to access and analyse data independently.
Design and manage databases using SQL Server to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval.
Analyse data trends and patterns to identify key insights and opportunities for clients.
Collaborate with the data team to ensure accurate and timely data extraction and analysis.
Present dashboards and data applications to clients in a clear, concise, and engaging manner, fostering productive discussions and driving action.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in data visualisation, database management, and application development.




Requirements:




Proficiency in PowerBI and creating interactive dashboards.
Experience with SQL Server for database design, management, and querying.
Experience with developing data applications using tools such as Microsoft Access, low-code/no-code platforms (e.g., Microsoft PowerApps), or basic programming languages (e.g., Python, VBA).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to distil technical information into understandable insights.
Experience working with Dynamics or similar CRM systems is a plus.
A proactive and collaborative approach to problem-solving.




Why Join?




Opportunity to work with user-friendly data tools and drive innovation in the property management industry.
Collaborative and supportive work environment where ideas and contributions are valued.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Convenient location in Birmingham City Centre, with flexible working hours (three days per week in office).

Title: Graduate Investment Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for 2024 graduates to join one of the most interesting and exciting investment managers in their London office for summer 2024. This is an amazing opportunity to kickstart your career in an organisation which has an inclusive culture where the contributions of all our people are recognised and valued.




At the heart of the firm's mission is the responsibility to safeguard and grow investors' capital. In alignment with investor expectations, they are dedicated to cultivating a culture that upholds the principles of diversity, equity and inclusion, alongside delivering financial returns




The Data Analytics and Business Solutions team is tasked with the capture, validation, manipulation and analysis of various investment-related datasets in order to deliver effective insights, reports, completion of targeted cross-functional projects to improve efficiency and reduce operational risk, implementation of solutions to business process challenges and provision of insights to assist with decision making. As such, candidates will gain broad exposure to various functions, teams and senior personnel including those within Investment Management, Operations, Valuation, Risk, Technology and Client Services/Reporting.




Key Responsibilities:




Management of investment attribution data.
Management of pricing feeds and validation
Development of processes to improve efficiency and reduce operational risk.
Ensuring data requirements of internal and external stakeholders (incl. recurring reports) are completed
Management of cash data and reconciliation for cash forecasting exercises.
Projection of future returns for each investment within the companies portfolios on a monthly basis.
Execution of portfolio analytics and the utilization of in-house aggregation tools to generate analytical reports.
Communication of monthly portfolio projection results to senior management and clients through monthly newsletters and bespoke reports.
Address ad-hoc portfolio-related analytical requests from investors and senior management.
Collaboration with the internal tech team in targeted cross-functional projects, offering exposure to different teams and enhancing business efficiency.




Requirements:




Drive and passion to build a career in investment management
Strong numerical degree from a reputable university.
Good IT skills, especially in Excel
Some experience with programming languages such as Python, R, and C# is beneficial but not mandatory.
Ability to work efficiently under pressure, delivering accurate results within strict deadlines.
Strong team mindset and excellent collaboration skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Product Analyst

£60,000

London (1 or 2 days p/w)




I've partnered with a business intelligence business that work in the Legal sector. They are looking for a Data Analyst, who will sit within the Product function, to help drive their digital and web analytics capability.




The business are working on multiple projects to build out new Data products, this person will play a critical role in the build of these products and the efficiency of the overall Data capability.




This role has a Google suite focus (BigQuery, GA and Google Tag Manager). GTM and tagging experience is vital to succeed in this role.

Optimise end-to-end tracking & insight gathering
