Be the SME for Digital Analytics in the Product and Data team

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a Hybrid role 3 days a week onsite




Purpose

The Data Analyst is responsible for turning large and complex data sets into meaningful insights that drive business decisions. The role requires a combination of technical and communication skills to effectively analyse, interpret and visualise data to uncover insights and support business decision-making.




Responsibilities




Collect and analyse large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and other data visualisation tools to provide stakeholders with easy-to-understand insights.
the management of Power BI assets, including reports, dashboards, workspaces, and the underlying datasets that are used in the reports and dashboard
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions to support their use cases.
Develop and maintain predictive models to support forecasting and decision-making.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to support specific business initiatives and projects.
Stay up-to-date with new technologies and trends in the data analytics field and recommend improvements to client’s data analysis processes.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, using both written and verbal communication.




Skills Required




Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with data analysis tools such as Excel, Tableau, and PowerBI.
Experience with data processing technologies such as Apache Spark and Apache Flink.
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and experience with programming languages such as Python, R, and SAS.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Passion for staying up-to-date with new technologies and trends in the data analytics field.
Willingness to travel around the UK, across the Port Estates as required for specific projects and generally




Desirable

Experience working in Port /Supply Chain or Logistics industry

Title: Data Analyst - Paid Display
Description:
Company Description

Wise is a global technology company, building the best way to move and manage the world’s money. Min fees. Max ease. Full speed.

Whether people and businesses are sending money to another country, spending abroad, or making and receiving international payments, Wise is on a mission to make their life easier and save them money.

As part of our team, you will be helping us create an entirely new network for the world's money. For everyone, everywhere. More about our mission.

Job Description

We are looking for a Performance Marketing Analyst to support the Paid Display marketing team! As part of our Marketing Analytics team, you will be embedded within the Paid Display team.

Your mission will be to proactively contribute with the channel optimisation and growth through data driven insights and to be responsible for the analytical requirements of the team.

Here’s How You’ll Be Contributing


You will own the paid display data pipelines and analytical domains, improving them as needed.
You will provide actionable insights to inform paid display decisions, from identifying strengths and areas for improvement.
You will provide analytical insights and findings that help the team to optimise their campaigns.
You will propose and execute incrementality tests to measure the real value of paid display campaigns. Additionally, you will collaborate with Paid Display managers to support and validate their testing ideas.
You will help the team improve the marketing message segmentation strategy.
You will maintain and create reports and dashboards to equip the team with the data they need for decision making.
You will contribute defining impactful OKRs to work throughout the quarter.


This Role Will Give You The Opportunity To


Be part of our mission to make money without borders!
Contribute to the growth of the company by enhancing the effectiveness of marketing efforts.
Collaborate with diverse teams such as marketing, analytics, data science and engineering.
Continue learning and developing in areas such as data analysis, performance tracking and marketing measurement.


Qualifications


You have experience with value based bidding, lookalike optimisation, targeting and creative optimisation.
You have advanced SQL skills
Python/R skills are advantageous.
You are able to demonstrate that you can tell a story with data and proactively give guidance on strategy based on insights.
You are familiar with tracking, attribution and MMP data.
You have experience with marketing measurement tools and are familiar with common methodologies.
You are familiar with in-platform tests.
You have experience with data visualisation tools (Looker, Superset, etc.).
You have worked with marketing teams and/or external marketing partners and can manage senior stakeholders.


Additional Information

For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive.

We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.

Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.

If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.

Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Cambridge

£150 per day (inside IR35)

My client is undertaking a programme of work with the objective of developing a clear picture of how they operate through the collation of reliable and consistent data about certain subject areas

More accurate and reliable asset information, that is stored and managed digitally, will deliver a range of beneﬁts to ensure they are compliant.




The Data Analyst role is being created to support the Programme Manager to deliver the programme in different phases by taking information from spreadsheets of data into a collated building view of assets, analysing this data and producing outputs for on-site verifications. The role is expected to include the following:

Importing data from various sources into Excel
Removing duplicate records
Handling missing or erroneous data
Standardising data formats
Filtering and sorting data
Creating calculated columns using formulas
Pivot tables for aggregating and summarizing data
Creating pivot tables and pivot charts to analyze data from different perspectives
Combining data from multiple sources using functions like VLOOKUP, INDEX MATCH, and Power Query
Merging and consolidating datasets
Implementing data validation rules to ensure data integrity
Exporting Excel data to other formats (e.g., CSV, PDF)
Collaborating with team members on shared workbooks using Excel Online or SharePoint
Tracking changes and managing version control
Creating documentation for data sources, transformations, and analysis procedures
Adding comments and annotations to Excel files

  • Pivot tables for aggregating and summarizing data
  • Creating pivot tables and pivot charts to analyze data from different perspectives
  • Combining data from multiple sources using functions like VLOOKUP, INDEX MATCH, and Power Query
  • Merging and consolidating datasets
  • Implementing data validation rules to ensure data integrity
  • Exporting Excel data to other formats (e.g., CSV, PDF)
  • Collaborating with team members on shared workbooks using Excel Online or SharePoint
  • Tracking changes and managing version control
  • Creating documentation for data sources, transformations, and analysis procedures
  • Adding comments and annotations to Excel files

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Aviation




Hampshire Based

Onsite during induction period, then 1 day onsite / 4 days WFH.




Are you a data whiz with a passion for aviation? Ready to soar to new heights in your career?




Our client, a leading aviation company specialising in the distribution of consumable and expendable aero parts, is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their purchasing team and spearhead data-driven decision-making in the aviation sector.




Why Join Us?

Innovative Environment: Work with cutting-edge technology and data models in a forward-thinking company.
Impactful Role: Your insights will directly influence strategic business decisions and operational efficiency.
Career Growth: Endless opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Flexible Working: Enjoy the freedom of remote working after initial training at their HQ in Hampshire.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyse large datasets from multiple sources within the aviation industry.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and visualisations to uncover hidden insights.
Identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and create eye-catching reports and dashboards to monitor them.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and provide data-driven recommendations.
Stay ahead of the curve with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis and aviation technology.




What We’re Looking For:

Experience: Proven experience as a Data Analyst in the aviation industry or a related field.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, or SAS.
Analytical Mindset: Strong problem-solving skills with a sharp attention to detail.
Communication: Excellent ability to present complex information clearly and concisely.




Salary:

Competitive, subject to experience




Working Hours:

Monday – Friday, 37.5 hours




Additional Perks:

Flexible Working: Remote work options available post-training
Professional Development: Access to exciting training and development programs




If you're ready to take your career to new heights and make an impact in the aviation industry, our client would love to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst - SQL and Python
Description:
At Radius, we provide best in class fleet and connectivity solutions to businesses of all sizes.




Our mission is to help businesses adapt to the future by building solutions for a more sustainable, connected future.




Our comprehensive portfolio of solutions includes fuel cards, telematics, telecoms, insurance, vehicle leasing, EV charging, business energy, and expense management.




We are proud to have over 400,000 customers worldwide, over 50 offices across 5 continents, and over 2,800 talented Radius colleagues.




Technology and data underpin everything we do and have a big part to play in our ongoing growth plans.




This is where you come in…




The role…




We’re looking for a Data Analyst with SQL and Python experience to join our Group Data Science team.




The Data Science team’s main goal is to provide valuable insights to positively impact key business challenges like improving sales conversion, customer churn, etc. These insights are delivered by developing predictive models and analytical solutions while collaborating with business stakeholders.




The role will report to the Head of Group Data Science and will be primarily located at the group’s head office in Crewe.




Your responsibilities will include…




Work with the data scientists and other data analysts to provide insights that aid strategic decision-making for sales, marketing, and account management functions.
Analyse customer and prospect touchpoints on Salesforce CRM and 1st party tools to identify trends that could help tackle key business challenges.
Help deliver targeted Sales and Marketing campaign data on Salesforce CRM through CRUD operations via API.
Work on a diverse range of initiatives for all of Radius’ business units - Fuel, Telematics, Telecoms, Insurance, Vehicle solutions, EV, and Energy.




What do we expect of you?




Minimum 1 year commercial experience working with Python and SQL for Data Analysis.
Passion for driving business impact through data and insights.
Good knowledge of Statistics and Applied Mathematics
Ability to communicate findings through presentations and dashboards.
Good organisation and time-management skills




What can you expect of us?




Your impact on Radius will be rewarded with the opportunity to develop and progress your career in many directions.




You’ll also have access to our competitive reward and benefits package, which includes:




Performance-related bonus scheme
Pension
Life assurance
Employee fuel card scheme
Electric Vehicle scheme
Employee assistance programme
Wellness and healthcare assistance via ‘Help@Hand’ by Unum
‘Cycle to work’ scheme
Free breakfast daily in the office




And of course, you will be part of a modern purpose-built space in Crewe that will provide you with an outstanding working environment complete with onsite gym, café, games areas, and more!




Still curious?




If you feel we are a good match for each other, you can apply online now!




If you’d like to understand more about the role or life at Radius before applying, then please contact our talent team via talent@radius.com.




Radius is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to welcome people regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation or socioeconomic background.







Note to Recruitment Agencies

We do not accept unsolicited agency CVs or candidate profiles. Any unsolicited CV or profile received by Radius will be treated as a gift and not eligible for an agency fee. PSL agencies should only send CVs if authorised to do so by the Radius talent team.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Initially a 6 months contract (Outside IR35, up to £420 per day)

Hybrid (1-2 days in client's office in Hindlip, Worcestershire)




We are currently partnered with a public sector client focused on developing new capabilities to align with their strategic vision of maturing their data function and migrating.




They are looking for a 'Data Analyst' with strong understanding of SQL analysis, data modelling, remediation plans; someone, who can identify data feeds and master records, and work with external partners to identify processes for correction on relevant systems.




Knowledge and Experience:

SQL analysis – writing scripts to identify and profile data, as well as to move data as part of a data migration
PowerBI for analysis/visualisation preferable
Data modelling – need to map data structures
Stakeholder management/engagement for internal and external stakeholders. Defining processes and requirements (in conjunction with the Business Analyst)
Identify and map all data feeds into the warehouse (ETL jobs, direct application updates, etc.)
Profile data volumetric, then measuring and quantifying data issues.
Propose remediation plan for records identified as missing / inaccurate in one or other system.
Execute remediation plan post governance and approval




It is essential that you have been part of a team responsible for data migration and highly desirable that you have worked across government administration or public sector. Also, having previously been SC cleared or currently having an SC clearance would be beneficial.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Hereford, England, United Kingdom

Type: Permanent

Working Pattern: Hybrid working ( 3days onsite)




Who Are we?




MandM is one of the biggest employers in Herefordshire and one of Europe’s leading online, off-price retailers, selling branded Fashion, Sport & Outdoor products for Men, Women and Children.

We offer our customers fantastic value by partnering with companies who we have built long term relationships with, enabling us to offer our customers big household names and up-and-coming brands, giving fantastic value all year round.




We are located in the heart of Hereford City Centre in our brand new, state of the art office. The modern, stylish workspace was designed to encourage collaborative working, teamwork and creativity - everything that MandM is all about.




As our business continues to grow we are recruiting for a talented Data Analyst to join our growing team.




Why not come be a part of our journey to success and take advantage of all MandM can offer you!




More than a role




✨ Competitive Salary: Your talent deserves recognition

🏆 Company bonus: We succeed, you benefit

🚀 Career Growth: Opportunity to grow

🎁 Staff Discounts: Stay stylish with our exclusive discounts.

🏦 Company Pension: Secure your financial future.

🏖️ Generous Holiday Allowance: Enjoy 5 weeks of well-deserved breaks. You even have the option to buy an extra week

🎁 Birthday Delight: Take your special day off to celebrate YOU

🚗 Free Parking

💊 Health & Wellbeing programme; we’ll look after you




The Role Scope




✨Role key responsibilities




Maintain a suite of business reports using Excel, Google Analytics, SQL and Looker (spanning financial, web analytics, customer, warehouse and product KPIs).
Perform ad-hoc project analysis and decision support across a wide variety of business projects spanning Marketing, IT, Operations and Finance.
Maintain and optimise the structure of stored data to enable timely, accurate and automated business reporting.
Be an expert on our data – continually search for valuable insights within the information that we store and pass these findings on to key stakeholders.
Promote the use of data across the organisation, helping make smarter, data-driven decisions.
Work alongside other members of the data analytics team sharing and adopting ideas and best practice.
Proactively and continuously improve processes, systems and documentation.




About You




✨Skill/competency




A passion for data, you will love turning large, transactional datasets into meaningful commercial insights to solve pressing business challenges.
SQL and/or Python experience
Robust analytical skills – able to spot trends and explain findings to a non-analytical audience.
Intermediate excel skills (lookups, pivots).
Experience with Google Analytics and data stored in databases would be advantageous.
A naturally inquisitive, self-starter with an eye for detail.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including presentation skills.
Excellent organisational, problem-solving, project management and communication skills.
The ability to work to deadlines and be flexible to deal with changing business demands.
An understanding of online retailing and the key KPIs that an online business needs to measure would be advantageous




About Us




At MandM, our employees are driven by a shared commitment to excellence and making a real impact in the industry. We pride ourselves on upholding these core values in everything we do.




The people

✨Integrity

✨Teamwork

✨Accountability

✨Entrepreneurial approach

Show more

Title: Graduate Insight Analyst
Description:
Introduction

In this role, you will be working in our B2C function working primarily in the acquisition insights team. This is an excellent opportunity to join a multidisciplinary team of supportive and highly collaborative insights specialists, data scientists and engineers.

You will work across a multitude of projects ranging from supporting monthly reporting, working with senior analysts to deliver insights projects and help analyse test results. You will be part of a team who delivers tangible difference and whose work impacts day to day decision making at The Economist.

We are looking for a candidate who is curious, looking to learn new skills and with an aptitude for insight. Experience working with analytics data or other large data sets using SQL or other languages is advantageous but not essential and candidates looking to develop their technical skills are also welcomed.

Accountabilities


Working closely with senior analysts and other members of the team to deliver insights work to product and marketing stakeholders.
Supporting the team across a variety of different tasks ranging from reporting, to deep dive insights projects and testing.
Collaborating across disciplines by helping to provide technical requirements to data engineers and business analysts.
Become an expert in how The Economist acquires new subscribers and how we can optimise our channels and platforms.
Proactively look for interesting insights and new opportunities.


Experience, Skills And Professional Attributes


Ability to examine data critically to extract meaningful insights
Ability to communicate findings clearly to non-technical colleagues
Experience working with datasets
Some familiarity with analytics systems
A proactive approach to problem solving


The following would also be advantageous but not required:


Experience using SQL for data analysis
Experience working in a digital subscription or online retail business

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.

ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.

ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UK’s leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketing Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on campaign performance; supporting the marketing and CRM teams to run experiments to improve UX and monetization, and building analytics to support the leadership team in developing the overall strategy.

What you will be doing:


Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
Work closely with our marketing teams across acquisition or retention (CRM) to help them understand the benefit of our marketing activity
Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve our campaigns and user experience
Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals


Skills We'd Love You To Have


You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload
You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
Strong quantitative and numerical skills


Why ClearScore?

ClearScore is the UK's #1 credit score and report app. We are also present in South Africa, Australia and Canada, with more than 18 million users globally and growing fast. Someone joins ClearScore every 20 seconds. We have established relationships with over 50 of the main lenders in the U.K., and have been a trusted tool for customers to manage their credit and make better financial decisions.

Since October 2016 we have helped 1.8 million users take out a new credit card or loan. We are user-centric at our core and we believe in leveraging technology to enable positive financial choices. We are design-led and data-driven and we embed these behaviours in everything we do.

Our company culture is a fundamental part of all we have achieved. We believe in hiring smart, driven, passionate and diverse people who are keen on having a real impact in our organisation. We trust you to manage your own time so we offer flexible work and no fixed desk hours. We don't micromanage and we believe in measuring outcomes rather than effort. We have an inclusive culture where all, regardless of seniority, are encouraged to contribute with their ideas, look after their wellbeing and actively seek opportunities for career growth.

If you feel like this could be the place for you, apply and our Talent team will be happy to share more.

Benefits:


25 paid holidays and a “duvet day” on your birthday
Hybrid Work Environment: flexible work-life balance allowing you to thrive both in the office and from the comfort of your own space.
Private health and dental cover
GP office visits
Life assurance scheme
Up to 6% matched pension
Brown bags with guest speakers
Dog-friendly office
Daily breakfast and free snacks
Free sports and social clubs
Generous training allowance
Fast progression
Leadership-led training
Regular well-being events
In-house psychotherapist
Financial coach to help you plan and achieve your goals
Physical and mental health support through BUPA
No clock-watching culture
Generous maternity and paternity plans
Culture and inclusion representatives
Transparent pay structure and a career growth plan


Inclusion Policy

We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.

Title: Junior Insights Analyst
Description:
XCM are looking to hire a Junior Insight Analyst to join our ever growing Team. We are looking for someone that works well under pressure, is a fantastic problem solver, knows when its time to reach out for help and if you happen to be a SQL and Big Data Superstar that would be great also!




Primary Purpose

Support the lead analysts and client team in a dual role that strives to be a first go to place for quick answers to analytical, campaign or data queries.
To deliver first class analysis measuring client customer performance of online and offline campaigns, alongside helping understand key client trends in a quick turnaround role.
To ensure the delivery of key insights for all clients including BAU, projects and planned analytics on their roadmap as requested by the client team or the analytics team
Communicating findings to our clients or client team in a visually impactful way with a focus on actionable insight and ROI

Key Responsibilities

Working closely with the Lead Analysts and Client Team to drive ROI for our clients by providing fast turnarounds on small to middle size analytics/Campaign related jobs
Analysing data through a range of marketing tools to serve the needs of each client by analysing; including but not limited to, customer sales and their purchasing behaviour, web traffic and user behaviour, email performance, direct mail performance, SMS performance and social media trends
Measure ROI of online and offline campaigns through all platforms available (being a strong user of everything)
Report on marketing KPIs like leads, conversion rates, website traffic and social media engagement
Track email campaign metrics (delivery, open, click-through rates)
Supporting the CRM team on campaign optimisation recommendations and on occasion implementation
Produce analytical recommendations and deliver presentations demonstrating the value and the insight the work has delivered
Deliver BAU analysis and reporting within an agreed schedule
Confidently present analytics and recommendations both to colleagues and clients
Assist on larger, complex statistical projects to produce strategic actionable recommendations
Respond to ad-hoc data requests raised by the client team with confidence and pace, utilizing all platforms available including but not limited to Horizon Analytics, Faststats, ESP’s, GA and other campaign platforms.
Delivery of WIP reports to agreed standard
Provide commitment to leadership and continuous improvement
Delivery of your agreed objectives
Management of your personal development programme
Delivery of agreed standards & discipline
Management of your quarterly appraisal process & documentation




Attributes

Ability to explain and present basic statistical terms to non-technical marketers
Curious, inquisitive, proactive, organized, and methodical and have a passion for problem solving
Demonstrate the ambition and determination to succeed
Enthusiastic and self-motivated, with the ability to manage multiple requests from the client team alongside analytical workload




Salary & Benefits




Salary £25-30K Per Annum

Private Healthcare, Company Pension & Death in Service

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
About the job



My client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their data team. This role will be pivotal in modeling data and constructing their internal data platform for the first time. Key responsibilities include using dbt to transform data into accurate and dynamic models for business insights and reporting. Additionally, the Data Analyst will assist in the entire data process, from digestion to visualization.



Role Requirements


Collaborate with data scientists to design, evaluate, and monitor the performance of models and algorithms.
Work with data scientists, data engineers, and backend developers to address client and user challenges.
Ensure accurate data collection in partnership with data engineers.
Enhance customer understanding to provide tailored solutions.
Conduct end-to-end data analysis, from data cleaning to insight extraction.
Demonstrate value to prospective clients by expanding on existing tools and techniques.
Develop innovative methods to showcase key analysis from complex data sets.
Drive product and business strategy through analytical findings.


Required Skills


2/3+ years of experience as a data analyst.
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
Proficiency in Python (especially Pandas) and SQL.
Solid understanding of statistical methods.
Experience with visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Superset, etc.
Basic understanding of machine learning and a keen interest in further learning.
Knowledge of data ethics.
Ability to present analysis and insights to diverse audiences.
Strong work ethic and a thirst for knowledge.


Desired Skills


Basic understanding of machine learning and a keen interest in further learning.
Fluency in statistics.
Good understanding of computer science concepts.
Domain knowledge or experience in the Financial Services industry or Fintech companies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

LONDON

HYBRID - 4 DAYS IN THE OFFICE A WEEK

UP TO £50K




This role cannot sponsor




THE COMPANY

A real estate company focused utilises data for investment in property, and development of the market managing purpose-built assets focused in the Pan Europe market




THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

In this role you will be responsible for gathering data from the investment and real estate teams, analysing it, and providing advice on areas of growth in investment real estate




In this role you will be:

Collecting, cleaning, and analysing data to help develop visually appealing dashboards in Power BI and Tableau
Collaborating with the real estate and investment team to help identify areas of growth for the company to help optimise their performance
Utilising statistical methods to help solve business problems
Ensuring data accuracy and integrity by implementing best practices




YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

They are looking for someone who comes from a statistical background in either the real estate or investment analytics industry




Please apply if:

Proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau
Proven experience in either investment analytics or real estate data
Ability to collaborate cross-functionally with non-technical and technical people
Proven ability to work autonomously and manage your own projects end-to-end
Full right to work in the UK




HOW TO APPLY

Please do so via the website

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Scientist




Location: London 🌆




Remuneration: Hourly rate £35.58 💸




Contract Details: Temporary, until 28th February 2025 ⌛




Working Pattern: Full Time (Hybrid Model) ⏰




Are you a talented Marketing Data Scientist looking for an exciting opportunity in the thriving tech industry? Our client, a leading organisation in the tech sector, is seeking a motivated and skilled individual to join their EMEA Marketing team as a Marketing Data Scientist. 📈




Responsibilities:

Manage the workload of a large project or multiple projects to maximise impact and refine timelines in collaboration with stakeholders.
Exercise sound judgement in weighing input against anticipated impact and adapt to changes as needed.
Identify issues for defined problems, navigate unexpected complexity, and propose analytical and technical solutions.
Effectively frame and escalate issues to be addressed by managers and stakeholders.
Serve as a trusted partner within the team and with cross-functional teams, providing guidance and managing relationships with partners, agencies, or TVCs.
Contribute to shared team responsibilities and the broader analyst community, such as conducting interviews or presenting analysis findings.
Utilise expertise in data extraction and manipulation, dashboarding/visualisation, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and research techniques to drive insights and solutions.
Develop strategies to drive incremental growth by addressing complex business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders across various functions.
Conduct market research and data analysis to influence business decisions, optimise performance, and deliver best-in-class execution.
Champion an inclusive culture, creating a supportive environment, role-modelling inclusive behaviour, and driving diversity change initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis support to senior leaders for specific data requests.




Skills/Experience/Education:

Strong knowledge of business operations and driving efficiency and effectiveness within organisations.
Excellent consultative skills to understand stakeholder needs and provide tailored analysis and recommendations.
Proficiency in dashboarding to link, report, and analyse metrics based on available data.
Ability to convert real-world business problems into trackable metrics and generate meaningful insights from data analysis.
Familiarity with experimental design principles and best practises.
Good understanding of the tech industry landscape, including key players and technology trends.
Experience in marketing analysis and applying analytical methods to generate actionable insights.
Project management skills and ability to plan and execute projects effectively.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods to evaluate data adequacy and draw inferences.
Strong storytelling and presentation skills to communicate data-driven insights in an engaging manner.
Technical acumen and eagerness to learn and apply statistical and mathematical concepts.




Our client offers excellent perks, including hybrid working arrangements, pension contribution matching, employee discounts, and comprehensive well-being support. 🌟




If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategies and make an impact in the tech industry, we would love to hear from you. Join our client's innovative team in London, and be a part of shaping the future of EMEA Marketing. Apply now! ✨




Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.💼




Adecco is a disability-confident employer. It is important to us that we run an inclusive and accessible recruitment process to support candidates of all backgrounds and all abilities to apply. Adecco is committed to building a supportive environment for you to explore the next steps in your career. If you require reasonable adjustments at any stage, please let us know and we will be happy to support you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🌟 Data Insight Analyst at top Lloyd's market Insurer🌟




Excellent Salary + Bonus + 31 days holiday + Excellent Benefits

Hybrid working: London Office (2/3 days a week in the office)




Are you passionate about data analysis, visualization, and driving business insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic, innovative environment? Look no further! Our Lloyds Market Insurer customer is seeking a talented and creative Data Insights Analyst to work directly with teams across the business to deliver the information they need.




This is an organization at the forefront of cutting-edge data services, capturing, transforming, and analyzing diverse data through their modern cloud-based platform, generating invaluable insights for their business. Now needing a Data Analyst to take this to the next level!




As the successful Data Insights Analyst you will need:




Essential skills:

Power BI report development (including DAX).
Transact SQL and Python/Scala scripting.
Stakeholder management and requirements capture.
General analytical and modeling techniques.
Data visualization and dashboard design.




Desirable:

Understanding of Lloyd’s Insurance market data.
Experience with Agile processes.
Data quality management expertise.
Familiarity with modern data processing technologies (data lakes, warehouses, reporting tools).
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure data and analytics tools (including Azure Databricks).




Role Highlights:

Hands-On Impact: Dive into data, collaborating directly with cross-functional teams to deliver critical information.
Analytical Skills: Design repeatable reports and create ad-hoc analyses to drive data-driven decisions.
Team Collaboration: Work closely with business teams, bringing their ideas back to the data team.
Continuous Learning: Explore new skills and innovative ways to analyze and visualize data.




Responsibilities:

Understand data requirements from colleagues across the business
Prioritize work within the Data Insights team.
Contribute to Agile project delivery.
Develop reporting and visualization solutions.
Collaborate on data engineering and architecture requirements.
Uphold data standards and governance.
Coach colleagues in data analysis self-service.
Monitor data quality and raise awareness of best practices.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and your application will be reviewed swiftly.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. This role will focus on developing reports in Power BI and Excel using SAP Hana S/4 and the Microsoft Fabric framework, including Power Automate. You will be hands-on in data analysis, and data visualisation, contributing to the data-driven decision-making processes. As a data analyst you will also be the gatekeeper of SAP engineering Master Data, creation and modification. Being a Tier 1 automotive supplier, good time management, understanding priorities and deadlines is essential.




Key Responsibilities:




Data Extraction and Cleansing: Perform data cleansing by removing duplicates, correcting formatting, and ensuring data accuracy.
Data Analysis: Analysis using Power Query language and Mashup for data manipulation and deeper analysis.
Data Visualisation and Reporting: Develop and maintain performance dashboards, infographics, reports, tables, graphs, and charts in Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint. Integrate data from SAP Hana S/4 using the Microsoft Fabric framework to enhance reporting capabilities.
Automation and Efficiency: Implement Power Automate workflows to automate repetitive tasks and improve efficiency in data handling and reporting.
Recommendations and Decision-Making: Analyse data to draw conclusions and make informed recommendations to key stakeholders, present findings through presentations, emails, and meetings.
Collaboration: Work with all departments, to establish reporting needs.
Creation, modification and housekeeping of the ERP Master Data for Engineering: Parts, BOM’s Routing, Logistics etc.
Assisting with the ‘Day to Day’ IT HelpDesk Requests.
Willingness to learn and support SAP Hana S/4 Modules.
Anything else the business requires.







Experience & Qualifications:




Strong passion for Data Analysis, and an eye for detail.

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Experience and/or qualifications within data analysis.

Effective communication skills for presenting data and solutions.

Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.

ERP Systems / Database Knowledge – SAP Hana S/4 or Similar.

A high proficient level in the use of Microsoft packages including Power BI, PowerAutomate, Excel, e.g. Power Query, complexed formulae etc.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - £30K-£40K - Cumbria - Hybrid




My client is looking for a Data Analyst to work with the large and complex datasets associated with their financial comparison products. The role has a broad remit encompassing analysis, interpretation, and prediction. The Data Analyst will also bring statistical rigor to their product teams’ efforts as they continuously enhance comparison products.




Role




Dive into complex datasets and extract actionable insights, e.g.
Identify customer segments across our comparison services where no or very few quotes are provided.
Analyse the conversion funnel data to improve the click to sale conversion to make recommendations on segments that are being poorly served, and
Utilize multiway statistical techniques to identify trends and correlations.
Facilitate discussions with the wider business to gain insight into pain points, problems and opportunities where analysis could help us with these either for business or for our partners/customers.
Support AB/MVT test plans and assessing results independently.
Assist with new provider due diligence and performance issue investigations.
Use of analytics tools/applications to undertake multi factor analysis to generate robust, accurate analysis to inform decision making.
Pro-actively work with stakeholders and colleagues to find ways for continuous evolution and improvement of the use of data/insight, to ensure solutions are best in class, and that value is continually generated from the data asset.
Create clear and concise reports and visualizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.




Skills




Proven experience as a Data Analyst, handling large datasets and performing statistical analysis.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Qlik).
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with Python, R or similar for data analysis.
Experience in filtering and cleaning complex datasets to provide actionable insights.
Experience working within the Financial Technology industry will be helpful.




Benefits




27 days holiday plus public holidays
Performance rated bonus
Enhanced pension
Generous private medical care
Sickness and insurance benefits
Share schemes.




If this sounds like your next role, apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Campfire is an award-winning Social first digital agency, founded on the values of Honesty & Integrity, First Principle Thinking, and Exceeding Expectations. Holding some of the world’s leading brands on our client roster, we pride ourselves on innovating and creating performance-driving firsts for our clients.

As social translators, it’s our job to take a client’s message and translate it into the perfect campaign and content for the platforms they’ll live on.

We believe in meritocracy. If you want to work for an agency that will invest in you and your career, Campfire is the right place for those willing to step up and deliver as part of the team and for our clients. With quarterly PDPs rather than annual, your career can move as quickly as you do.

As a progressive agency, our teams enjoy a number of benefits including (but not limited to) hybrid working, flexi-time, wellness days/benefits, and birthdays off.

Job Summary:

As Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in overseeing our data warehousing transition to BigQuery and extracting valuable insights from our data. You will be responsible for ensuring the successful migration of our data systems and using your expertise in SQL, data visualization, and analytics to develop comprehensive reporting dashboards. Your role will be key in providing data-driven insights.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Strategy and Warehouse Transition:
Lead the comms with our supporting agency on the strategic transition of data warehousing from Google Sheets to BigQuery.
Develop a comprehensive plan for data migration, ensuring minimal disruption to ongoing operations.
BigQuery Database Management:
Establish, optimize, and maintain BigQuery databases with our supporting agency.
Ensure database security, integrity, and scalability to support growing data needs with our supporting agency.
Advanced Dashboard Creation:
Design and implement sophisticated dashboards for internal reporting on key metrics such as revenue, margins, and cost-income analysis.
Develop campaign-specific dashboards to provide insights on influencer, paid media, and organic social performance.
Data Visualization and Reporting:
Utilize advanced data visualization techniques to present complex data in an accessible format.
Create and automate regular reports for internal stakeholders and clients, providing actionable insights.
Cross-Departmental Collaboration:
Work closely with various teams to understand their data needs and integrate these into the overall data strategy.
Provide data-driven recommendations to support decision-making across the company.
Innovation and Continuous Improvement:
Stay abreast of the latest trends and developments in data analytics and visualization.
Continually seek opportunities to enhance data processing, analysis, and reporting capabilities.

Qualifications:


Proven expertise in SQL and data visualization.
Strong analytical and logical skills, akin to an analytics engineer.
Experience with BigQuery or similar data warehousing solutions.
Demonstrated ability in building and maintaining data dashboards.
Ability to collaborate effectively with senior leadership to turn business needs into data solutions.
Forward-thinking, with a talent for process improvement.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


This position offers a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of data transformation at Campfire, providing strategic insights that shape our decision-making and client strategies. Your role will be a blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and visionary leadership, crucial for our continued success in the ever-evolving digital marketing landscape.
Show more

As social translators, it’s our job to take a client’s message and translate it into the perfect campaign and content for the platforms they’ll live on.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Join Netcompany in leveraging technological innovations to foster societal transformation.

Netcompany was awarded 5th position on the esteemed UK Top 50 Best Places to Work in the Glassdoor Employees Choice Awards for 2024. As one of the fastest growing technology companies, we are disrupting the marketplace and revolutionizing the way businesses operate. Our vision is to be the leading digital challenger in Europe whilst evolving the next generation of IT consulting.

Operating across both public and private sectors, we offer a comprehensive range of services from product design and engineering, digital strategy, data services & management (Machine Learning and AI), cloud migration to program delivery and service operations, our offerings are designed to meet diverse business needs.

Job Description

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our growing team, as part of the role you will collaborate with the team to identify, implement, and validate the most suitable tools, (i.e. Kibana, Grafana, Splunk, Google Analytics) and translating business needs into actionable metrics.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis of specification, data profiling, measurements and improvements
Creating and maintaining Data Visualisations (Defining Architecture, Implementation, Training and Support, Monitoring and Tuning)
Presenting data in compelling, clear and actionable stories
Leading and facilitating workshops for stakeholders
Developingperformance management framework including defining KPIs and ensuring these are measurable
Working collaboratively alongside agile delivery teams
Producing regular performance reports and dashboards that drives stakeholder decision-making


Qualifications


Experience with presenting analysis and visualisations tocommunicate complex messages
Providingtactical and strategic recommendations to inform wider decisions whilstapplying innovative approaches to resolve problems
Programming skills for data and analytics using SQL
Experience with designing / building complex reports/dashboards using Power BI/Tableau/Qlik/SAS
Experience with various tools including Kibana Grafana, Splunk Google Analytics
Good influencing,stakeholder management and communication skills
Deep understanding of the technical concepts required and understand how they fit into the wider technical landscape.
Experience working within an agile development team.


Additional Information

Benefits Include


Hybrid working model with some flexible working
25days holiday
Private Medical Health care via Vitality
Pension contribution, Life Assurance
Professional certifications supported as part of learning and development.
A range of retail discounts to enhance your lifestyle, encompassing restaurants, supermarkets, travel, leisure activities and health and well-being services.
Access to our Employee Resource Groups, our groups represent diverse backgrounds and provide a platform for colleagues to connect, learn, and support one another.


Company Information

We pride ourselves on our entrepreneurial spirit and our capacity for doing things differently. Our culture is built on fostering low bureaucracy, emphasizing high agility and promoting flexibility, enabling everyone to contribute their best.

Our journey began in the UK with the acquisition of Hunter Macdonald in 2017. As one of Northern Europe's most accomplished IT companies, we have expanded our headcount globally to 7400+ employees and have offices in UK, Denmark, Norway, Poland, Holland and Vietnam.

We are a Disability Confident Employer and are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment that celebrates every individual. Our recruitment processes are based on individual merit. If you require any reasonable adjustments or additional support during the interview process, please email HR Teamfor assistance.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Us

We’re an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we’ve been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world’s leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.




In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen’s Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.




Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.




We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!




We are DataOps advocates and use software engineering best practices to build scalable and re-usable data solutions to help clients use their data to gain insights, drive decisions and deliver business value. Clients don’t engage BJSS to do the straightforward things, they ask us to help on their biggest challenges which means we get to work with a wide range of tools and technologies and there are always new things to learn.




About the Role

BJSS data engineers are specialist software engineers that build, optimise and maintain data applications, systems and services. This role combines the discipline of software engineering with the knowledge and experience of building data solutions in order to deliver business value.




As a BJSS data engineer you’ll help our clients deploy data pipelines and processes in a production-safe manner, using the latest technologies and with a DataOps culture.




You’ll work in a fast moving, agile environment, within multi-disciplinary teams of highly skilled consultants, delivering modern data platforms into large organisations.




You can expect to get involved in variety of projects in the cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP), learning about and using data services such as Databricks, Data Factory, Synapse, Kafka, Redshift, Glue, Athena, BigQuery, S3, Cloud Data Fusion etc.




About You

You're an engineer at heart and enjoy the challenge of building reliable, efficient data applications systems, services and platforms.
You have a good understanding of coding best practices and design patterns and experience with code and data versioning, dependency management, code quality and optimisation, error handling, logging, monitoring, validation and alerting.
You have experience in writing well tested object-oriented Python.
You have experience with using CI/CD tooling to analyse, build, test and deploy your code.
You have a good understanding of design choices for data storage and data processing, with a particular focus on cloud data services.
You have experience in using parallel computing to process large datasets and to optimise computationally intensive tasks.
You have experience in programmatically deploying, scheduling and monitoring components in a workflow.
You have experience in writing complex queries against relational and non-relational data stores.




Some of the Perks

Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
Flexible holiday buy/sell option
Electric vehicle scheme
Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O’Reilly
Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
We have a busy social calendar that you can chose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
GymFlex gym membership programme
Show more

Title: Senior Data Governance Analyst
Description:
TransUnion's Job Applicant Privacy Notice

What We'll Bring

TransUnion is a major credit reference agency, and we offer specialist services in fraud, identity and risk management, automated decisioning and demographics. We support organisations across a variety of sectors including finance, retail, telecommunications, utilities, gaming, government and insurance.

What You'll Bring

The Senior Data Governance Analyst is responsible for supporting the delivery of the Data Management and Governance Framework and practices using their specialist knowledge and expertise.

Day To Day You’ll Be


Supporting and improving compliance with data governance, data quality, data protection policies and standards
Ensuring new and existing product and data assets are well managed in accordance with the above and reporting on compliance
Maintaining the data asset catalogue
Maintaining and maturing the Data Ownership Framework. Proactively engaging Data Owners, Data Stewards and Data Users to ensure they are adequately supported and trained in their roles
Collaborating closely with Data Privacy and Data Quality teams
Contributing heavily to building the new data lineage and business glossary, liaising with project areas and utilising expertise from SMEs across the business
Supporting the resolution of data issues and incidents. Collaborating with stakeholders, liaising with Global Issue Management, Compliance and Data Issue Response teams, and reporting/escalating to relevant committees
Reporting on risks, issues and performance to the Data Quality and Governance Manager
Engaging with TU Data Governance teams across the global business (e.g. in Spain, US, Canada) to promote alignment and share best practice
Supporting the personal development of the (junior) Data Governance Analyst.


Essential Skills & Experience


Knowledge and understanding of data management and governance concepts and best practice
Knowledge and understanding of the GDPR, as well as other relevant legislation and regulations
Understanding of data quality concepts and how to measure data quality
Understanding of data cataloguing and data lineage
Ability to work and oversee a network of Data Stewards to meet the data governance requirements
Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact with a variety of technical and non-technical business stakeholders
Ability to articulate a business issue without resorting to technical language
Organisation and time management skills, including working to deadlines with multiple deliverables
Analytical and problem-solving capabilities.


Impact You'll Make

What’s In It For you?

At TransUnion you will be joining a friendly, forward thinking global business.

Benefits

As well as an excellent salary and bonus scheme or commission scheme (if joining our sales teams) our benefits package comes with:


26 days’ annual leave + bank holidays (increasing with service)
Global paid wellness days off + a bonus day off to celebrate your birthday
A generous contributory pension scheme + access to the TransUnion Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Private health care + a variety of physical, mental and financial fitness wellbeing programmes such as access to mindfulness tools
Access to our diversity forums and communities so you can get involved in causes close to your heart


TransUnion – a Place To Grow

If there’s something on the list of essential / desirable skills that you can’t quite tick off, don’t let that put you off applying. We are open to exploring training and development opportunities for the right candidate to ensure you are successful.

We know imposter syndrome is real, lets confront it so we can continue to grow and thrive together

Flexibility At TU

We recognise that our people need the freedom to balance their day-to-day lives with their work. This is why we’ve set out to create inclusive and flexible policies and practices for you to accommodate all your responsibilities and needs: children, family and beyond. If the role is advertised as full time, don’t let this stop you from applying. Let us know if you’re looking for a part time or flexible working arrangement and we can discuss this with you.

Additional Support

At TransUnion, we’re committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where all individual’s talents and perspectives are valued. When you apply for a position with us, you’re not just joining a team, you’re becoming part of a community that celebrates differences and embraces equality. We understand that everyone has different needs, which is why we offer a range of reasonable adjustments to our recruitment process. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to help you through the application process or to attend an interview with us by contacting ukrecruitment@transunion.com

Interview & Hiring Process

Most of our recruitment processes are virtual, so you’ll get to know our hiring managers and teams over the phone and through video. If we need you to attend a physical in person interview your recruiter will inform you of this.

We do not accept any unsolicited CV’s from recruitment agencies.  If you are a recruitment agency on our PSL our talent team will contact you directly should we require any assistance.

 ,

Find Out More About Life At TU UK

https://twitter.com/TransUnionUK

https://www.linkedin.com/company/transunion/life/

This is a hybrid position and involves regular performance of job responsibilities virtually as well as in-person at an assigned TU office location for a minimum of two days a week.

TransUnion Job Title

Sr Analyst, Data Governance

Title: Data Governance Analyst - Hybrid Bradford - £60,000
Description:
Data Governance Analyst - Bradford 3 Days a Week - £60,000

Location: Bradford

Schedule: 3 days a week in office - 2 days working from home.

Salary: Up to £60,000

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Governance Analyst to join our client who specialise Automotive Finance based in Bradford. As the Data Governance Lead, you will be responsible for developing and implementing data governance strategies, policies, and procedures to ensure the integrity, quality, and security of our organization's data assets.

A big part of this position will be Data Consolidation.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and implement data governance frameworks and policies
Define data quality standards and ensure compliance
Establish data governance processes and procedures
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data governance initiatives
Monitor and report on data governance metrics and KPIs
Provide guidance and training on data governance best practices


Qualifications


Proven experience in data governance, data quality management, and data security
Strong understanding of data governance principles and best practices
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment


If you are a data governance expert looking for a great opportunity in Bradford and meet the qualifications outlined above, we encourage you to apply for this position. Join our team and help us drive data governance excellence in our organization. Apply now! Or email lauren.hamer@oliverjames.com
Show more

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
To Apply for this Job Click Here

CUSTOMER ANALYST

REMOTE-FIRST (London HQ)

Up to £45,000 + benefits

This is a fantastic opportunity for a Customer Analyst to join this leading retailer focusing on loyalty and best customer offerings through data-driven solutions!

The Company

This is a well-known retailer group in the homeware space, catering for all their customer needs. With both in-store and online offerings, they are currently going through a digital transformation, and they are looking for a Customer Data Analyst to work on a range of customer analytics projects, immediately getting to add value to the company!

The Role

As a Customer Analyst, you can expect to:


Work daily with SQL to conduct deep-dive analysis into customer behaviour and trends.
Work on customer segmentation to create better customer profiles
Utilise these segments in order to have the best customer contact strategy for personalised campaigns
Create a clear customer view, understanding key metrics like retention, lifetime value and loyalty
Communicate data insights in simpler terms with the wider business, as well as manage relations with stakeholders


Your Skills And Experience

As a Customer Analyst, you will be expected to:


Have prior experience in a commercial role covering similar things to the responsibilities listed above
Have experience working with very large customer data sets
Have excellent technical skills in SQL for data extraction, manipulation and analysis
Have a solid understanding of customer analytics, across segmentation, LTV, churn, loyalty, acquisition, retention, etc.
Be confident in communication with people to tell stories with data and present information clearly


Salary And Benefits


Up to £45,000 base salary DOE
Wider benefits like bonus scheme, pension and staff discount
Remote-first policy for candidates based further afield - head to either the London or Southampton offices once a month/quarter
Excellent retailer name for the CV, as well as great experience working in a successful company that's just scratching the surface of their capability - what a time to join!


How To Apply

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Alanah Chambers via the Apply link on this page.

This role not the one for you? I have roles across Marketing & Customer Insight all over the north and midlands of England, so please do look at the other roles I'm covering to find your perfect next step!

Segmentation, personalisation, customer analytics, customer insight, customer behaviour, lifetime value, churn analysis, loyalty, acquisition, retention, marketing, campaigns, customer targeting, customer contact

To Apply for this Job Click Here

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Governance Analyst looking to lead our data transformation?

Do you have the expertise of taking a business on a journey to maturing its data landscape?

Are you looking for an opportunity offering growth and progression as we grow our data function?




This is a newly created role where you will be at the forefront of our data journey. Collaborating closely with our Digital & Change Service team as we define and shape our data landscape, documenting every step of our journey towards maturity. Your expertise will be invaluable as we navigate this transformative phase to meet our evolving needs.




You will lead the way in data integration laying the groundwork for our systems to operate harmoniously throughout our maturity journey. You will have a keen eye for detail and embrace the challenge of turning initial ambiguity into clear and concise data definitions, models and plans.




Your role

You'll collaborate with Subject Matter Experts to dive deep into our data sources and transformations, crafting comprehensive documentation that serves as our roadmap to success. With your expertise, you'll support Architecture in shaping transformation and integration activities, developing solutions that align with both technical and business requirements.




But it's not just about the technicalities your passion for promoting best practices and upholding data governance standards will be crucial. You'll develop data quality processes, monitoring adherence and proactively resolving any issues that may arise.




You'll be the driving force behind creating and maintaining integration documentation, ensuring smooth data flow across systems. Leveraging your data modelling skills, you'll design frameworks that empower our Change Delivery team to build and maintain end-to-end data solutions in line with our overarching data strategy.




About You

Experienced working with data catalogues, inventories, dictionaries; working on initiatives such as Master Data Management, Metadata Management, Data Quality; and working on application integration and migration projects.
Experience of working in a data governance function, contributing to policies & procedures, and working to improve an organisations data management capability.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with a proactive attitude and ability to collaborate effectively within teams to drive digital strategies forward.




Your benefits

If flexible working is important to you, then look no further! At Stepchange we are proud of our culture and our commitment to flexible working. This role is hybrid working 1 day per week in our Leeds city centre office.

You will also get an excellent benefits package including;-

24 days annual leave (this increases by one day per year up to a maximum of 5 additional days plus bank holidays & an additional day off for your birthday)
The opportunity to buy and sell annual leave
Group pension & Group Company Life Assurance
Westfield Health cash plan with employee discounts in high street shops
Vitality at Work health and wellbeing
Employee Assistance Programme




Please note:

This advert / role may close early if a suitable candidate is successful.




Our Data Governance Analyst is known internally as Data Analyst.




Equality, diversity, and inclusion

Equality, diversity, and inclusion are incredibly important to us; we have a culture of belonging. We’re always looking to increase the diversity of our workforce to ensure we can provide the best service possible for everyone. It’s not just about the professional experience you bring – we’re interested in who you are and your potential. If there’s an adjustment to our recruitment process that would help you to be your best, speak to our team and they’ll be happy to help.




Show more

Title: BI Engineer
Description:
Location: This role will be based in our Leeds, Manchester or London / Oxford offices.

About Us

Ridge is an award-winning multidisciplinary built environment consultancy, employing over 1100 people across 11 locations throughout the UK. Our vision is to help our clients to create better places for people to live, learn and work.

At Ridge, our people are the foundation of our success, and our greatest asset. They drive our vision and embody our values. Our people are what separate us from the competition and we never lose sight of this. We offer not just a job, but a journey. We believe in commitment, and the value of a stable, long-term career path. We challenge our people to be the best they can be and help them grow with training and support.

Due to the continued growth and associated success of Ridge, the Technology team is growing in capacity to meet demand & service across the company. We are looking for a talented and experienced BI Engineer to sit within the Ridge Technology team. You would join at an exciting time of growth in the wider company especially in the Technology team, where investment is being made to match the needs due to the success of the business.

About The Role

The Data and Analytics team at Ridge was formed 12 months ago to meet growing demand for professionally managed data. We’ve created solid foundations of data management by setting up our data architecture and delivering value and insight, and have established strong relationships across the business, building awareness and trust in data across Ridge.

We’re now at a stage where we want to bring in a BI Engineer to expand our capacity and build the future of our team. As the business grows in data maturity through our engagement, we’re being presented with increasing number of requests, and need to balance that with the need to review, redesign and improve the maturity of our data architecture. After completing our set-up work and delivering quick wins earlier in 2024, we need a BI Engineer to support our work in enabling us to both continue delivering valuable work and ensuring that the foundations of our output grow sustainably, matching the high expectations of data in the business we’ve established. Additionally, to support the delivery of this direction of travel, we’re investing in growing the team’s skills and experience; partly through bringing in a BI Engineer, but also with a consistent focus on offering professional development, opportunities, and freedom to take on responsibility. We recognise that Ridge’s success has come through supporting our great people, and this is reflected in our Data and Analytics team.

This position will have responsibility to be leading design of modelling data in the data warehouse as we grow our reporting and bring in new data sources, will involve taking responsibility for decision-making regarding SQL and modelling, and being the key contact for the business for our data pipelines.

Role And Responsibilities

What you need to do to be effective in this role


Experience with data warehouse modelling, designed to accommodate future growth
Competency to lead the development of schemas
Expanding our data warehouse, incorporating new data sources, and building in best-practice warehouse design
Working closely with the IT department to ensure that the data collection and storage are appropriate and suitable for BI purposes
Staging & shaping data from multiple data sources into reporting and analytical solutions and integrations
Creation of technical documentation, capturing development, processes & DW changes
Developing and maintaining analytics solutions and perform data analysis
Troubleshooting and resolving data-related problems
Collaborating with colleagues in the Data and Analytics team to deliver dashboard reports
Engaging with clients (usually but not limited to internal colleagues) to understand their needs, and designing and creating a suitable dashboard report
Identifying and suggesting improvements in delivery of BI to the company
Working with all internal departments to identify suitable metrics specific to their departmental operations and wider BI requests
Identifying new sources of data to be used to grow BI capability
Identifying new uses of existing data to provide insight to the company


Experience And Skills Required

The skills and experience you need to have for this role


Knowledge/experience of Data Warehouse schema design, data modelling & data warehouse systems (Snowflake preferable but not essential)
Strong working knowledge of SQL
Experience on data visualisation software preferable (Power BI preferable but not essential)
Practical experience in ELT processes & tools
Analytical with a creative mind and attention to detail
A good communicator, you listen carefully and use positive language to clearly present information, ideas and views, verbally, in writing and by using technology
Experience in interpreting data to draw out insights
Comfortable with independent work, and collaborating within the team
Good communication with non-technical stakeholders to understand what is required and discuss technical work in an understandable way
You work effectively with others by being co-operative, inclusive, supportive and understanding towards your colleagues and other stakeholders


What’s in it for you:

Our people are our business – our vision is to be ever progressive, expanding our expertise and nurturing our talent through Quality, Innovation & Growth, to achieve our strategic outcomes.

Your reward is focused on your total wellbeing, with a package to support all aspects of life. In addition to your salary, you can expect:


A healthy holiday balance of 25 days, plus bank holidays & the ability to buy / sell to suit you
3 days a year to give your time to others, volunteering for great causes
An inclusive wellbeing offer:
Financial – Life Assurance, Pension Scheme (3% Employee, 6% Employer), Income Protection, Salary Sacrifice Car Scheme, flexible choice of Critical Illness Insurance
Physical – Free Private Medical Insurance, Doctor at Hand Private GP, Best Doctors, flexible choice of Dental Plan, Cycle to Work Scheme, GymFlex & Healthcare Cash Plan
Mental – Mental Health First Aiders, Help@Hand by Unum
Car allowance
A flexible approach to hybrid working, to suit both you & your team
Tailored career development – focused on professional, personal and/or educational

We believe that everyone performs their best when they feel like they belong and can be their true selves at work. As an equal opportunities’ employer, we will support you to ensure you have everything you need to be successful and achieve your best in your career at Ridge. If you’d like to discuss accessibility, accommodations or adjustments during your application & selection process, please contact us at workwithus@ridge.co.uk and we will work with you to ensure you feel included and supported.

What’s in it for you:

Our people are our business – our vision is to be ever progressive, expanding our expertise and nurturing our talent through Quality, Innovation & Growth, to achieve our strategic outcomes.

Your reward is focused on your total wellbeing, with a package to support all aspects of life. In addition to your salary, you can expect:

  • A healthy holiday balance of 25 days, plus bank holidays & the ability to buy / sell to suit you
  • 3 days a year to give your time to others, volunteering for great causes
  • An inclusive wellbeing offer:
    • Financial – Life Assurance, Pension Scheme (3% Employee, 6% Employer), Income Protection, Salary Sacrifice Car Scheme, flexible choice of Critical Illness Insurance
    • Physical – Free Private Medical Insurance, Doctor at Hand Private GP, Best Doctors, flexible choice of Dental Plan, Cycle to Work Scheme, GymFlex & Healthcare Cash Plan

  • Tailored career development – focused on professional, personal and/or educational
We believe that everyone performs their best when they feel like they belong and can be their true selves at work.
